loans.name: Almira

texts.en: Almira is a married woman who lives in Bantayan, Cebu. She earns her living by raising hogs, buying and selling rope, and with a veterinarian business. Her husband, Ricardo, age 44, works as a fisherman. They have four children who are between 11 and 21 years old. Almira joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, and by the sweat of her brow, Almira has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 6,500 PHP, improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing 29,500 PHP, which she intends to use to buy medicines and vaccines for her hogs and paraphernalia so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Almira is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase medicines and vaccines for the pigs

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad M. is from the village of Sampagar, Damulog, Bukidnon. She is 47 years old. Felicidad is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Felicidad owns & operates a business raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Felicidad has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Felicidad joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felicidad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. 

Felicidad is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used again to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Felicidad from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Rosenie

texts.en:
Rosenie J. is a 24-year-old mother who dreams for the betterment of her family. She is from Villar, Sibalom, Antique, Philippines.  She is married to Orlee J. and they are blessed with two children: Gwen Ashley – five years old, and Steven – two years old.

In order to provide for their family's basic needs, they work very hard to earn an income. Rosenie is engaged in hog fattening while her husband works as a driver and a fish vendor.  With their limited income, Rosenie tries to budget for her family's needs, repay her loans, and also keep a little savings for their future needs.  She has started personal savings through the initiative of ASHI.
 
She joined ASHI in 2010 and has fortunately already fully repaid her first loan.  She is requesting PHP 9000.00 for her second loan. This amount will be used for her piggery project.  These projects really help them address the big and unexpected expenses for their family.

Rosenie's greatest dreams are to give her children the right education and to have their own house and lot.  If she has access to a bigger loan in the future, she wants to open up a variety store to earn extra income.

loans.use: To use for pig farm

Currently, Sam B. wants to plant a potato crop, but she has no funds to do it. To solve this problem, Sam B. will use her loan to plant a potato crop.

loans.name: Rachelle

texts.en:
Rachelle is a married woman who lives in Pulupandan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a business selling fish and seafood.  Her husband Rafael D. Jr., who is 33 years old, works as a fish vendor to earn income.  He also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 2 children who are 7 months and 5 years old. 

Rachelle joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rachelle has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 6th loan, she is borrowing PHP 13000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save for the future education of her children. 

Rachelle is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Luis Leonardo

texts.es:
Luis tiene 70 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su familia en un sector urbano marginal del distrito de José Leonardo O., uno de los distritos más poblados de la región, se caracteriza por tener a la mayor parte de su población situada en zonas marginales. Es conocido por su abundante movimiento comercial y de transporte.

Se dedica desde hace varios años a la comercialización de carne en el sector minorista del mercado Moshoqueque (el centro de abasto más grande de la región), el adquiere su mercadería en los principales distribuidores de la zona y la ofrece en venta durante todo el día. Su buen trato y carisma le han servido para contar actualmente con una clientela estable que siempre acude a su negocio para solicitar los productos que necesita.

Luis se vale de los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad para sacar adelante a su familia y solventar su economía diaria. Actualmente desea adquirir más carne a su proveedor para poder aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias. Para lograr su meta ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Luis is 70 years old and married.  He lives with his family in a marginalized urban area in the José Leonardo O. district.  It is one of the most heavily populated districts in the region.  It is noted for having most of its population living in marginalized zone.  It is known for its abundant commercial movement and for transportation.

For several years Luis has been selling meat in the retail section of the Moshoqueque market (the biggest centralized supply center in the region).  He gets his merchandise from the main distributors in the zone.  He sells throughout the whole day.  His good service and charisma have served him well.  He currently has a stable customer base, and his customers always frequent his business to request the products that they need.

Luis uses the income that he gets from this business activity to get his family ahead and to pay for the daily expenses.

He now wants to get more meat from his provider in order to be able to increase his sales and get more income.  In order to achieve his objective he believes it is advisable to request a loan for 1,000 from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell

loans.name: Analie

texts.en: Analie is 45 years old, married and supporting her family by fishing and selling fish. She lives in Pulupandan, Negros Occidental. Analie has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Analie is borrowing 13,000 PHP so that she can fund operations. This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 12,000 PHP (which she paid off well within its term) was just another step on her journey toward economic freedom. Analie hopes to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. loans.name: María Fidelina

texts.es:
María Fidelina tiene 52 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su familia en el distrito agrícola D. TambogranD., una zona D. clima semitropical que se caracteriza principalmente por producir frutas como el mango y el limón, pertenece a la provincia D. Piura y se encuentra ubicado a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con un pequeño establecimiento en su domicilio en donD. ofrece en venta artículos D. oficina y productos D. belleza. El negocio cuenta con bastante acogida debido a la calidad D. atención que brinda y al tiempo que tiene trabajando en el rubro. Esta actividad le permite ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento D. su economía diaria.

María desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más mercadería D. modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda que con la que cuenta actualmente, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
María Fidelina is 52 years old and married.  She lives with her family in the agricultural district of TambogranD..  This zone has a semitropical climate, and is mainly known for producing fruits like mangos and lemons.  It belongs to the Piura province, which is over four hours from the city of Chiclayo.

She has a small establishment in her home where she sells office products and beauty products.  The business is well-received due to the quality of service she provides and the amount of time she has been working in this field.  This business activity allows her to help her family with the daily finances.

María wishes to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise to be able to satisfy her current demand.  In order to do this, she has seen the necessity of requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 soles, which will help her achieve her objective.

loans.use: To get more merchandise to expand her business

Her previous loan of 7,500 PHP (which she paid off well within its term) was just another step on her journey toward economic freedom. loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva tiene 52 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su familia en el distrito agrícola D. TambogranD., una zona D. clima semitropical que se caracteriza principalmente por producir frutas como el mango y el limón, pertenece a la provincia D. Piura y se encuentra ubicado a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta D. animales menores: ella cría cerdos, ovejas y aves domésticas en unos ambientes situados cerca a su domicilio, una vez que estos alcanzan un buen nivel D. desarrollo las ofrece en venta en el mercado D. su localidad. El negocio le sirve para ayudar a su esposo, que es profesor, con el sostenimiento D. la economía diaria D. su familia.

Genoveva desea ampliar su negocio comprando más animales y alimento balanceado D. modo que sus animales se desarrollen D. mejor modo y puedan ser vendidos a un mejor precio. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Genoveva is 52 years old and married.  She lives with her family in the agricultural district of TambogranD.. This zone has a semitropical climate, and is mainly known for producing fruits like mangos and lemons. It belongs to the Piura province, and it is over four hours from the city of Chiclayo.

She raises and sells small animals.  She raises pigs, sheep, and poultry in some areas that are close to her home.  Once they have reached a good level of development, she offers them for sale in the local market.  The business serves to help her husband, a teacher, with the family’s daily finances.

Genoveva wishes to expand her business by purchasing more animals.  She also wants to buy balanced feed so that her animals develop in the best way and can be sold for a better price.  In order to achieve her objective, she believes it is advisable to request a loan of 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing more animals and balanced feed

loans.name: Djamiyla

texts.en:
Djamiyla A. is a 54-year-old farmer with three children. Her two daughters live on their own, and her youngest son lives with her and helps in breeding cattle. They started this business with the initial capital of 12,000 KGS and managed to earn about 8,000 KGS in a month. She works hard to develop her farm, and, for this reason, Djamiyla is applying for a loan of 40,000 KGS to purchase more livestock. Revenues from this loan will allow her to develop her business further and to improve her living conditions.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas, which leads to increased employment and meets the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Fermina

texts.es:
Fermina tiene 40 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su esposo y a su hijo menor en el distrito agrícola D. TambogranD., una zona D. clima semitropical que se caracteriza principalmente por producir frutas como el mango y el limón, pertenece a la provincia D. Piura y se encuentra ubicado a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio en donD. ofrece en venta a sus vecinos diversos productos D. uso diario, entre productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes, ella suele atender a sus clientes con mucho esmero y carisma, por ello actualmente cuenta con un grupo D. cliente fieles que prefieren comprar en su bodega. Os ingresos que percibe D. esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo, que es chofer, con el sostenimiento D. la economía D. su familia.

Fermina desea implementar su negocio con más productos D. modo que pueda ampliar sus ventas y satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar  a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Fermina is 40 years old.  She is married and lives together with her husband and child in the agricultural district of TambogranD., an area with a semi-tropical climate that is mainly noted for producing fruit such as mangos and lemons.  It is located in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Fermina has a small grocery store in her home where she offers her neighbors a range of essential household products, staples and groceries.  She serves her customers with a lot of care and charisma which means that she has a group of loyal customers who prefer to shop in her store.  Fermina uses the profits that she makes in her business to help her husband, who is a driver, to support their family financially.

Fermina would like to stock her business with more products so that she can expand her sales and meet the demand that she has.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing more merchandise

loans.name: Koch

texts.en: Koch C. is a 43-year-old married woman from Kompong Chhnang Province. To earn a living, Koch C. sells porridge in front of her house to her neighbors and to other villagers who need to have breakfast. Usually, Koch C. generates around 1.25 USD of profit per day to meet the needs of her family. She has other financial sources from her husband. He works as a building worker, earning an income of approximately 1.25 USD per day. They have five children. Four children are single, and the other one is married and lives away from home. Koch C. is taking out a loan to purchase a piece of farmland in a good location for farming, on which she will grow different kinds of crops. Note: Koch C. and her young child are pictured in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of farmland in a good location for farming

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Som K. is 56 years old. She lives with her husband and three of her children in Takeo Province. To earn a living, she has been running a butcher store at the local market. She earns approximately US $5.00 in profit each day. Her husband is a soldier who earns US $3.50 per day. One of her children is a garment factory worker and her other two are in school. 

Som K. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase pigs to sell at the market. 

Som K., who appears in the middle of the photograph, is pictured with her husband (on the left) and two of her children.

loans.use: To buy pigs to sell.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry A. is from the village of Mapuroc in San Mateo. He is 39 years old. Jerry is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jerry plants, harvests, and sells rice. Jerry has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Jerry joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jerry is requesting a loan of 19000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This will be Jerry's first loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Loeurng

texts.en:
Loeurng H., age 43, is married and lives with her husband and four of her children in Takeo Province. Since 2003, she has been weaving silk scarves to earn a living and is able to make about US $3.00 in profit every day. Her husband, Touch Nan, age 48, is a construction worker who builds houses. Two of their children are garment factory workers and two are in school. 

Loeurng H. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Soun

texts.en:
Soun S., age 41, is married and has three children living at home with her in Takeo Province. She runs a grocery store, typically making US $8.00 each day. Her husband, Say Kin, sells pigs and chickens and typically makes about US $12.00 each day. 

Soun S. would like a loan of US$1200 to expand her grocery store. She will also give some money to her husband so he can improve his business.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store.

loans.name: Kem

texts.en:
Kem R., 37, is married and lives with her three young children in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who works for less than $1 each day, while her husband works in construction, making $5 each day. 

The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Kem R. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase more construction tools.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools

loans.name: Burulbubu

texts.en:
Burulbubu B. is 56 years old and lives in Emgekchil village with her family. Her husband works as a keeper at the local school. She has nine children; four of them live with their own families while the other five live with Burulbubu and help their parents in farming. 

In 1970, with an initial capital investment of 8,000 KGS, Burulbubu's family began to breed livestock and cultivate land with wheat, barley and holy clover. They worked hard to develop the farm. Because of their hard work, Burulbubu qualified for her first loan from Bai Tushum, which was repaid without any delays. 

Burulbubu will use her loan of 70,000 KGS to broaden her business by buying one cow, one colt, and sheep. With the revenue, she plans to construct a barn for her cattle and hold her daughter’s wedding. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase a cow, a colt, and sheep

loans.name: Ken

texts.en:
Ken K., 43, is a widowed farmer who lives her two daughters. Living in the Takeo province, she typically makes $1 every day and is aided by her daughters, who work in a garment factory. 

Ken K. is asking for a loan of $1,200 to finish her construction and purchase fertilizer.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and finish construction

loans.name: Nob

texts.en: Nob P., 65, is married and lives in Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US $2 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians – Nob P. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US $750 to purchase fertilizer and cows. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and cows

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong S., 36, is married with three young children, living in Takeo province. She works in a grocery store, typically making US $3.50 each day and her husband raises pigs and chickens. Her husband, Som Saroeurn, typically makes about US $2.50 each day as a pig farmer. Kong S. would like a loan of US $500 to purchase more pigs to breed and also to purchase feed for the pigs.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs and feed for the pigs

loans.name: Horn

texts.en: The photograph shows Horn O. at work growing fruit O. her farm. Horn O. and her husband make their daily revenue by working as local farmers in the village. This couple has been married for a few years, but they have not had children yet. The family owns a medium-sized piece of farmland where they plant jackfruit, banana, and mango trees, and they always get a good result from their planting. In order to earn an extra profit, Horn O. wishes to buy a piece of land to grow more fruit crops in a larger amount than at the present time. This loan will provide her family with this additional asset.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land in order to grow more fruit crops

loans.name: Run

texts.en: Run L. was born in 1966 and has been married many years to Mr. Khoeun, age 46, who is a taxi driver. This couple has two school-aged kids. The kids help with the business when they are not studying. To earn a living, Run L. cooks and sells porridge to her neighbors for a profit. She starts selling her items in the morning and finishes in the afternoon. Presently, her house is in building process, and it is not finished yet because she lacks some materials to continue building. To deal with this problem, Run L. is asking for a loan to buy wood, cement, and other essential material for building her house.

loans.use: To buy wood, cement, and other essential material to build her house.

loans.name: Putri Mandiri Group

texts.en:
The group chose the name "Putri Mandiri" (Independent Women) in the hope that, one day, the members will not be dependent on their husbands. "Putri" means "woman" and "mandiri" means "independent." The Putri Mandiri Group has 14 members and is located in Melaya Bali. 

The group is led by Ni Ketut R., age 58, who is respected by the members. Ni Ketut R. has four children, all of whom are married. Ni Ketut R. is grateful that MUK trusts her group enough to give them a second loan. Like their previous loan, this loan will provide each member with Rp 1,500,000. 

Ni Ketut R. will use her portion of this second loan to buy more piglets. She will raise the pigs for five months and sell them in July.

loans.use: To buy more piglets

loans.name: Sabeela Hamid Raza's Group

texts.en:
Sabeela is the wife of H. R.. She lives in Khanewal, Pakistan, an area that is famous for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family for over 9 years.
 
She is 41 years old and runs a sewing business. She collects orders from her neighborhood clients and earns income after completing them on time. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband. 
 
She is expert in her work and can sew designer and non-designer dresses very easily. She learned these skills from her mother and they are now earning a good profit for her.
 
She is also a very good wife and mother who works full time in her household and takes care of her family. She is the mother of an only son who is 5 years old and has not yet started attending school.

Her husband is also involved in sewing. He is a tailor who is proficient in sewing men's clothes. His tailoring shop is located in the market and he is well known in his area for the quality of his work.

Sabeela has applied for a loan from Asasah, a Kiva field partner, to expand her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine which will help her to produce good quality work and to complete her orders on time to raise her income. She is very confident that her business will be improved with the help of an investment. 

She is a regular Asasah borrower and this is her second loan application. She paid the installments on her previous loan on time and never missed any meetings.
 
In the photo, Sabeela is the woman who is holding the group's Asasah passbook.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business

loans.name: Vannessa Paola

texts.es:
Vannessa D. 33 años, cría y venD. pollos desD. las 06h00 am que se levanta hasta las 21h00 pm, una D. sus actividades económicas es venderlos para conseguir el dinero y volverlos a reinvertir en mas pollos. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio ya que lleva muchos años con este negocio. 

Quiere continuar con su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo pollos y balanceado para poderle dar una mejor vida a su hijo ya que es madre soltera. En el futuro quiere terminar sus estudios y seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para que pueda ser reconocida  por sus ventas.
texts.en:
Vannessa, 33 years of age, raises and sells chickens from 6:00 am when she rises until 9:00 pm. One of her economic activities is to sell chickens to acquire money and then to invest in more chickens. She has great hopes for her enterprise since she has many years in the business.

Vannessa wants to continue with her business. For this reason, she wishes to use the loan to buy chickens and chicken feed in order to proviD. a better life for her son, since she is a single mother. In the future, she wants to finish her studies and continue investing in her business so that she can be recognized for her sales.

loans.use: BUYING CHICKENS AND CHICKEN FEED FOR HER BUSINESS

loans.name: Cheas

texts.en: Making baskets is a part of 52-year-old Cheas C.’s daily activities for earning an income. Cheas C. and her husband currently buy raw materials to make baskets to sell in her house. They also buy baskets from other weavers at a reasonable price and resell them to gain extra profits. They have done this since 1985. Cheas C. is an older mother who has four children. Two of her children are studying in the public school, while the other two are employed as garment workers. Now, Cheas C. is not comfortable for living because her house is getting old and it needs to repair. Because of lacking money, But Teav has decided to ask for a loan from Kiva to add her personal savings to buy woods for repairing her old house.

loans.use: To buy wood for repairing her old house.

loans.name: Janeth Paola

texts.es:
Janeth de 18 años es joven emprendedora que siempre le ha gustado tener su propia microempresa. En la actualidad ella vende productos Avon y Yanbal para poder tener dinero y comenzar con su microempresa. 

Escogió la actividad porque la mama vendía los productos de uso personal y ella quiso seguir el mismo trabajo para tener su propio dinero. Tiene  muchas aspiraciones para el futuro pero por ahora quiere comprar con el préstamo perfumes, cremas, desodorantes y otros productos de estas marcas ya que le dan a crédito al comprarla y asi puede reinvertir el dinero de su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Janeth is 18 years old and an enterprising young woman who has always wanted to have her own micro-enterprise. At present, she sells Avon and Yanbal products to earn money and to launch her micro-enterprise.

Janeth selected this activity because her mother sells personal use products and she wanted to continue in the same line of work to have her own money.  She has many aspirations for the future but for now, she wants to use this loan to buy perfumes, creams, deodorants, and other products of these brands, since she can obtain credit for buying them and then, she can reinvest her working capital.

loans.use: BUYING PERFUMES, CREAMS, AND DEODORANTS TO SELL

loans.name: Johana Teresa

texts.es:
Johana es una mujer emprendedora que con esfuerzo y dedicación ha alcanzado ser una microempresaria teniendo un negocio de venta de carne. 

Con la ayuda de su eposo y la buena administracion que le ha dado al negocio ahora ella puede comprar variedad de carnes para venderle a los clientes mas cercanos. Trabaja desde las 08h00am vendiendo carne de todo tipo hasta las 22h00pm. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con el negocio ya que quiere invertir mas dinero para tener un capital fijo y vender mas carne en su local. En el futuro quiere comprar congeladores para tener mas oportunidad de venta.
texts.en:
Johanna is an enterprising woman who, with an effort and dedication, has become a small business woman, owning a butcher shop. 

With her husband's help and through sound business administration she has developed her store to be in the position to purchase a variety of meats to sell to her closest neighbors. She works from 8am to 10pm, selling all kinds of meats. She has great plans for her business, wanting to invest more money in order to secure a steady capital savings and to sell more meat from her store. In the future she wants to purchase freezers to increase her sales opportunities.

loans.use: To purchase meat for resale.

loans.name: Shahla's Group

texts.en:
Shahla has applied for a loan for the second time from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business. She started this business 10 years ago because her husband’s income was not enough to fulfill the basic needs of the family. Now she is very much an expert in her work and receives a good number of orders every month from her neighboring clients.
 
She will use the loan money for purchasing a new sewing machine, which will help her complete orders on time and make more income. 

She is 28 years old and a confident person who is very much hopeful that an investment will bring more profits to her and she will be able to enroll her second daughter, who is now 7, in school in the near future.
 
She is the mother of three daughters; her eldest daughter is enrolled in the local school and is getting her education. Her husband's name is  A. A.; he works in a factory for a low income.  

She belongs to Khanewal, which is a small city of Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She owns a two-room brick house and lives in it with her family. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with the book called the Asasah Passbook is Shahla.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Berha Clemencia

texts.es:
Bertha de 60 años, tiene una tienda con mercadería muy surtida en la parte delantera de su casa. Ya que le ha dado una buena administración al negocio ha tenido la oportunidad de brindar los servicios de venta de viveres en el sector donde vive. 

Tiene muchas aspiración con su negocio por eso se levanta desde las 07h30 a atender los clientes hasta las 23h00pm para cerrar el local. Quiere continuar con su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa para surtirlo con otro estilo de mercadería y algunos viveres. En el futuro quiere continuar con su tienda para asegurar su vejez.
texts.en:
Berthan is 60 years old and she has a well-stocked general store located in the front section of her house. Through sound business administration she has had the opportunity to have a grocery store in the neighborhood where she lives. 

She has great plans for her store, which is the reason why she starts work at 7:30am and she closes the shop at 11pm.

She wants to keep up with her business and with the loan she wants to purchase clothing in a different style and some grocery items. She wants to keep her store in the future to secure her old age.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Yolanda Zobeida

texts.es:
Yolanda de 54 años, es una mujer emprendedora que tiene un negocio de venta de almuerzos. Antes de comenzar con el negocio ella vendia artículos pero decidió comenzar con el negocio de venta de almuerzos para tener mas ingresos. 

En la actualidad vende cada almuerzo a $ 1.50 el cual contiene sopa, segundo, jugo. Trabaja desde las 08h00am preparando la comida hasta aproximadamente las 14h00 que es la hora donde se le acaba la comida. Ella quiere continuar con su negocio porque le gusta mucho servir a la gente por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo mesas, arroz, carnes. En el futuro quiere tener un local grande para vender a un mayor volumen.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 54 years old and she is an enterprising woman who owns a restaurant serving lunch. Before she started her business she used to sell merchandise items but she decided on a restaurant to improve her earnings. 

She sells each lunch for $1.50, consisting of soup, an entree, and juice. She starts work at 8am to prepare the meals until about 2pm when the food sells out. She wants to keep up with her business because she greatly enjoys serving others. She wants to purchase tables, rice, and meats. In the future she wants to have a large restaurant in order to sell in greater quantities.

loans.use: To purchase tables, rice, and meats.

loans.name: Lucy Belen

texts.es:
Lucy de 34 años, tiene un negocio de venta de bollos (comida típica en las playas de Ecuador contiene plátanos y pescado).  Empezo el negocio con una herencia familiar ya que a los 16 años aprendió como preparar este platoo típico. 

Continúo con el negocio y lo convirtió en su negocio económico hasta ahora que tarabaj vendiendo bollos a un valor de $ 1.00 cada uno. Trabaja sola aunque en ocasiones le ayuda la hermana a realizar los bollos ya que hay que rayar mucho el platano para que quede en su punto y cocinarlo.  Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar con su negocio comprando con el préstamo cemento y materiales de construcción para mejorar el local donde los vende.
texts.en:
Lucy, age 34, has a bollos sales business (bollos are a typical food on the beaches of Ecuador, containing bananas and seafood). She started this  business from a family inheritance since she learned how to prepare this typical dish at the age of 16.

She continued with this business and converted it into her main source of income. She sells bollos at $1.00 each. She works alone, although her sister helps her to make the bollos since it is necessary to cut up the banana quite a bit so that it will be the proper shape before cooking it. She has many dreams for her business, so she wants to continue with her business. She will use this loan to buy cement and construction materials to improve the store where she sells the bollos.

loans.use: cement, sand, blocks

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en: Ruby P. is from the village of Old Kibawe, Kibawe, Bukidnon. She is 33 years old. Ruby is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Ruby runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, beverages and toothpaste. Ruby has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Ruby joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruby has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Ruby is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like snack foods and canned goods. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Ruby from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like snack foods and canned goods

loans.name: Narcisa Natividad

texts.es:
Narcisa de 49 años, comenzó con un negocio de teléfonos monederos poco a poco con el dinero que le ingresaba ella comenzó ahorra hasta que pudo tener sus propias centrales de teléfono en un local para alquilar las llamadas. 

En la actualidad tiene su negocio de servicio telefónico que lo realiza sola desde las 08h00am hasta que termina su jornada de trabajo a las 22h00pm. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar con el comprando con el préstamo cemento, bloques y arena para darle una mejor adecuación al local y asi sus clientes se sientan muy contentos de ir a llamar. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y tener un cyber.
texts.en:
Narcisa is 49 years old. She started her coin phone business slowly with the money she made. She started saving until she was able to have her own telephones to charge for calls. 

Currently she has a telephone service business where she works from 8:00 am until she finishes her workday at 10:00 pm. She has many aspirations for her business which is why she wants to use the loan to keep buying cement, blocks and sand to better adapt the store front so that her customers will be excited about making calls there. In the future she wants to finish building her house and provide internet service.

loans.use: Purchase cement and blocks.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph M. is from the village of Omonay, Damulog, Bukidnon. He is 39 years old. Joseph is married and has a child. To make a living, Joseph runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste. He is also raising and selling pigs. Joseph has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Joseph joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joseph has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Joseph is requesting a new loan of 21,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods and snack foods, and as working capital. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Joseph from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods and as working capital

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.en:
Yuryi is a married father with a 6-year-old child. Yuryi makes and sells ceremonial items in his hometown. He has been in this business for seven years. His turnover capital is about 30,000 Grivnas and his net profit exceeds 5,000 Grivnas a month. One of the specific characteristics of his business is a high turnaround of inventory.

Yuryi is very focused and determined. He is grateful for the previous micro-loans he has received, which have helped the expansion of his business. This time, Yuryi is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnas to purchase equipment as well as additional raw materials to manufacture funeral wreaths, e.g. fake flowers, wire and ribbons. The loan will be beneficial for Yuryi’s business by keeping it competitive and promoting further growth so it will continue to provide necessary income for his family.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and materials to manufacture funeral wreaths

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en: Romeo L. is from the village of Lampanusan, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. He is 54 years old. Romeo is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Romeo operates a manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling wood products to local businesses and community members. He also offers chainsaw services. Romeo has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2010, Romeo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Romeo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase tools and other equipment to expand the business. Romeo is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase wood products and as additional working capital. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Romeo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase wood products and as additional working capital

loans.name: Arlen

texts.en: Arlen D. is from the village of Lampanusan, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 53 years old. Arlen is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Arlen runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily-use products such as snack foods, biscuits and beverages. She also makes and sells snacks like rice and cheese cakes. Arlen has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Arlen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Arlen is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like beverages and snack foods. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Arlen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Yulia

texts.en:
Yulia is married and has two small children. She sells women's clothing at the Tsentralniy department store in Novaya Kahovka. Her working capital is 30,000 Hryvnias and her monthly income is about 6,000 Hryvnias.

Yulia started this business six years ago because her family was in need. She began selling clothing and really liked it. Eventually, she was able to rent some space at the department store. Since that time, her business has been even better. Today it is a stable additional source of income for her growing family.

Yulia would like to borrow 20,000 Hryvnias to increase the assortment of her inventory. She hopes to increase her sales and to receive additional income.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of her inventory

loans.name: Piranock

texts.en:
Piranock is 32 years old. She is married with five children aged 2 to 15. She lives in a rented house in Hioma, Uganda, with a family goal of educating her children to the degree level.

She has a retail shop and has been running it for five years. She started it by selling charcoal and then saved to start the shop. She has a challenge of the lack of enough capital, and in the future, she wishes to have a wholesale shop. Piranock needs the loan to buy sugar, soap and cooking oil for selling.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, soap and cooking oil for selling

loans.name: Yasmeen Monis Raza's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen lives in a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, called Khanewal, which is known for its agricultural industry. She owns a three-roomed brick house there and has been living in it with her family for over ten years. She is a seamstress who sews clothes to support her husband financially. Her customers are her neighbors.
Yasmeen is 40 years old and has been married to M. R., a mason by profession, for 18 years. She is the mother of three sons. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting an education.
Yasmeen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine, which will help her finish her orders in a shorter period of time as well as produce high quality work. She is hopeful that an investment will bring her better profits and enable her to provide a better education to her children as a result. Yasmeen is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In her previous loan year, she established good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah Passbook) is Yasmeen.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Las Estrellas Group

texts.es:
Eliberto de Jesus A. es un comerciante 27 a;os de edad, casado, con tres hijos, y reside en el barrio Guanacaste en el municipio de La union, Olancho. Eliberto es integrante del grupo solidario Las Estrellas y funge como coordinador del mismo. Desde hace un a;o Eliberto inicio con el negocio de venta de abarroteria en un peque;o espacio de su domicilio. Su esposa le de terminar con los quehaceres del hogar lo ayuda a atender a los clientes. Su horario de trabajo es de lunes a domingo desde las 6:00 am hasta las 7:00 pm. Una de sus ventajas es que en el barrio donde vive no hay otro negocio parecio al de El, es por eso que cuenta con la clientela total. 

Eliberto solicita el prestamo para surtir su pulperia de mas productos para asi poder ofrecer a sus clientes una gama de opciones. Con el apoyo del prestamo podra seguir teniendo una entrada de dinero para sostener a su familia, ya que su negocio estara bien surtido. 

Su sue;o es tener un mini super y contar con los ingresos suficientes para educar a sus hijos y darles una mejor condicion de vida. Es su segundo ciclo en FAMA y ha demostrado responsabilidad en el pago de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Eliberto de Jesus A. is 27 years old and is a merchant. He is married, has three children and lives in the Guanacaste neighborhood in the municipality of La Union, Olancho. Eliberto is a member of the communal bank Las Estrellas and also serves as the bank's coordinator. A year ago Eliberto started his business selling groceries in a small space in his home. After she finishes her housework, his wife helps him serve the customers. His work schedule is Monday through Sunday, from 6:00 am until 7:00 pm. One of his advantages is that the neighborhood where he lives does not have a similar business which is why he counts with all the customers. 

Eliberto is requesting a loan to stock his grocery store with more products to be able to offer his customers a range of options. With the support from this loan he will be able to continue to have an income stream to support his family since his business will be well stocked. 

His dream is to have a small supermarket and have enough income to educate his children and to give them a better quality of life. This is his second loan cycle with field partner FAMA and he has shown that he is responsible in making his payments.

loans.use: Purchase groceries to stock his grocery store.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence F. is from the village of Lampanusan, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 36 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Florence owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods and toothpaste in the local community. Florence has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Florence joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Florence is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods and junk foods. This loan will be her fourth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell (e.g. canned goods and junk foods)

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 43 years old and married to Francis Kariuki, a mechanic who contributes to the family income. They have two children. She has been farming for the past 20 years with an income of about KES 8,000 per month.

This is her third loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous ones successfully. She intends to use the loan to buy fertilizer, seedlings and pesticides. She hopes to give her children a quality education and improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings and pesticides.

loans.name: Engracio

texts.en:
Engracio L. Jr. is from the village of Mapuroc, San Mateo. He is 41 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Engracio owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Engracio has been engaged in his business for over 23 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Engracio joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 21,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be his first from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Zulfiya Joldoshova's Group

texts.en:
Zulfiya J. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Tashkomur, a small mining town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 24, married and has a four-year-old daughter. Her husband earns money by reselling coal. In order to earn additional money, Zulfiya and her husband breed livestock. They started this activity four years ago with an initial investment of 1,000 KGS. Now, by reselling livestock after fattening the family earns 5,000 KGS per month. With this loan, Zulfiya wants to purchase home products and a gift for her daughter. In the future she dreams of building a big house.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase home products

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
Khem P. is a married woman who has always done housework as a daily routine. She is a good housewife and a good mother of six children. Her 
main activities include cooking  meals for all members the family as well as washing clothes, cleaning house, caring her kids, managing the property.

 Her husband is a fisherman, and earns a profit about $5 per day which is used to meet family expenses. This couple are blessed with six children, four of whom are single, and two are married. They have two children working  at the main factory and having a proper salary every month. Khem P. says that she has one child who wishes to go on and study at the university level but Khem P. has no cash to support him.  Khem P. would like to request a loan to be used to pay the school cost.

loans.use: To pay for school costs.

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana lives in a small city of Pakistan called Khanewal. Khanewal is located in Punjab, Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. Her house contains 2 rooms where she has been living for over 10 years with her family. 

She is 42 years old, married to I. H. and has 2 sons. Her elder son left school after the 8th grade and started a business, making and selling furniture. Now he is an expert in his work and doing this business on a full-time basis. Her youngest son is studying in the 8th grade.

Rukhsana’s husband manufactures sewing machines and she supports him financially by operating a boutique  business. She prepares different kinds of dresses such as simple, embroidered and dresses with stylish designs to display in her boutique and sell to her customers. She uses an area of her house to display her collection to her customers and earn income for the family.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her boutique business. With the loan, she will buy clothes, thread and beads in bulk which will help her to offer more finished products to her customers and increase her income.  She has been operating her business for over 10 years and she is very hopeful that this investment will take her business to more profitable level. 
She is new loan applicant of Asasah.

loans.use: To buy clothes, thread and beads for preparing dresses to display and sell in a boutique

loans.name: El Paraiso Group

texts.es: Maria del Carmen P. es una comerciante de 42 a;os de edad, vive en union libre con el padre de sus dos hijos, y reside en el Barrio Recreo en el municipio de La Union, Olancho. Maria es una persona luchadora, que con mucho esfuerzo a sacado adelante a sus hijos, ella tiene una pulperia en su domicilio y sus hijos le ayudan atenderla. Su horario de atencion es de lunes a domingo desde las 6:00 pm a 7:00 pm. Maria solicita el prestamo para surtir su pulperia de mas y variados productos de la canasta basica. Por los momentos no atraviesa ninguna dificultad. Con el apoyo del prestamo espera seguir obteniendo ganancias y de estas ahorrar un poco para que dentro de poco tiempo pueda tener un negocio mas grande y mas rentable. Su meta es mantener y mejorar su negocio para que cuando ella y su esposo esten ya ancianos no sean una carga economica para sus hijos. Es su vigesimo ciclo en FAMA y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos.
texts.en: Maria del Carmen P. is a merchant. She is 42 years old and lives with her live-in partner and father of her children in the Recreo neighborhood in the municipality of La Union, Olancho. Maria is a fighter who has painstakingly brought up her children. She has a grocery store in her home and her children help her attend to it. Her schedule is Monday to Sunday from 6:00 am until 7:00 pm. Maria is requesting a loan to stock her grocery store with a greater variety of basic products. Currently, she does not face any difficulties. With the help of this loan she hopes to continue making a profit to be able to save so that eventually she can have a larger and more profitable business. Her goal is to maintain and improve her business so that when she and her husband are older they will not be an economic burden on their children. This is her 20th cycle with field partner FAMA and she has proven to be responsible and punctual with her payments.

loans.use: Purchase groceries to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Seiyl's Group

texts.en:
Seiyl K. is the leader of this group. She is the resident of Tokmok, a small town near Bishkek (capital of Kyrgyzstan). She is 35 and married. Her husband has gone to Russia to earn money. Seiyl takes care of two children: a son and a daughter. In order to cover family expenses she works in the barber shop. Four years ago with the initial investment of 4000 soms, she rented a place and opened a barber shop. She earns 15000 soms per month. With money received from the loan she wants to improve the services she provides in her barber shop. In the future she dreams of building a big house for her family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135
