Tahmina D. is the leader of this group. She is 28 and married. Her husband works as an electrician. Together they bring up two sons and  both sons are preschool age (under seven). Tahmina works as a chief specialist in the Regional Department. Two years ago with the initial investment of 20000 soms the family started to breed livestock.  By reselling livestock after fattening they earn additional 2000 soms per month. Tahmina applied for the loan because she needs additional money to purchase furniture in order to improve the family’s living conditions.

 --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff

loans.use: to purchase furniture

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina A. is from the village of Poblacion, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 54 years old. Lina is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Lina owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk food & toothpaste in the local community. She is also selling different kinds of beverages like soft drinks. Lina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Lina is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional beverages like softdrinks. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional beverages like soft drinks

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz, a hardworking lady, operates an artificial jewelry business to support her family financially. She collects orders from different jewelry shops and fulfills their orders to earn an income for the family. She buys jewelry from the famous markets in the city of Lahore named "Anarkali" and "Township bazaar". 

She lives in a small city of Punjab Pakistan called Khanewal. Khanewala is famous for its agriculture industry. Her house consists of 2 rooms and is located in the area of Khurram pura.  Shahnaz is 47 years old, married to E. S. and has 3 children. Her eldest son is 18 years old and operates a barber shop. Her younger son is in the 8th grade, while her daughter is studying for B.com degree. Her husband runs a grocery store in the community through which he sells daily use items like sugar, spices, cooking oil and rice etc. 

Shahnaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her jewelry business. With the loan, she will buy jewelry to fulfill the larger orders on time and to earn a good profit. She hopes that her business will become more profitable after the loan investment and that her family will be able to enjoy a better standard of life. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit performance and never missed a loan group meeting.

loans.use: To buy supplies of jewelry for a jewelry selling business

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a 27 years old married  woman with 2 children, aged 9 and 2 years, living in her own house in Hioma Uganda . She has no other dependents and her family goal is to educate her children . She runs a retail shop and has been doing this for 2 years. She started it from her savings and she hopes in the future to improve her business into a whole sale shop. Caroline needs this loan to buy rice, flour and sugar to sell.

loans.use: Purchase rice,flour and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Sulaika's Group

texts.en:
Sulaika B. is the leader of this group. She is 42 and married to a woodworker. Together they are bringing up two daughters and a son.  The daughters are at school and the son studies at university. Three years ago, with the initial investment of 10000 soms, the family started to breed livestock.  By reselling livestock animals after fattening they earn 5000 soms per month.  With money received from the loan Sulaika wants to purchase two livestock animals for breeding. In the future she wants to repair the house and celebrate her son’s wedding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff

loans.use: to purchase two livestock animals

loans.name: Masereka

texts.en: Masereka is a twenty five year old married man with two children and owns a house in Kasese Uganda. He has operated a retail shop for two years which he started with a capital of 500,000 shillings and has increased his capital to 1,800,000 shillings. His vision is to expand his business out to Bwera  (at the boarder with congo) and to educating his children. Masereka requests the loan to buy clothes, rice, sugar and flour to resell.

loans.use: To buy supplies of clothes, rice, sugar and flour to resell.

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en:
Gantulga is 46 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. He and his family live in an apartment. His youngest son attends a local secondary school and his wife works as a cook for the local cafe. She helps him with the business in her free time by taking orders from his customers. Gantulga operates a wood products business in his town. He designs and produces many different styles and sizes of furniture that he sells throughout his community. He started his business in 2000 with a capital of 350,000 MNT that was used to buy the necessary equipment and tools for his carpentry business. 

Today, his business is well established in the local area, and his working capital exceeds 1,300,000 MNT. For the future, he says, "My main business goal is to establish my own carpentry factory." 

Gantulga is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more wood supplies to make furniture.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies of wood

loans.name: Dorcus

texts.en: Dorcas is 32 years old and married with two children, aged 7 and 11. She lives with a family of two people in a rented house in Hioma Ugandahaving. Her  goal is to educate her children. She has a drug shop business and has been operating it for four years now. She started by working in someone’s clinic and then saved to start her own shop. She faces the challenge of bad debts. In the future she hopes to upgrade her drug shop to a clinic. She needs the loan for buying more drugs to sell.

loans.use: Purchase of drugs to sell

loans.name: Tesie

texts.en:
Tesie P. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 39 years old. Tesie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Tesie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Tesie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods and canned goods. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods and canned goods

loans.name: Uugantsetseg

texts.en:
Uugantsetseg is 46 years old and lives with her husband in the Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in one rented room in a public apartment. Her son lives on his own, separate from his parents, and her husband is disabled. 

She graduated from a trade vocational school as a cashier in 1985. Uugantsetseg operates a construction materials trading business out of a stall at the construction market in the city. She has been engaged in this business since 2007 and has built a stable and successful operation. 

She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to increase her working capital so as to increase the amount of her products to sell.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph would like a loan to purchase sugar, salt and rice for resale. He has been in the retail business for the last five years and the business is still at its boom stage. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda, and is charged with the responsibility of taking care of his six children. He dreams of building a permanent residential house and becoming a wholesaler.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, salt and rice for resale

loans.name: Abibu

texts.en: Abibu is a thirty-two-year-old single female with three children. She owns a house in Kasese. She has been dealing in poultry for the last two years during which she started with fifty birds and now has more than two hundred birds. Her hardships include the death of birds plus very expensive feeds. Her vision is business expansion plus educating her children. Abibu intends to use the loan to buy more hens.

loans.use: Buying more hens

loans.name: Crice

texts.en: Crice would like a loan to purchase a motorcycle. He has been working in the transport sector for one year. and his dream is to have at least three motorcycles. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda, and is charged with the responsibility of taking care of his one-year-old child. He desires to build a permanent house for the family.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle.

loans.name: Batbaatar

texts.en:
Batbaatar is 31 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. 

Batbaatar operates a vegetable trading business in his town. He provides a large selection of vegetables to his customers. He started his grocery business in 2006 with a working capital amount of 350,000 MNT and has since built a stable operation with many permanent and loyal customers. After several years of successful business activity, his working capital exceeds 1,300,000 MNT. For the future, he hopes for continued success and to expand his business. 

He is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to purchase more vegetables for his grocery business.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza T. is from the village of Kandiis, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old. Flordeliza is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, she buys and sells coconuts for copras (dried coconut meat) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $225 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Flordeliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Flordeliza is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional coconuts. This will be her 6th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts

loans.name: Rabson

texts.en: Rabson is a twenty-seven-year-old married male with three children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been selling foodstuffs for the last eight years. He started with a capital of 300,000 UGX and increased to 2,000,000 UGX. His hardship is debtors and his vision is business expansion plus educating his children. Rabson intends to use the credit to buy cassava, rice, flour, beans and rice for resale.

loans.use: Buying cassava, flour, beans and rice to sell

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a thirty-seven-year-old married male with five children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in a retail business for the last two years which he started with a capital of 1,000,000 UGX and increased to 5,000,000 UGX. His hardships include competition plus rising prices for goods. His vision is expanding his business to a supermarket plus educating his children. George needs the loan to buy soft drinks, bread, rice and sugar for resale.

loans.use: Buying soft drinks, bread, rice and sugar for resale

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a thirty-nine-year old married man with three children.  He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been buying and selling coffee for the last fifteen years; he started with one bag and now can purchase eight bags.

His biggest hardship is lack of enough capital. He has a vision of buying a motor vehicle and educating his children. Ibrahim needs the loan to buy coffee for sale.

loans.use: Buying coffee to sell.

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Un S. O. is a 49 year-old man who lives in the province of Kompong Thom. Un S. O. is a local farmer who has been planting a variety of crops since 1990. He has a life partner in his wife who sells fresh fish in the busy market. They have given birth to five children: three are single and two are married. One of them is a farmer as well as fisherman. 

Un S. O. is currently planting a peanut crop O. his own farmland, but he lacks capital to complete the project. In order to deal with this problem, Un S. O. hopes to use his Kiva loan to rent a plowing machine to plow his farmland. He will also purchase seed and fertilizer for growing.

loans.use: To rent a machine to plow his farmland and purchase seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine is a 42-year-old married woman with 3 children who lives in her own house in Hioma, Uganda. She has a business of buying and selling beans which she has been running for 8 years . She started as a farmer and later saved to start the produce business. In future, she hopes to move to her own bigger store. Justine wants the loan to buy beans for sale.

loans.use: To purchase beans

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
Sum O., age 34, is married with four children, all of whom are single. She is a local rice seller who buys rice in bulk at a reasonable cost to mill. She sells her finished rice to people to earn an income. Her husband also earns an income by growing rice. Sum O. generates around $2 of profit a day to meet the needs of her family. 

The rice-harvesting season will soon arrive and Sum O. has decided to seek a loan on Kiva for capital to buy more rice during the time when rice is commanding its lowest price. Then she will sell it later when the price has increased.

loans.use: To buy rice to stock for later resale while cost are low.

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen lives in Khanewal, which is a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan and is known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in a 2-room brick house with her family in the area of Khurram Pura.  She moved here with her family 25 years ago.

She is 44 years old and married with 4 children: three sons and a daughter. Her eldest son works for a government organization while the other sons stay at home and don’t do anything. Her daughter is studying in grade one.

Perveen supports her family financially by doing a job at the school. Her husband's name is B. M. and he also works for a government organization for a monthly wage. After his day job, he operates a fruit-selling business to supplement the income of the family. He sells seasonal fruits by visiting different streets of the city with his four-wheeled cart. He has been operating this business for past 10 years and manages a good clientele base.  

Perveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s fruit-selling business. With the loan, he will purchase fresh seasonal fruits and increase his sales. Perveen is hopeful that an investment will bring more profits for her husband.

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In a previous loan year, she has established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

Note: In the photo, the lady with the book (called Asasah Passbook) is Perveen.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruits for fruit-selling business

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a forty-eight-year-old married man with three children who lives in his own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a dream of setting up a farm for the family. For twenty years, he has been a successful builder and a farmer and with the income generated, he was able to pay for three of his children to go to school up to university.

His major challenge is the accidents involved during his construction work. His dream is to have rentals for the family. Joseph needs the loan to plant three acres of cow peas.

loans.use: Planting cow peas.

loans.name: Len

texts.en:
Len P., 52, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. P. and her husband produce traditional baskets to sell, earning an income of 3 USD each per day. One of her children is employed as a chef, earning an income of 4 USD per day to help cover the family's expenses.

Each month, the family has to spend 15 USD on food and 60 USD on other necessary expenses. P. is requesting a loan of 700 USD to purchase a plot of farmland to improve the family's farming. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her third loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland to improve the family's farming

loans.name: Bugongi United Savings And Credit Group C-Kihihi

texts.en:
Robert B., 31, a happily married father with three children, is best described as a hard-worker by nature. At least he has lived up to that description the last 10 years operating a commercial agricultural business in Kito-Kihihi. 

That hard work ethic has enabled him to make significant strides in a business that was once regarded as Uganda's economic backbone. That statement must be put into perspective because there has been a gradual shift away from commercial agriculture as a means of subsistence through the course of the last 30 years in Uganda. 

Robert, for the most part, sells bananas. Bananas are a staple food in most parts of western Uganda. Before he obtained a firm footing in this business, Robert was selling mostly coffee, which is also a cash crop of high financial value. 

With this loan, Robert says he is going to buy pesticides to get rid of the bugs that have been playing havoc with his banana plantations. Robert says that, in the future, he is looking to expand his banana plantations by buying more acres of land.

Robert belongs to Bugongi United Savings and Credit group-Kihihi.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is married to M. M. who is daily wage laborer. His income is not guaranteed because sometimes he gets work and sometimes not. In order to assist him financially Khalida started an artificial jewelry business eight years ago. She collects orders from different jewelry shops and fills them on time to make an income. 

She belongs to Khanewal, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, famous for its agriculture industry. She has lived there in a two-room brick house with her family in the area of Khurram Pura for the past 20 years. She has given birth to four sons. Her oldest son works in a government organization, and the next oldest is a daily wage laborer. Only her youngest son is able to attend school, and he is studying in kindergarten. 

She has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, to improve her jewelry selling business. With the loan, she will buy jewelry like earrings, rings and necklaces in bulk to fulfill larger orders on time and to make extra income.  

She is very hopeful that the loan investment will take her business to a more profitable position. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Khalida”.

loans.use: To buy jewelry to sell

loans.name: Chhourn

texts.en:
Chhourn T., 45, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. T. sells fish, earning an income of about $3 per day. One of her children is a fisherman, earning an income of $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $25 on food and $40 on the other necessary expenses. 

T. is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase more fishing tools for her child to improve his fishing business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her third loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy more fishing tools to improve her child's fishing business

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is twenty-four years old, living with his parents in Fort Portal, Uganda, with a dream of educating his siblings up to degree level. He is a teacher by profession and has been teaching for three years now. John needs the loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: Paying school fees

loans.name: Seav

texts.en:
Seav S., 22, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. She is a housewife while her husband is a chef, earning an income of about $6 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $50 on food and $15 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $700 to build a grocery store to start a new business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner. 

S.'s husband appears in the photograph because she was not available.

loans.use: build a grocery store to start a new business

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia is a resident of Khanewal, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a two-room brick house with her family for over fifteen years. She is a housewife, and she prefers to stay at home and perform her household responsibilities. She is a very active lady and performs her duties very well. Safia is the mother of three daughters and a son. All of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education. 
 
Her husband’s name is Y. M., and he works in a factory for a low income. After his day job, he also operates a recycling business. He provides scrap like plastic bottles, used papers, etc. to different factories to earn more income. He has been operating this business for the past ten years and maintains a good reputation.  

Safia has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy scrap in bulk and increase his sales. Safia is very confident about the positive growth of her husband’s business after the loan investment. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy scrap for recycling business

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is twenty-two years old and lives with his parents in Fort Portal, Uganda, with a dream of building his own house and educating his brothers. He is into sieve making, farming and motorcycle businesses, and with the income generated he was able to buy his own motorcycle. His hardship is price fluctuation for agricultural products and his dream is to set up a factory that makes sieves. Moses needs the loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: Paying school fees

loans.name: Pheouk

texts.en:
Pheouk S., 53, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. S. is a housewife, while one of her children is employed at a hotel, earning an income of about $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $30 on food and $60 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike for family use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an electric compressor engine

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Yun L., 31, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. L. is a construction worker, earning an income of $3 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman, earning an income of $7 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $60 on food and $75 on the other necessary expenses. 

L. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase more construction supplies to improve the current business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her 4th loan from CREDIT, a L. standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy more construction supplies to improve the current business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth V. is from the village of Kandiis, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 50 years old. Elizabeth is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $187 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elizabeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. 

Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 5th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Chak

texts.en:
Chak S. is a 29-year-old married woman blessed with one small child. From Kompong Thom Province, Chak S. weaves bamboo baskets for sale. She sells her finished product to buyers who come directly to her house. She makes over 50 sets of baskets before selling out. She also orders baskets from the other villagers and sells them to make additional income. Her husband helps her buy the raw materials and weave the baskets. 

This is a rice harvesting season, and it is a good time for earning additional income. So Chak S. is concerned that she needs capital to purchase many sacks of rice to store while prices are low. She will sell them when prices are high.

loans.use: To stock up rice while prices are low for future sales

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz L. is from the village of Minsapinit, Gingoog City. She is 34 years old and married. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $175 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Luz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Luz is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods and canned goods. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more snack foods and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim, the wife of H. N., resides in a city called Khanewal in Pakistan. Khanewal is famous for its agriculture industry. She owns a two-room house there where she has been living with her family for the past 20 years. Shamim has given birth to four children: three boys and one girl. All of her children are enrolled in school and are getting their education. 
 
Shamim is a 42-year-old housewife who prefers to stay at home to manage the household responsibilities. Her husband is involved in an animal sales business. He buys animals from the animal market at cheap rates. He raises them and then sells them to clients. He has been in this business for five years.
 
Shamim has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy goats and raise them to sell at a good profit.
  
Shamim is hopeful that through this investment her husband’s business will become improved and he will be able to serve many more clients as a result. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Shamim.

loans.use: To buy goats for animal sales business

loans.name: Meliza

texts.en:
Meliza C. is from the village of Bal-ason, Gingoog City. She is 21 years old. Meliza is married and has two infant children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business making and selling broom sticks to local businesses and community members. Meliza has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Meliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Meliza is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional brooms. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Meliza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional brooms

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more equipment for her beauty salon

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli L. is from the village of San Luis, Gingoog City. She is 67 years old. Arceli is separated from her spouse and has six adult children. 

To make a living, Arceli owns and operates a tailoring business, providing general alteration and tailoring services as well as curtains, pillowcases, bedsheets, sofa covers, dresses and pants to local community members. Arceli has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Arceli joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Arceli has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles and threads. 

Arceli is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Arceli from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

location.town: San Luis, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa S. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 60 years old. Elsa is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Elsa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste in the local community. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elsa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Elsa is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Elsa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Naseema's Group

texts.en:
Naseema is 43 years old and married with four daughters. She belongs to a city called Khanewal in Pakistan, which is famous for its agriculture industry. She owns a two-room house where she has been living for over 25 years.
 
She is a very hardworking lady. She carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well. Besides being a housewife, she also works in a local factory on a monthly wage, and she handles this job very well. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband. Her earning allows her to pay the school fees of her daughters.
 
Her husband, Z. H., is a carpenter by profession. He makes furniture on orders and earns income after completing them. He learned this art from his father because he was involved in the same profession. He practiced carefully to become skillful in this art and now he has been operating this business independently for 15 years.
  
Naseema has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy a wood-cutting machine because the manual cutter takes much of his time, causing him to fall behind on his orders.
 
She is hopeful that through this investment her husband will become more efficient in his work and able to achieve the orders on time.

loans.use: To buy a wood-cutting machine for the furniture-making business

loans.name: Boldbaatar

texts.en:
Boldbaatar is 49 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Songino-Hairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia’s capital city. He and his family live together in a house and fenced yard. His wife is currently unemployed and his youngest son attends a school.
Boldbaatar operates a taxi service using his own car to support his family. His oldest daughter also drives a taxi using her own car. Boldbaatar started his taxi business in 2010 after working for the firefighting team as a driver between 2004 and 2010. He has gained a lot of experience as a driver. Boldbaatar is modest and honest and says, "All I want is to continue to run this business as a stable operation in order to provide my family." Boldbaatar is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to use for his household to repair his house and fence.

loans.use: To repair his house and fence

loans.name: Odbayar

texts.en: Odbayar M. is 28 years old, married, and has one child who attends school.  They live in the Songino-Hairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. Odbatar operates a computer service out of a rented stall at the local trade center. He started his business in 2008 after graduating from Technical Institute as a programmer in 2007. After years of operation, he has gained a significant experience in his business. Odbayar is a modest and honest man and plans to continue to run his business in order to have his own work place in the future. He is requesting a 900,000 MNT loan to purchase computer software and devices for his computer service center.

loans.use: To purchase computer software and devices

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Narantsetseg is 46 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in the Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in an apartment. His daughter attends a local primary school while her husband is currently unemployed. She graduated from Construction Vocatioanl School as an operator in 1983. 

Narantsetseg operates a household goods trading business out of a rented stall at the construction trade center in the city. She has been engaged in this business since 2007 after working at her occupation from 1990. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to import more household goods from Erlian, a border city in China in order to increase her working capital for her business.

loans.use: To import more household goods

loans.name: Tegshbayar

texts.en:
Tegshbayar is 47 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a house in the Han-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Tegshsaihan operates a grocery shop in the city. She is one of our trustworthy clients who has paid all her bank loans on time in full. After years of operation she has gained a lot of experience in her business. 

Tegshbayar is a very hard-working and optimistic person. She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a large amount of products for her shop to increase her working capital as well as be able to buy a TV for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of products

loans.name: Fawziyeh

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 35 years old, married and has four children.

In 2008, Fawziyeh opened her own sewing project for women and children's wear. She is very experienced in this field and now she is becoming well known and has a good reputation in her local community.

She is requesting a $2,000 loan to buy two new sewing machines and a small generator to increase her production. She is aiming to grow bigger and increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy two sewing machines and a small generator

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is a 35-year-old lady, residing in a city called Khanewal, which is famous in Pakistan for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family in the area called Abbas Nagar for over 15 years. 

A talented lady, Razia is involved in a clothes-selling business. She purchases clothes from the clothing markets of Khanewal and sells to her community at a profit. She is well known among her customers for her good collection and quality clothes. She has been doing this business for over five years. She utilizes her income to pay the utility bills and also the school fees of her children. 

Her husband's name is M. M. and he works for Pakistan railways on a monthly wage. She has given birth to four children: two sons and two daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a school and getting their education.  

Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her clothes-selling business. With the loan, she will buy clothes of different variety in bulk. The bulk purchasing will enable her to offer more variety to her customers and help her to increase her sales. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Razia.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Akbari's Group

texts.en:
Akbari is the wife of M. Y. and resides in a city called Khanewal in Pakistan. She owns a single-roomed house in the area called Abbas Nagar where she has been living with her family for over 15 years. She is 38 years old, a hard-working lady, who operates her bangle-selling business in the community. She started this business five years ago to support her husband financially. Now she has become the earning hand of her family which makes her feel happy and responsible. Besides being a working lady, she also manages her household responsibilities very well. She takes care of her family and gives them her full-time attention.  

Her husband is a painter by profession and paints walls and buildings on contract. She has given birth to six children: five daughters and one son. All of them are enrolled in a school and getting their education. 

Akbari has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her bangle-selling business. With the loan, she will buy bangles of different kinds such as steel and plastic and sell them to her customers to earn a profit. She is hopeful that through this investment she will be able to take her business to a more profitable position. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a booklet (called Asasah Passbook) is Akbari.

loans.use: To buy bangles for bangle-selling business

loans.name: Bugongi United Savings And Credit Group D-Kihihi

texts.en:
Julius T., 30, has been affiliated with Bugongi United Savings and Credit Group-Kihihi for the past 10 years. 

It is from his small farming business that this happily married father of two was able to set the balling rolling to create his current retail business. Hard work is what Julius is known for, and his diligence has been bringing in dividends. 

Julius sells a wide range of general merchandise retail items such as sugar, salt, beans, rice, etc. He does not have many of the aforementioned commodities in bulk, however, and he often runs out of stock because his operating capital is not yet at a sustainable level. 

Monthly, this business generates him 200,000 shillings, and with this loan, he says he is going to purchase more beans, bars of soap, sugar, etc., to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more beans, bars of soap, sugar, etc., to resell

loans.name: Shamim Wanjiku

texts.en:
Shamim Wanjiku S. is 42 years old and married to S. Abed. Together they have three children. Her husband is employed at Eldo millers in Eldoret town, where they live. 

Shamim runs a beauty salon and boutique in the same area and has been in the same business for four years now. She gets a monthly income of fifteen thousand shillings.

This will be Shamim's first loan from KADET Ltd., and she plans to use it to buy cosmetics, a hair dryer and a few items for her boutique business. With the income that she will get, she plans to repay her loan well, pay her rent, and also raise her family's standard of living. 

In the future, she wants to educate her children by taking them to the best schools in Eldoret, and also to diversify her business to start a hotel in Eldoret town.

loans.use: To buy salon equipment

loans.name: Shamshad Begum's Group

texts.en:
Shamshad begum M. Y.  is 58 years old, married, and has four children.  She resides in Kamokay in Pakistan. Kamokay is known for its rice industry. She has been living there with her family for past 40 years. Her eldest son has got his education until 5th standard and could not study further due to the poor financial condition of the family. He is now 24 years old and runs a grocery shop in the market to financially support the family. 

Shamshad's husband is involved in a dairy business. He has some buffalos at his home from which he gets milk and sells to his customers to earn an income. Shamshad is a very talented lady, who operates an embroider business in her home. She collects orders from her community and earns income after completing them on time.  

Shamshad has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her eldest son’s business. With the loan, he will buy groceries, such as cooking oil, rice, sugar, and spices to sell in his grocery shop. Shamshad is hopeful that through this investment her son will be able to expand his business and doublehis income. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shamshad begum.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian J. is a 21-year-old single woman. She does dairy farming in the Eldoret area and sells milk from the cows to her neighbors and dairy processing plants in her area. She has been in this business for nine years now and gets a monthly income of 22,000 KES.

This will be Lilian's first loan with KADET Ltd., and she plans to buy a dairy cow for milk production. With the income she will get, she plans to buy land for agricultural production so as to maximize profits. 

In the future, she wants to continue with dairy farming and also to diversify to maize farming.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for milk production and sales

loans.name: Constante

texts.en:
Constante  M., 36, is married and the father of four children. He has been teaching for the past decade. 

Constante, who many describe as development-oriented and honest, has been teaching in quite a big number of schools in and around the district of Ntungamo. That partly explains why he gets a slightly higher remuneration than other teachers. He earns 800,000 shillings monthly from his teaching job. 

He also does some farming and cattle keeping for alternative sources of income. He says that with this loan, he is going to purchase land.

loans.use: To purchase land

loans.name: Akramjon

texts.ru: Сафаров Акрамжон проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 30 лет. Женат. Детей не имеет. Живет вместе с родителями. Жена домохозяйка. Сам Акрамжон предоставляет услугу, то есть он занимается перевозками на своей грузовой машине. Этим видом деятельности занимается 7 лет. Кредит берет для ремонта машины.
texts.en: Akramjon S. lives in the Yavan Region. 30 years old. Married, without children. His parents live with him. His wife is a homemaker. Akramjon provides transportation services, transporting cargo in his truck. He has been in this line of business for seven years. He is taking out a loan in order to repair his truck.

loans.use: Auto repairs

loans.name: Abdumavlon

texts.en:
Abdumavlon B. is a 39-year-old married man who lives with his wife and two children. Abdumavlon raises and sells cattle. He has 10 years of experience in this field. Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Abdumavlon has become a very successful businessman. 

Abdumavlon has a friendly family whose members always try to help each other. Thus his wife helps him with his business. He works very hard and spends his weekend time with the cattle, cleaning them, feeding them and pasturing them. 

Now Abdumavlon wants to expand his business and buy more cattle. He has applied for a loan of 5,000 TJS. Abdumavlon thanks all lenders for their support.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Bebina

texts.en:
Bebina A. is from the village of Lunao, Gingoog City. She is 38 years old. Bebina is married and has two school-aged children. 

To make a living, Bebina owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling squid and dried fish like pinikas, sap-sap and salmonete in the local community. Bebina has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Bebina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Bebina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Bebina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like dried fish and squid. This will be the third loan taken out by Bebina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seafood to sell

loans.name: Ikromjon

texts.en:
Ikromjon N.  is a 52-year-old married man who lives with his wife and children. He has 30 years of experience in raising and selling cattle. Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Ikromjon has become a very successful businessman. 

Ikromjon has a friendly family whose members always try to help each other. Thus his wife helps him with the cattle business. He works very hard and spends his weekend time with the cattle, cleaning, feeding and pasturing them. 

Now Ikromjon wants to expand his business and buy more cattle. He applied for a loan of 5000 TJS. He thanks all lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Akbarkhuja

texts.en:
Akbarkhuja O.  is married and the father of three children, who are his responsibility. He has been dedicated to cattle farming for the past four years and has vast experience in the field, as it is the only business he is in. 

This work is satisfying, and it enables Akbarkhuja to purchase goods for his home. He provides the markets with meat and his family with the necessary food. 

Akbarkhuja wants to buy young cattle and needs money so he decided to apply for a loan of 5,000 TJS. He is counting on your help and expresses his gratitude for your generous heart.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa P. is from the village of San Miguel, Gingoog City. She is 47 years old. Marisa is married and has six school-aged children. 

To make a living, Marisa owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling clothing, cosmetics and locally made shoe products from MSE (Marikina Shoe Exchange). She also sells rice by the kilogram. Marisa has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Marisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Marisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Marisa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Marisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: San Miguel, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en:
Rustam is married and has a big family including his wife, parents and brother.  He owns a bakery.  His business has been running for 3 years.  Demand for bread has always been high, which is why Rustam’s business has flourished.  Rustam has requested a loan of 7,500 Somoni to purchase ingredients for his bakery. The ability to buy more inventories at low prices will give him the opportunity to increase his profits and continue developing a successful enterprise while improving his standard of living.

loans.use: Purchasing flour at wholesale for baking the national bread “lepeshka”.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne S. is from the village of Bangbang, Medina, Misamis Oriental.  She is 40 years old.  Jeanne is single and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, Jeanne owns and operates a specialized retail store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling coconuts for copras in the local community.  Jeanne has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jeanne joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeanne has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Jeanne is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional coconuts for copras to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jeanne from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Purchasing more foodstuffs for increasing the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Alozious

texts.en: Alozious is a thirty-two-year-old married man with four children living in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal Uganda. He is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after his family, and his ambition is to build a permanent house in the next three years. He has been farming for ten years, facing seasonal challenges, and his dream is to have five acres of banana plantation and maize garden. Alozious needs the loan to prepare land for maize planting.

loans.use: To prepare land for growing maize

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina is married to M. M. A..  They have two children, one of whom attends school.  The family resides in Kamokay, which is famous for its rice industry in Pakistan. She has been living there with her family for the past 25 years.  Zarina operates an embroidery business at her home to supplement the income of her family. She is expert in her work and crafts beautiful embroidery on clothes to satisfy her customers. She enjoys doing her work. She has been in this business for past eight years. Her husband is operates a business of making shoe boxes. He supplies the shoe shops to earn income. 

Zarina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy embroidery items such as beads, colored thread, and clothes in bulk for her business, which will help her complete her orders on time and earn a good profit. She is a regular borrower of Asasah. This is her second loan application. With her previous loan, Zarina has established good credit and never missed any meetings. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Zarina.

loans.use: To buy embroidery items

loans.name: Ruzijon

texts.en:
Ruzijon is married and has two children. She runs a small store selling candies and sweets. The store is located on the first floor of a big apartment building which provides easy access for her clientele. She has been in this business for 6 years. 

Ruzijon is very cheery and optimistic. Her store faces high competition as there are many supermarkets in the neighborhood. However, her customer-friendly service and the individual attention she can give help her keep loyal customers. Her responsibility and perseverance have helped Ruzijon repay all loans she has received from IMON International successfully. 

Ruzijon is requesting a loan of $1500 US for a couple of purposes. She is going to do some remodeling work inside her vending facility and she’d like to increase the assortment of products she has available. This loan will help Ruzijon expand her business, having a positive impact on her trade profitability, and helping to further improve the economic and social situation of her family.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing candies to expand inventory; remodeling store

Jocelyn N. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 47 years old. Jocelyn is married and has eight adult children. 

To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods and canned goods. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Jocelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

texts.ru: Сафаров Файзали проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 47 лет. Женат. Имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается перевозкой людей по маршруту Яван-Душанбе. В этой области уже 12 лет. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en: Fayzali S. lives in the Yavan Region. 47 years of age. Married, with five children. He has secondary education. He transports passengers between Yavan and Dushanbe. He has been in this business for 12 years. He is taking out a loan in order to repair his car.

loans.use: Auto repair

loans.name: Mamasuluv

texts.en:
Mamasuluv B. is a 49-year-old mother who lives with her husband and six children. 

Mamasuluv and her husband make a living by planting and cultivating crops like onions, corn and grain in their field. They both work very hard. This couple is striving to work almost day and night in their field plowing, cultivating and fertilizing soil to grow more crops due to a great demand in the market. 

They hope to use a loan to make more and better crops and in the end to earn more money. 

In the future, they hope to save more money to buy more land so they can grow a wider range of crops for additional income. Mamasuluv hopes one day she will have enough money to send her children to a local school.

loans.name: Zubaida Begum's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida Begum, 49, is the wife of N. H. and resides in a city named Kamokay in Pakistan. She has been living there with her family for 14 years. She has given birth to four children: three sons and one daughter. Her daughter is in fifth standard, while her sons help their father in his business. Zubaida prefers to stay at home and manage her responsibilities. 
  
Zubaida’s husband operates a small restaurant in the market, where he sells Punjabi foods such as nan chanay (made with chick peas and served with bread) and biryani (made with rice and chicken and served with pickle and yogurt). He has been operating this business for 12 years. He is well known among his customers and in the market for his quality of food.
  
Zubaida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy the required items such as chick peas, rice, cooking oil and spices for his restaurant business. This will help him to maintain the quality of his food, to serve more customers and to increase his income.
 
Zubaida is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Zubaida Begum.

loans.use: To buy required items for the restaurant business

loans.name: Marifel

texts.en:
Marifel R. is from the village of Kandiis, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 30 years old. Marifel is married and has 3 school-aged children. Marifel owns & operates a livestock business. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and raising pigs for sale. Marifel has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marifel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marifel has successfully repaid her first loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Marifel is now requesting a second loan, for 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

loans.name: Zebogul

texts.en:

Her small vending kiosk is located very favorably in a nice part of the marketplace busy with potential customers. Zebogul launched this business 9 years ago. Her business can boast high profitability. Foodstuffs always sell well in any season and are always in high demand among customers. Zebogul is dreaming about growing her business and eventually opening a grocery store. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 Somoni to increase her turnover capital.

loans.name: Petronille

texts.fr: M. Pétronille est commerçante.  Elle a 52 ans, elle est veuve, et elle a 4 enfants entre 12 ans et 20 ans.  Elle a une éducation primaire, et tous ses enfants vont à l’école.  Elle était née) au district de Ruhango, province du sud du Rwanda, mais maintenant elle habite à Kigali-Rwanda.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter du ciment, planches, briques, sables et main d’œuvre.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’épargner, et remboursement de prêts à temps pour être indépendante chez elle et augmenter la confiance avec sa banque.  Elle voudrait augmenter le développement intellectuel de ses enfants.  Pour sa famille, elle voudrait acheter une maison d’habitation.
texts.en: M. Pétronille is a storekeeper.  She is 52 years old, a widow, and she has three children between the ages of 12 and 20.  She has a primary school education, and all of her children go to school.  She was born in the district of Ruhango, a province in the south of Rwanda, but she now lives in Kigali-Rwanda.  She is going to use her loan to buy cement, flooring, bricks, sand and labor.  Her strategy for the project's growth is to save and to pay back her loans on time in order to be independent in her own home and to increase the confidence of the bank.  She would like to increase the intellectual development of her children.  For her family, she would like to buy a new home in which to live.

loans.use: Purchase of cement, flooring, sand, bricks and labor

loans.name: Pastor

texts.fr: M. M. a 64 ans et est  marié à une revendeuse. Il  a 3  enfants en charge. Il fait la vente de documents biblique    et  a commencé  cette activité en  1990.  Il s’approvisionne  à l’Alliance biblique et revend ensuite dans le marché local d’adawlato. Pour satisfaire plus de client, il demande un prêt. Le monsieur est celui qui est habillé en T-shirt blanc.
texts.en: Mr M. is 64 years old and married to a reseller. He has three children in his care. He sells bibles and religious books. He began this trade in 1990. He gets his supplies from the The Biblical Alliance and then resells the books at the local market in Adawlato. To meet the demand from more clients, he applies for a loan. Our client is the gentleman with the white T-shirt.

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es:
Magaly forma parte del banco comunal “El Altillo” ubicado en la ciudad de Puerto Montt.  Ella tiene una sociedad con un cuñado en la venta de muebles, él los fabrica en un taller que tiene en su casa y ella sale a vender y maneja la administración, desde hace 3 años. Tienen aproximadamente 9 empresas como clientes fijos, ya que sus muebles son principalmente para oficinas. También tienen clientes particulares. 
Con este préstamo comprará materiales y nuevas herramientas para mejorar la fabricación de los muebles.
Su sueño es tener una mueblería establecida. 
Vive con su marido y sus 4 hijos. Los 2 mayores son universitarios quienes trabajan y estudian, el de 16 años también trabaja y estudia y el menor de 10 años solo estudia.
Para Magaly Fondo Esperanza le da la oportunidad de surgir en su negocio y de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Puerto Montt es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Lagos. Una de las atracciones de Puerto Montt son sus bellos paisajes verdes; sus playas poco frecuentadas; su gastronomía y especialmente la reputación de sus pescados y mariscos y sus artesanías. Es también la puerta de entrada a la Isla Grande de Chiloé, rica en tradiciones y leyendas.
texts.en:
Magaly is a member of the community bank "El Altillo" which is located in the city of Puerto Montt. She has been in partnership with a brother-in-law selling furniture for three years. He makes the furniture in a shop he has in his home and she goes out to make sales and also handles the administration. They have about nine companies as regular clients as their furniture is primarily for offices. They also have private clients. With this loan she will purchase materials and tools to improve the manufacturing of the furniture. Her dream is to have an established furniture store. 

Magaly lives with her husband and four children. The two oldest are university students who work and study. Her 16 year-old also works and studies and her youngest of 10 years only goes to school. 

For Magaly Fondo Esperanza this is an opportunity to rise in her business and thus improve the quality of life for her family. Perto Montt is a city in the south of Chile, located in the Los Lagos region. The attractions of Puerto Mott are its beautiful green countryside, its uncrowded beaches, its gastronomy and especially the reputation of its seafood and crafts. It is also the gateway to the Isla Grande de Chiloe, rich in tradition and legend.

loans.use: Purchase materials and tools.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en:
Modesto is a 36-year-old married man with two children, who rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the hardware business for one year. He started with small-scale farming, saved money, and then started the hardware shop. His hardship is his low income, and his vision is becoming a wholesaler who is self employed and educating his children.

Modesto intends to use the loan to buy cement.

loans.use: To buy cement

loans.name: Agossou Kokou

texts.fr: M. Agossou a 39 ans  et est  marié. Il est père de 2 enfants. Il est né à Lomé  et exerce comme activité  la vente de produits alimentaires.  Il a commencé en 2006 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Il revend ensuite dans un magasin à la devanture de sa maison. Il sollicite un prêt pour acheter  10 cartons de boite de tomate et 10 bidons d’huiles.
texts.en: Mr Agossou, aged 39, is married and the father of two children. He was born in Lomé and runs a grocery store. He began in 2006. He gets his supplies at the great market in Lomé and then retails them in his store located at the front side of his house. He applies for a loan to buy 10 boxes of canned tomatoes and 10 cans of oil.

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Fiyaz's Group

texts.en:
Fiyaz resides with her family in a 2-room brick house in the city called Pakpattan. Pakpattan is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there for past 30 years. 

Her husband’s name is M. A. S. and he operates a vegetable business at his home from where he sells fresh seasonal vegetables to customers from his community. He uses a room of his house for this purpose. He is well known for his customer relations and good quality vegetables. 

Fiyaz is a housewife but when her husband is absent she also operates his business. She is the mother of one son who works in a factory and contributes to the household financially. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal vegetables to put in his shop for sale. He has been operating this business for the past 15 years, and Fiyaz is hopeful that an investment will bring even more profit to his business. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit record and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal vegetables for vegetable-sales business

loans.name: Bujuuta 'b' Development Group-Lugazi

texts.en:
Gorreti B., 44, operates a beauty salon business in the Bujuuta B trading center in the Lugazi district. She mostly offers hair dressing services. Weekly, this business generates close to 100,000 shillings as profits. Prior to opening this business, Gorreti, who is happily married with four children, says she was more involved in farming.

This business has been in existence for 15 years, and to achieve this longevity, it has called for a lot of sacrifice, time, hard work and patience. With this loan, she says she is going to purchase a hair dryer.

loans.use: To purchase a hair dryer

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hanifaan's Group

texts.en:
Hanifaan lives in Pakpattan, a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family for the past 20 years. Her husband’s name is M. Y. and he operates an animal sales business. He purchases animals like goats from the animal market, raises them, and then sells them to people who require them, at a good profit. 

In order to financially support her family, Hanifaan also does paid work. She packs different spices like black pepper, red-chilly powder, salt etc. on order and charges for her labor. She is the mother of three sons and a daughter who is young. Hanifaan couldn’t provide them education due to financial constraints. Her eldest son is involved in a potato-selling business. He buys potatoes from the vegetable market and sells to different vegetable shops to earn an income. He does this work to contribute to his family financially. 

Hanifaan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her son’s business. With the loan, he will buy potatoes in bulk and increase his sales. Hanifaan is hopeful that through the loan investment her son will be able to take his business to more profitable position and make more income which will improve his family’s financial condition. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself as a responsible client who always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.
