loans.use: To buy potatoes for potato-selling business

loans.name: Phelelani Group

texts.en:
Elpha is 65 years old and married with seven children aged between 19 and 35. She sells brooms, mats, hats, bags and baskets at pay points and also in Durban. In the photo above, she is standing in the center of her borrowing group.
Elpha been engaged in her business for ten years and has two employees. She says that the main challenge to her business is the shortage of employees. She has many customers and sometimes loses them because of insufficient stock. In the future she hopes to have a formal place to sell her mats and make the business more sustainable in order to hire more staff.
She has requested this loan through Kiva partner, Womens Development Businesses (WDB), to buy more dye, wool, mats and grass for her handicrafts, and also buttons for making bags. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her buy enough food for her family, and send her grandchildren to school, extend her house and send her last-born child to university. She also said that she appreciates WDB and Kiva for providing this opportunity – she never thought she would see herself on the internet!

loans.use: To buy handicraft materials (dye, wool, mats, grass) and buttons for bags

loans.name: Shahnaz Bebal's Group

texts.en:
For the past 20 years, Shahnaz has lived in Pakpattan, a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agricultural industry. She lives there in a two-roomed brick house in a combined family unit in the area of Shaheed Nagar. Shahnaz is a seamstress. In order to support her family financially, she stitches clothes for her neighboring customers. She has operated this business for many years and is well known in her community for the quality of her work. Her husband, B., is a loader by profession. He loads different items such as fruits, vegetables and construction materials (such as bricks and cement) on his donkey cart and delivers them to their destinations.
Shahnaz is the mother of three sons and two daughters. She only managed to provide education to her eldest son who is in 5th standard. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her brother-in-law who operates a fruit-selling business in the market. With the loan, he will purchase fresh seasonal fruits in bulk (to minimize the purchase cost) in order to fulfill customer orders on a timely basis. Shahnaz's brother-in-law has operated this business for 15 years and Shahnaz is hopeful that an investment will bring even more profits to him. She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruits for fruit-selling business

loans.name: Tasneem Mehram Ali's Group

texts.en:
Tasneem lives in Pakpattan, a small Pakistani city known for its agricultural industry. She has been living there with her family for over 30 years. Tasneem is 48 years old and married to M. A., who has a wheat-selling business. He has contacts with different farmers from whom he purchases wheat and then he resells the wheat at a good profit to different shops in the city. He has been engaged in this business for 20 years and has vast experience in this field.
Tasneem is a hardworking lady who operates a timber sales business to support her husband financially. As many people in her community don’t have a gas connection in their house, they use timber for cooking. Tasneem is the mother of a son who works in an animal sales business and contributes to his family financially through his earnings. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy wheat in larger quantities to fulfill larger orders on time and to make more income. Tasneem is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself to be a responsible client who always pays her installments on time and never misses a single meeting.
Note: In the photo, the lady with the book (an Asasah Passbook) is Tasneem.

loans.use: To buy wheat for resale

loans.name: Ndiang Mbambodj Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois de NDIANG MBAM. vient d'être inauguré et de recevoir son premier financement avec CAURIE-MF le 21 décembre 2010. Il est composé de 48 femmes issues du même groupement féminin et du même village. 

Madame AMINA S. debout en premier position à partir de la droite sur la photo et mise en médaillon est présidente du Banc Villageois. Elle est âgée de 51 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. 

Elle est couturière de profession. Depuis plus de 10 ans elle exerce ce métier. Elle est détentrice d'un atelier de couture où elle confectionne des vêtements.

Son nouveau financement lui permettra de mieux développer son activité de couture et accroitre ses revenus financiers

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans les besoins de la famille
texts.en:
The recently created Ndiang MbaM. Banc Villageois has just received its first financing from Caurie-MF on December 21, 2010.  It is made up of 48 women who are all from the same group and the same village. 

Mrs. Amina S., standing, at the far right of the photo, and shown in the inset, is President of the Banc Villageois. She is 51 years old, married, and the mother of 7 children. She is  a seamstress by profession, an activity she has carried out for more than 10 years. She owns a workshop where she makes clothes. This new loan will allow her to expand the business and increase her revenue. Her goal is to support her husband in meeting the family's needs.

loans.use: To buy fabric and sewing supplies

loans.name: Nezikokolima Kitega Women's Group-Lugazi

texts.en:
Salama N., 36, has been operating her tailoring business in Kitega-Lugazi for seven years now. Before this enterprise, this happily married mother of six was more preoccupied with farming as a means of subsistence.

Salama says she began this business with her own savings, unlike many of her contemporaries who rely on bank loans. Her niche in the market has been growing, and she attributes this to her good relationship skills and word of mouth. The determination and diligence she has personified has seen her make significant headway in her operations, especially as regards being able to sell her clothes beyond Lugazi. 

Weekly, this business generates her 70,000 shillings, and she says with this loan, she is going to buy new textiles for making clothing.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing material

loans.name: Jennie  America

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SUMAC SONCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jennie América; ella tiene 57 años D. edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia es profesora cesante D. educación primaria, ella trabajo años para el estado y ahora esta dedicándose a su familia, la socia es una persona bien alegre y entusiasta y tiene todas las ganas D. seguir apoyando a sus hijos en especial a su hijo mayor que necesita para su maestría. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la pagar la maestría D. su hijo mayor. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota
texts.en:
The member belongs to the SUMAC SONCCO Communal Bank, located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

She is Jennie America. She is 57, married, and has 2 children. She is an unemployed elementary teacher who worked for the state for years and is now dedicating herself to her family. Jennie is a very happy and enthusiastic person, and has every desire to continue supporting her children, especially her oldest child who needs money for a master's degree.

She is requesting this loan to pay for her oldest child's master's degree.

She is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of the quotas.

loans.use: to pay her oldest child's tuition.

loans.name: Noshad Liaqat Ali's Group

texts.en:
Noshad is married to L. A. and lives in Pakpattan, Pakistan, a city famous for its agricultural industry. She has been living there with her family for over 25 years. Her husband is involved in an animal sales business. He buys animals from the animal market, raises them up and then sells them to customers. His customer base is butchers and he earns a good income by providing them with animals. He has been engaged in this business for ten years and is an expert in his field.
Noshad has a daughter and three sons. Two of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting an education while the others stay at home. Noshad supports her family financially by doing embroidery work. She learned this art at a young age and it is now paying off. She is also a very good housewife and performs her household responsibilities very well.
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy animals (goats) and raise them up to sell at a good profit. He will also use some of the money to buy animal feed. Noshad is confident that after the loan investment her husband’s business will grow further and make even more income than before. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a meeting. Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Noshad.

loans.use: To buy animals and animal feed

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SUMAC SONCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gloria; ella tiene 57 años D. edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica a la venta D. ropa ella viaja hasta la ciudad D. Lima para luego distribuirlo a sus amistades y familiares también trae D. allá artefactos como licuadoras, cámaras fotograficas, planchas entre otros más, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio y D. esta manera la socia saca a su familia adelante.  

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  más mercadería para su negocio y para pagar sus pasajes hasta la ciudad D. Lima.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota
texts.en:
The member belongs to the SUMAC SONCCO Communal Bank, located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

She is Mrs. Gloria. She is 57, married, and has 2 children. She sells clothing and travels to the city of Lima in order to later distribute the clothing to her friends and family. She also brings back articles such as blenders, cameras, and irons, among other items. She has had this business for a long time and this is how she gets her family ahead.

She is requesting this loan to purchase more merchandise for her business and to pay the fares for her trips to Lima.

She is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of her quotas.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for her business and to pay the fare for her trips to Lima.

loans.name: Paul Ngugi

texts.en:
Paul Ngugi N. is 47 years old and married to Esther Wairimu, who contributes to the family income. 

He owns a passenger vehicle for his public transport business. He has been in the business for about 10 years with an income of KES. 30,000 per month.

This is his second loan from KADET Ltd. He successfully repaid the previous one. Someday, he hopes to own a bus to increase his profit margin and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To service the vehicle

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SUMAC SONCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Florentina; ella tiene 39 años de edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como cremas, perfumes, colonias, entre otros más la socia lleva ya un buen tiempo con este negocio y le gusta ya que le trae muchas satisfacciones una de ellas es que puede estar más tiempo con sus hijos sin necesidad de tener un horario, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería para su negocio y así poder tener más variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
The member belongs to the SUMAC SONCCO Communal Bank, located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

She is Mrs. Florentina. She is 39, married, and has 2 children. She sells beauty products such as creams, perfumes and cologne, among other items. She has had this business for some time now and she likes it because there are many good things about it. For one, she gets to spend more time with her children without having a schedule. She is a very happy person with a great desire to succeed.

Florentina is requesting this loan to purchase more merchandise for her business in order to have a greater variety of products to offer her customers.

She is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of her quotas.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for her business in order to have a greater variety of products to offer her customers.

loans.name: Sarah Njeri

texts.en:
Sarah Njeri is a 46-year-old widowed lady. She has been growing tea for about 20 years with an income of 4,000 KES a month. 

She has never borrowed from any other MFI, and this is her first loan from KADET LTD, which she intends to use to buy farm inputs and fertilizer. She hopes to buy a car and improve her standard of living in the future.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Norma  Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SUMAC SONCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Norma María; ella tiene 57 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia se dedica a su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros productos más la socia lleva años con este su negocio el cual le está yendo muy bien y espera poder seguir asi, la socia mediante este negocio saca a su familia adelante ella es una buena persona alegre, optimista y con 
muchas ganas de seguir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería para su negocio para poder abastecer a todos sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Norma Maria belongs to the SUMAC SONCCO Communal Bank. 

She is 57, married, and has 3 children. She has a grocery store where she sells basic staples such as rice, sugar and milk, among other items. She has had this business for several years and it is going very well. She hopes to be able to continue, as she uses this business to get her family ahead. She is a good, happy and optimistic person with a great desire to succeed.

She is requesting this loan to purchase more merchandise for her business in order to provide everything that her customers want.

She is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of her quotas.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for her business in order to supply the needs of all of her customers.

loans.name: Sop Serigne Saliou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP SERIGNE SALIOU est né depuis le 14 décembre 2008. Il est composé de 15 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Elles sont unies par des liens de voisinage. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de KEUR SERIGNE BARRA

Madame OULEYMATOU S. à droite de la photo, emmitouflée d'une écharpe noir parsemée de fleurettes vertes et bleues est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 54 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de 04 autres qui lui sont confiés par des proches. 

Elle est vendeuse de friperie. Elle s'approvisionne au marché central de Louga pour revendre dans son quartier. 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement afin d'accroitre ses bénéfices. 

Son objectif est d'agrandir son commerce et de renforcer son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Serigne Saliou was created on December 14, 2008. It is composed of 15 women, all living in the same neighborhood and knowing each other because they are neighbors. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois of Keur Seigne Barra.

Mrs Ouleymatou S., to the right on the picture and wearing a black scarf with green and blue flowers sewn all over it, chairs the group. She is 54 years old, married and the mother of six children. In addition, family members have entrusted four other children to her care.

She sells second-hand clothes. She gets her supplies at the central market in Louga and resells them in her neighborhood. Her new loan will enable her to bolster her inventory level and increase her earnings. Her objective is to expand her business and strengthen her savings level.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
Gonzalo es transportista publico, tiene un taxi que funciona como Trufi inter-ciudad La Paz  - El Alto. Tiene dos hijos de 2 y 7 años de edad;, vive en su casa propia en la zona Tilata de la ciudad de El Alto.
El crédito que solicita será utilizado para la compra de un motor y una caja de transmisión para su movilidad y así continuar trabajando y cubrir la manutención de su familia.

 Es el tercer crédito con IMPRO y el primer via Kiva.
texts.en:
Gonzalo provides public transit in his taxi which functions as an inter-city minibus between La Paz and El Alto. He has two children ages two and seven. He lives in his own home in the Tilata neighborhood in the city of El Alto. 

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy an engine and a gearbox for his vehicle so that he can continue working and support his family. 

This is his third loan with field partner IMPRO and his first with Kiva.

loans.use: Purchase an engine and a gearbox for his taxi.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah N. lives in the Kisaasi Nsimbi Ziwoome neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has five children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sister’s grandchildren). She lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication, school fees and food for the family.
Sarah has a retail business selling phones. She has been in this business for over ten years, and works seven days of the week. Sarah sells her products in a retail shop. She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more mobile phones, phone batteries, chargers and sim cards. Sarah's main business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to build more rental rooms and to start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more mobile phones, phone batteries, chargers and sim cards

loans.name: Sudaj

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC SONCCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr.Sudaj; el tiene 25 años de edad y es conviviente  y tiene 1 hijo; el socio se dedica  a su negocio de tienda de abarrotes el vende diferentes productos entre ellos golosinas, productos de primera necesidad, fideos, aceite entre otros mas, el socio lleva un buen tiempo con este negocio a la vez el socio es guía de turismo pero por ahora no ejerce su carrera ya que le falta graduarse y mediante este trabajo está ahorrando para su graduación.

El socio solicita el préstamo para implementar su negocio de tienda de abarrotes. 

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “SUMAC SONCCO". The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Mr.Sudaj. He is 25 years old, lives with his partner and has one son. The member is dedicated to his grocery store business where he sells different products including sweets, convenience store items, noodles and oil among other things. The member brings experience to this business, at the same time the member is a tourist guide, but for now he isn't using his career because he still needs to graduate. In the mean time he is working and saving for his graduation.

The member is requesting the loan to begin his grocery store business. 

The member is happy because of the loan and he promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: The member requests the loan to begin his grocery store business.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José es transportista publico, tiene un taxi que trabaja como trufi con ruta fija  La Paz – El Alto. Está casado y  tiene tres hijos de 18, 14 y 7 años de edad; vive en la casa de sus suegros en la zona Kollasuyo de la ciudad de La Paz. Su esposa es comerciante y tiene una tienda de abarrotes.
El crédito que solicita será usado para la compra de un motor y caja de cambios para su movilidad; de esta manera continuará trabajando normalmente.
 Es el tercer crédito con IMPRO y el primer via Kiva.
texts.en:
Jose is a public transport driver. He has a taxi and he works on an established route in La Paz - El Alto. He is married and he has three children, aged 18, 14, and 7. He lives in a house belonging to his in-laws in the community of Kollasuyo in the city of La Paz. His wife is a merchant who has a grocery store. 

The loan requested will be used to purchase an engine and a cash register for his car. This way he will be able to keep working normally. 

This is his third loan with Impro (Kiva Field Partner) and the first through Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase an engine and a cash register.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomás vive en casa propia en la zona Pasankeri, de la ciudad de La Paz, es casado y tiene tres hijos menores de edad, el señor es comerciante, y su esposa también es comerciante  con los ingresos que obtienen se mantienen.
El crédito será utilizado para compra de materiales como arena, cemento, ladrillos, para la construcción de dos habitaciones.

Por su estudio socio económico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Tomas lives in his own home in the community of Pasankeri in the city of La Paz. He is married and he has three young children. He is a merchant, as his wife is a merchant also, and with both incomes they are able to support themselves. 

This loan will be used to purchase materials such as sand, cement, and bricks to build two bedrooms. 

His socio-economic analysis qualifies him for a new loan.

loans.use: To purchase bricks, cements, and sand to build two bedrooms.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah N. lives in the Kisaasi Nsimbi Ziwoome neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has seven children, three of whom attend school.  Deborah has a pub business, which she has been doing for over 10 years. She works seven days a week. Deborah sells her products in a shop by means of wholesale/retail.  She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy  more crates of beer and soda and jerrycans of local gin.     

The main business challenges for Deborah include transportation and seasonality challenges.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to build her own house and to start selling wholesale only.   Deborah lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and food.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of beer and soda and jerrycans of local gin

loans.name: Sirley

texts.es:
Sirley vive en casa de su padre en la zona Llojeta, de la ciudad de La Paz, es casada y tiene dos hijos menores de edad, la señora atiende una librería de barrio,  con los ingresos que obtienen se mantienen.
El crédito será utilizado para la construcción, cementado de patio en su vivienda.

Por su estudio socio económico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Sirley lives in a house belonging to his father, located in the community of Llojeta in the city of La Pas. She is married and she has two young children. She has a bookstore in her neighborhood and she is able to support her family with this income. 

The loan will be used for the construction and cement flooring for a patio in their home. 

Her socio-economic analysis qualifies her for a new loan.

loans.use: To build a patio in her home.

loans.name: Wcsl Pri Kapethe Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Sierra Leone, is pleased to present the teachers of the WCSL Primary School in Kapethe, a village in northern Sierra Leone. This school was founded in 1973 by the Weslyan Mission to educate the children of Kapethe village and neighboring villages. The school is currently staffed with 10 teachers and has an enrollment of 225 pupils. This is not the first loan that teachers of this institution have borrowed from Kiva lenders 

Jonathan L. J. (pictured in the back row, second from left) is the head teacher at the school and leader of this group. His is 43 years old and was born in the village of Gerihun. Jonathan is married has six children, all of whom attend school.  He has been in the teaching profession for 30 years. Jonathan is requesting for a loan of 2,000,000 SLL in order to pay school fees for his children. 

School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, comes to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish some tasks that they would otherwise have not being able to accomplish with their salaries alone. With the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in a business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a chromate cobalt dental appliance..

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
La señora Máxima es soltera y tiene un hijo, vive en casa de sus hermanos ya hace mucho tiempo, la casa esta ubicada en la zona alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.
La cliente cuenta con una tienda en la cual vende ropa para mayores y niños, en una zona comercial de La Paz.
El crédito lo utilizara para la compra de mercadería y así tener productos surtidos en la tienda y poder mejorar sus ventas. Es así como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Maxima is single and she has a son. She has lived in a house belonging to her siblings for a long time. The house is located in the community of Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz. 

She has a store from where she sells clothing for adults and children, located in a commercial region in La Paz. 

The loan will be used to purchase merchandise in order to have a variety of products for her store and to perceive better sales. This is how she earns an income for her household. 

This is her first loan and her socio-economic analysis is positive and she is eligible to access a loan.

loans.use: To purchase articles of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
El señor Ramiro es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres ya hace mucho tiempo, la casa esta ubicada en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.
El cliente trabaja manejando maquinaria pesada (un montacargas) en una empresa de construcción, de  la cual el dueño es su primo; Ramiro también se encarga aparte de los contratos de trabajo de la empresa.
El crédito lo utilizara para la compra de una computadora para su casa. Es así como obtiene sus ingresos para su hogar.
Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Ramiro is single and he has no children. He has lived with his parents for a long time. The house is located in the community of Pasankeri in the city of La Paz. 

He drives heavy machinery (a front-end loader) for a construction company, of which his cousin is the owner. Ramiro is also responsible for the company's work contracts. 

The loan will be used to purchase a computer for home. This is how he earns an income for their household.

This is his first loan and his socio-economic analysis is positive and he is eligible to access a loan.

loans.use: To purchase a computer for his children.

loans.name: Sop Serigne Babacar Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP SERIGNE BABACAR est créé le 15 décembre 2008. Il est composé de 15 femmes du même quartier et qui ont des liens d'amitié et de parenté. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de KEUR SERIGNE BARRA

Madame MAME LAT F. M. debout à l'extrême droite de la photo, les bras croisés est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 32 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'un garçon de 02 ans. 

Elle fait du commerce. Elle achète des tissus, des chaussures et d'autres articles destinés à la vente. Elle est très expérimentée dans ce domaine d'activité pour l'avoir menée depuis plusieurs années

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer ses activités et d'accroitre ses bénéfices

Son objectif est de renforcer son activité et son niveau d'épargne
texts.en:
The solidarity group SOP SERIGNE BABACAR was created on December 15, 2008.  It is comprised of fifteen women from the same area who are tied by friendship and kinship. The group is part of the Banc Villageois of Keur Serigne Barra.  

Ms. MAME LAT F. M., standing on the far right in the photo with her arms crossed, is the group’s leader .   She is 32 years old, married, and the mother of two boys. She works in commerce.  She buys fabrics, shoes, and other goods for resale purposes.  She is highly experienced in this business domain for having worked at it for several years.  

Her new loan will enable her to bolster her business and to increase her profits.  Her goal is to improve her work and her savings.

loans.use: Buying shoes, fabrics, and a variety of goods

loans.name: Eshrat's Group

texts.en:
Eshrat comes from Pakpattan, a small city in Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family for over 5 years. She is a working lady and is involved in making artificial flowers. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband. She takes orders from different gift shops and supplies them with finished goods to earn a good income for her family.  

Her husband’s name is M. I. and he operates a grocery shop in the market. His shop is located in the busiest market where he deals with a good number of customers every day. Eshrat is the mother of three sons and two daughters. All of them are illiterate and stay at home. Eshrat couldn’t provide them with education due to poor financial conditions. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk to put in his shop to increase his sales. Eshrat is hopeful that after putting more stock in his shop, her husband will be able to offer a greater variety of products to his customers and make more income which will result in a better standard of living for her family. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In her previous loan year, she established a good credit record and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady  raising her hand is Eshrat.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine N. lives in the Kisaasi Nsimbi Ziwoome neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 2 children, both of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her mother).    Justine has a retail shop.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Justine sells her products in a shop, retail.    

Justine has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cooking oil.  She also generates additional income through frying "chapats" and "samosas".The main business challenges for Justine include transportation and seasonality challenges.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a supermarket.  

 Justine   lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include medication, school fees, and feeding the family

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and jerrycans of cooking oil

loans.name: Seydina Mouhamad Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SEYDINA MOUHAMAD est né le 14 décembre 2008. Toutes le femmes qui composent le groupe sont du même quartier. Elles ont formé leur groupe par voisinage et par des liens d'amitié et de parenté. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de KEUR SERIGNE BARRA

Madame MBARK. F. debout à l'extrême droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 46 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants en charge. 

Elle de l'embouche bovine. Elle achète des sujets frêles qu'elle engraisse pour revendre au bout de 4 à 5 mois
Parallèlement elle fait du petit commerce

Avec son prêt elle va renforcer ses activité afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille
texts.en:
The Seydina Mouhamad solidarity group was created on December 14, 2008. It is composed of women who are all from the same area, and who came together as neighbors and through ties of kinship. The group is part of the Banc Villageois KEUR SERIGNE BARRA.

Mrs. MBARK. F., standing on the far right of the photo, is the group leader. She is 46 years old, married, and the mother of three children who are still in her care.

Her activity is cattle fattening. She buys frail animals, which she fattens and resells after four to five months. As a sideline, she is also engaged in small trade.

With her loan, she will strengthen her business in order to increase her profits. Her goal is to assist her husband in providing for their family.

loans.use: To buy oxen

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo y una de sus 2 hijos  en su casa propia. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la costura de mandiles para amas de casa, su principal herramienta de trabajo es su maquina de coser; desde entonces trabaja en el taller de costura que tiene en su misma casa. Por otro lado, su  hermana le ayuda en la comercialización de estos mandiles, llevándolos a distintos lugares y ciudades aledañas a su zona. Esta forma de realizar su negocio le ha traído buenas ganancias que recompensan las horas arduas de trabajo que realiza, es por eso que en adelante desea implementar con más maquinas de coser y otras herramientas para su taller de costura. Es el séptimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de mas telas.
texts.en:
Antonia is 48 years old and she lives with her husband and their 2 children in their own home. For the past 10 years she has made aprons for housewives. Her main working tool is her sewing machine. She then she has worked in her sewing shop, located in her house. 

Her sister helps her sale the aprons, taking them to various locations and distant cities in the region. She has managed to earn a good income, a reward for her arduous hours of work. In the future she hopes to purchase more sewing machines and other tools for her sewing shop. This is her seventh loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is very happy to know she has the financial support. She has demonstrated responsibility with her payments and she also enjoys being a member of her communal bank. All of the other members are responsible and they are team players. She is thankful to all those individuals who will contribute to the loan she requests. It will be very useful in the development of her business. The loan she requests will be invested in the purchase of more fabrics.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca N. lives in the Kisaasi Nsimbi Ziwoome neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 12 children, eight of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (foster children).

 Rebecca has a poultry farm. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Rebecca sells her products from home, wholesale.  Rebecca has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use  to buy more bags of chicken feed and chicks, and boxes of soap and cooking oil. The main business challenges for Rebecca include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own 2000 chickens. 

Rebecca lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and  piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include medication, school fees and feeding the family .

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed and chicks

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her son’s construction supply slaes business. With the loan, he will buy cement, bricks and sand, etc. and improves the sales of his business.  

Khursheed is a widow. She lives with her 2 sons in a 3-room brick house in a city called Pakpattan, located in Punjab, Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry.  She has had a very difficult life since the death of her husband and in raising her children alone. Now both of her sons have become young men and are doing their businesses. Khursheed spends most of her time at home and takes care of her household responsibilities. 

She is very hopeful about the positive growth of her son’s business.  She wants to marry him off and hopes that an increased income will help her save some money for this purpose. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit record and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Khursheed.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for construction supply sales business

loans.name: Leoncie

texts.en: Leoncie is 33 years old, and she has three children. The youngest is five years old while the eldest is 9 years old. Leoncie sells children's second-hand clothes, and she is requesting this loan in order to buy more clothing to sell. With the profits she plans to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: Buying second-hand children's clothes for resale

loans.name: Bertila

texts.es: Bertila tiene 55 años, vive en compañía D. su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más D. 35 años se dedica al comercio, en un inicio vendía frutas, después vio conveniente vender gelatina que ella misma prepara y cuya herramienta principal es su refrigeradora. Todos los días por las mañanas sale a vender gelatina, caminando largos trayectos y más en lugares muy transitados. Afirma que los días en donD. tiene mayores ventas es cuando es un día caluroso, ahora se encuentra en verano, tiempo que le favorece para vender más. Se siente muy contenta y motivada D. ver que después D. largas horas D. trabajo regresa a su casa este postre, lo cual hace ver que ha tenido buenas ventas. Por ahora desea mejorar su negocio con nuevos implementos para la preparación D. gelatina. Es el octavo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá comprar más ingredientes y envases descartables al por mayor.
texts.en: Bertila is 55 years old and she lives together with her husband and their 4 children in their own home. She has been a merchant for more than 35 years. She started out selling fruits but later she started selling gelatins that she maD. herself. Her main work tool is the refrigerator. Every day she sets out to sell her gelatins, walking long distances to reach the most visited areas. She makes the most sales on very hot days, and now that it is summer the weather is helping her to sell more. She is very happy and motivated to come home after long hours of work and to see that this dessert has yielded good sales. She wishes to improve her business with new implements to make her gelatins. This is her eighth loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner), and she is very happy to know she has financial support. She has always demonstrated responsibility with her payments and she enjoys being a member of her communal bank. The other members are responsible team players. She is thankful to all those individuals who will contribute to the loan she requests. It will be very useful in the development of her business. The loan she requests will be used to purchase more ingredients and disposable containers in wholesale.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and disposable containers.

loans.name: Venatie

texts.en: Venatie is 32 years old. She has three children, the youngest being 4 months old, while the eldest is 6 years old. Venatie, together with her husband, owns a driving school, and she is requesting a loan in order to buy another motorcycle for their driving school. Venantie’s husband works at their driving school, and they have been running this business for six years. She plans to buy a tailoring machine to open up a tailoring workshop.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle for the driving school

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane N. lives in the Nalukolongo neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has six children, all of whom are in school. Jane   has a business selling bark cloth. She has been in this business for five years and works seven days a week. Jane retails her products at the market. Jane has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more supplies of bark cloth. Jane's main business challenges are competition and seasonality. Her goal for her business is to start going to Masaka villages for bark cloth. Jane lives in a home that she owns, where she has access to electricity but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication, school fees, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of bark cloth

loans.name: Sheema's Group

texts.en:
Sheema lives with her family in a small city of Pakistan called Pakpattan. She owns a two-room brick house there and has been living in it for the past four years.
  
She is a widow. Her husband died suddenly a few years ago. This was a very difficult time for her, but she recovered her sense and started a cloth-selling business to survive financially. Her clients are mainly people from her community who give her regular orders.
  
She has a son who runs a small grocery store adjacent to his home. He earns income through his shop, which offers daily-use items like cooking oils, rice, and spices to his customers.
  
Sheema has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s business. With the loan, he will put more groceries in his grocery store and increase his sales by fulfilling the demands of his customers. 
 
Sheema is confident that her son will get a better income from his business after the loan investment. She is a regular loan user of Asasah, and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has proven herself a responsible client who always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.
  
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Sheema.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery store business

loans.name: Solidario Vida Group

texts.es:
Solidario Vida: Maria Julieta C. S. tiene 36 años tiene 3 hijos los tres estan estudiando en una escuela del gobierno su negocio es de venta de ropa nueva lo inicio hace 4 años ella tiene un local pequeño a la orilla de la callle en donde ella vive los vecinos ya la conocen y se hacercan desde muy temprano para comprar sus mercaderia, el prestamo que ella solicita es para comprar mas blusas, camisetas, y pantalones ya que en esta fecha la demanda de su mercaderia aumenta su sueño es expandirse y abrir un nuevo local en su municipio para obtener mejore ganacias y darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
El grupo vida esta integrado por dos señoras y un señor los tres se dedican a la venta de ropa nueva tienen su propio local y desean invertir mas en ropa, el sueño de ellos es crecer en su negocio obteniendo mayores ganancias para darles un mejor futuro a su hijos.
texts.en:
“Vida” (Life) Communal Bank 

Maria Julieta C. S. is 36 years old.  She has three children, and they attend a government school.  Her business is selling new clothes.  She started the business four years ago.  She has a small place on the side of the street where she lives.  Her neighbors now know her, and, starting very early, they come to buy her merchandise.

The loan she is requesting is to buy more blouses, t-shirts, and pants.  The demand for her merchandise is now rising.  Her dream is to expand and open a new place in her municipality.  She wants to do this to get better earnings and to improve her children’s future.

The Vida group is comprised of two women and one man.  The three of them sell new clothes, and they have their own places.  They wish to invest more in clothes.  Their dream is to see their businesses grow, to get greater income, and to give their children a better future.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida N. lives in the Nalukolongo neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school.  Farida has a retail business. She has been in business for less than one year, and she works seven days a week. Farida retails her products at the market. Farida has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, and boxes of soap. She also generates additional income through a restaurant. The main business challenges for Farida include competition and transportation. Her goal for her business is to start selling wholesale only. Farida lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication, school fees, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, and boxes of soap

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran is a caring lady who operates a sewing business at her home to supplement the income of her family. She sews clothes for neighboring customers and earns income. She is an expert in her work and can sew designer and non-designer dresses easily. Her quality work helps her to attract many customers, and she receives regular orders every month. 

She lives in Pakpattan, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, and known for its agriculture industry. She owns a two-room brick house, where she has been living with her family for the past 15 years.  

She is married to M. A., who is a painter by profession and paints houses and buildings on contract.

Sughran has two sons and two daughters. Her eldest son is a welder, while the others stay at home and don’t do anything.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy paint boxes of different shades, along with paintbrushes, which will help him to produce quality work and to maximize his profits.
  
Sughran is hopeful that an investment will be a good step towards the positive growth of her husband’s business. She is a regular loan user of Asasah, and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has proven herself a responsible client who always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with the book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sughran.

loans.use: To buy paint boxes and paintbrushes for a painting business

loans.name: Señor Nazareno Group

texts.es: Hedibia es una de las 8 socias de la alcancía Comunal  “Señor Nazareno “. Es  casada y a sus 50 años de edad tiene dos menores hijos dependientes de ella y de su conyugue. Se dedica a la venta de  frutas, bebidas gaseosas y confitería aledañamente a la zona donde reside y como ambulante ofrece sus productos en lo peajes donde transitan muchos camiones  de carga pesada  que viajan al centro del país. Esta actividad es emprendida desde niña pues los pobladores de la zona aprovechan la oportunidad de tener  una zona  transitada por muchos vehículos incluso para hacer turismo interno en nuestro país como nos manifiesta Hedibia  su finalidad es obtener ganancias de sus ventas para educar a sus hijos menores. Hasta ahora a logrado mejorar su vivienda y sueña con ahorrar para comprar un auto y ponerlo a trabajar en transporte público de pasajeros. Podemos apreciar a 6 de los integrantes en plena reunión de desembolso, lamentablemente el acceso a su anexo de Corcona le dificultó la llegada a tiempo de  Rolando y Madeleyne por lo cual se están publicando sus fotografías adjunta a la del grupo. Todos están integrados en el sistema de Prosperidad y son personas responsables,  orgullosas de sus negocios y quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Hedibia is one of the 8 members of the “Señor Nazareno" Communal Bank. She is married and at the age of 50 has two young children who depend on her and her husband. She sells fruit, pop and snacks on the streets around the zone where she lives. She offers her products at the toll gates where many heavy cargo trucks pass through on their way to the center of the country. She learned this business as a child, as the citizens of the area take advantage of the opportunities inherent in living in an area with a lot of traffic, including tourist traffic. Hedibia's goal is to make an income from her sales to educate her children.

In the photo, we can see 6 of the members in the payment meeting. Unfortunately, the difficulty in getting to Corcona meant that Rolando and Madeleyne were not able to arrive on time, so we are putting their photos next to the group. All of the members in the Prosperidad system are responsible people who are proud of their businesses and want to succeed.

loans.use: to purchase fruit, pop, snacks (peanuts, beans), and plantain chips.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Pictured here is Marie K., a small-scale businesswoman in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. Born in Makeni city about 56 years ago, Marie is married to a trader and the couple has one child. 
 
Marie sells drinks and DVD players. She has been a businesswoman for seven years now. With a loan of 5,000,000 Sierra Leone leones, she will expand her business by buying more drinks and DVD players to add to her current ones.

loans.use: Buy more drinks and DVD players to add to her current ones

loans.name: Touba Dabaye Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois de TOUBA DABAYE est créé le 28 décembre 2010. Il vient de recevoir son premier financement avec CAURIE-MF. Il est composé de 36 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Elles sont unies par des liens de solidarité très solides.

Madame PENDA N. debout tout à fait à droite de la photo est responsable du Banc Villageois. Elle est âgée de  26 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Elle a aussi la charge d'une de ses nièces. 

Elle fait de la broderie de draps de lit. Elle maitrise bien cette activité pour l'avoir pratiquer depuis plusieurs années. En tant que paysanne elle fait aussi de l'agriculture. 

Son premier prêt avec CAURIE-MF lui permettra d'acheter des tissus et des fournitures de broderie afin de pouvoir faire l'extension de son activité

Son objectif est de soutenir son mai dans la prise en charge de la famille, de participer au payement de la scolarité des enfants et de renforcer son épargne
texts.en:
The Banc Villageois of TOUBA DABAYE was created on December 28, 2010. It has just received its first financing with CAURIE-MF and is comprised of 36 women from the same village. They are united by sturdy ties of solidarity.  

Ms. PENDA N. (standing at the far right in the photo) is the leader of the Banc Villageois. She is 26 years old, married, and the mother of four children to support. She also has one of her nieces in her care.

Ms. N. embroiders bed sheets. Having worked at it for several years, she is mastering this business nicely. As a peasant, she is a farmer as well. Her first loan with CAURIE-MF will enable her to buy cloth and some supplies for embroidery in order to expand her business.  

Her goal is to support her husband in supporting the family, to help cover schooling costs, and to bolster her savings.

loans.use: Buying fabrics and supplies for embroidery

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista K. lives in the Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has four children, two of whom are in school.  

Teopista has a business of selling yellow and sweet bananas. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Teopista sells her products at the market, by means of retail.    

Teopista has requested from MCDT SACCO a loan of 50,0000 Ugandan Shillings, which she will use to buy more bunches of sweet and yellow bananas. The main business challenges for Teopista include competition and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on a wholesale basis only and to start buying from farmers directly. 

Teopista lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication, school fees, utility bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of yellow and sweet bananas

loans.name: Dora Glicet

texts.es:
Dora Clicet tiene 49 años de edad tiene 6 hijos mayores de edad, es casada ella inicio su negocio hace 10 años, con el apoyo económico del esposo ya que en la colonia donde vive no vendían verduras ni productos de consumo diario, los cuales le generaron ganancias,  obtuvo un crédito con el cual logro instalar una mini tienda obteniendo mas ganancias y pudo ampliar la tienda, además vende comida (tamales y chuchitos) los fines de semana. En el negocio es ayudada por las hijas. 

Ella solicita FAPE que la siga apoyando con un crédito para seguir adelante y poder darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dora Clicet is 49 years old, and she has six grown children.  She is married.  She started her business ten years ago with financial support from her husband.  She started because no one in her neighborhood sold vegetables or daily consumption products, which generate income for her.

Using a loan that she got she managed to set up a mini store.  With the increase in earnings she was able to expand the store and sell food (different types of tamales) on the week-ends. Her daughters help her with the business.

She asks that FAPE continue supporting her with a loan.  She wants the loan in order to get ahead and be able to give her children a better future.

loans.use: To buy daily consumption food products

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther M. lives in the Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has five children, all of whom are in school. 

Esther has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for less than one year, and she works seven days out of every week. Esther sells her products from home, by means of retail. She also generates additional income through a canteen.

Esther has requested a loan of 50,0000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO. She will use it to buy more bags of charcoal and merchandise for her canteen. The main business challenges for Esther include competition and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on wholesale basis only and to buy a plot of land. 

Esther lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include medication, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal and merchandise like sugar, salt and bread for her canteen

loans.name: Cheukh Khassane Aidara Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité CHEUKH KHASSANE AIDARA est créé le 09 décembre 2008. Il regroupe 16 femmes qui sont toutes du même village. Elles sont pratiquement toutes liées par la parenté. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de TOUB. SERAS 2

Madame NDEYE F. debout à l'extrême droit de la photo, emmitouflée d'une écharpe orange est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 55 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de deux autres enfants qui lui son confiés par des proches.

Elle fait de l'embouche ovine. Elle pratique cette activité depuis sont adhésion dans le Banc Villageois en 2008.

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d'acheter des mouton qu'elle va engraisser pendant 05 mois pour le revendre au 06è mois afin de pouvoir rembourser.

Son objectif est de renforcer son activité et son épargne
texts.en:
The Cheukh Khassane Aidara solidarity group was created on December 9, 2008. It is composed of 16 women who are all from the same area. Almost all of them share bonds of kinship. The group is part of the Banc Villageois of TOUB. SERAS 2.

Mrs. NDEYE F., standing on the far right of the photo and wrapped in an orange scarf, is the group leader. She is 55 years old, married, and the mother of seven children. She is also taking care of two other children entrusted to her by relatives.

Her business is cattle fattening. She has been engaged in this activity since she became a member of the Banc Villageois in 2008.

With her new loan, she will buy sheep which she will fatten over a period of five months for resale in the sixth month. This will allow her to repay the loan.

Her goal is to strengthen her business and increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty tiene 55 años, vive con su esposo y sus 5 hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a realizar bellos bordados, actividad que lo realiza desD. hace 41 años, esta experiencia le ha servicio para ser mas productiva diseñando nuevos modelos en sus bordados. Sus hijas la ayudan en esta tarea, siendo su casa, lugar que implementó para que sea un taller  artesanal. Lo que más le agrada D. su trabajo  es la tranquilidad que siente y las ganancias que le produce ya que esta labor a pesar D. durar un mes aproximadamente, por cada  falda  bordada y las aplicaciones que requiere como lentejillas e hilos dorados como plateados requiere D. mucha  precisión e hilos D. muchos colores. Una vez que ha terminado D. producir, su clientela  compra  muy satisfecha porque conocen D. la calidad D. su trabajo, para el futuro Betty  desea  tener mayor producción. Es el décimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. más materiales para sus bordados.
texts.en:
Betty, age 55, lives with her husband and their five children in her own house.  She has been making beautiful embroideries for 41 years.  Her experience has maD. her more productive in designing new patterns in her embroideries.  Her daughters help her with this work.  Her house is where she established her handicraft workshop.  

What pleases her most about her work is how peaceful she feels.  She also likes the income it produces for her.  She likes it even though it takes approximately a month of work to make one embroidered skirt and the required appliques like sequins and gold or silver threads.  It requires much precision and many colors of thread.  Once she has finished making the item, her customers are very satisfied with their purchase because they know the quality of her work.  In the future Betty wishes to have greater production.

This is her tenth loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She has always demonstrated herself to be responsible with her payments.  She is pleased to be a part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive.  She will use the requested loan to buy more materials for her embroidery.

loans.use: To buy different colors of thread

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria S. lives in the Kitawuluzi Lubaga road neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has three children, none of whom are in school.  

Maria has a business of selling phone usage and stationery. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works six days out of every week. Maria sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.  

Maria has requested a loan of 50,0000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to more SIM packs, airtime, books, pens and reams of papers. She also generates additional income through selling raw food.

The main business challenges for Maria include competition and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on a wholesale basis only. 

Maria lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, medication and feeding the family

loans.use: To buy more SIM packs, airtime, books, pens and reams of papers

loans.name: Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Fatima is a wife of M. A. and resides in Pakpattan, which is a small city of Pakistan famous for its agriculture industry. She owns a two-room brick house there and has been living in it with her family for over 10 years. 

Her husband is a painter by profession and paints walls and houses on contract. He makes contracts with different house owners and building owners and work for them on daily wages. 

Fatima is a midwife by profession and offers her services on an as-needed basis. 

She has given birth to a daughter and two sons. Her eldest son has a barbershop in the market, while the others are young and stay at home. Fatima couldn’t provide them an education due to poor financial conditions. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy paint boxes of different shades and paint brushes for expanding his painting business. The purchased items will make him able to fulfill the demands of the clients and to earn larger profits. 

He has  been doing this business for past 10 years and Fatima is confident that after the loan investment, her husband’s business will grow further and make him even more income every month. 

She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.  

Note: In the photo, the lady holding the Asasah Passbook is Fatima.

loans.use: To buy paint boxes and paint brushes for a painting business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 46 años, vive con su hijo y su madre en su casa propia. Desde hace 1 año vende cerveza, negocio que realiza desde su domicilio, es así que atiende a partir de la tarde hasta la noche. Siempre recibe la ayuda de su madre, ya que tiene buena acogida, es por ello que se esmera en brindar un  trato amable a sus clientes. Es así que cada cierto tiempo se abastece de mercadería, eso favorece en las ganancias. Ahora su propósito es  crecer su negocio e implementarla con más productos. Es su séptimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en cervezas y así podrá incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Gloria is 46 and lives with her child and mother in her own home. She has sold beer for one year from her home, working from the afternoon into the evening. Her mother always helps her, and the business is well-known. They take great care to offer good customer service, so every time that she stocks up on merchandise, she makes a better income.

She is now hoping to expand her business and stock it with more products. This is her seventh loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support, since she has always been responsible with her payments. Furthermore, she is happy to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very united people.

Gloria thanks those of you who will lend toward her loan, as it will be very useful in the progress of her business. With this loan, she will invest in the purchase of more merchandise (beer), and thus be able to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to stock up on more beer

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth tiene 26 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en su casa propia. Se dedica al comercio de juguetes y otros artículos de plástico, negocio que lo realiza desde hace 3 años. Su esposo la ayuda en este negocio, él la ayuda a vender sus productos de manera ambulante todos los días, siendo los fines de semana que tiene mayores ventas. Por otro lado su madre la ayuda en el cuidado de su bebe mientras sale ella a vender. Durante este tiempo en el negocio, vio por conveniente que su negocio es muy rentable. Asimismo considera que los productos que vende son muy demandados por su localidad  sobre todo en épocas navideñas  es por esta razón que desea en adelante tener una tienda bazar. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que la ayudara en el progreso de su negocio, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá comprar más mercadería para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Ruth is 26 and lives with her husband and child in her own home. She sells toys and other plastic items, a business which she has had for three years. Her husband helps her with the business. He helps her sell the products on the street every day, as on the weekends they make the best sales.

Her mother helps her by taking care of her baby while Ruth goes out to sell. The business is very profitable. Ruth says that the products that she sells are in great demand in her area, especially during the Christmas season. For this reason, she wants to have a general store in the future.

This is her first loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has a financial support that will help her with her business. Furthermore, she is happy to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are very responsible and united people. She thanks those people who will lend toward her loan, since it will be very helpful for her business. With this loan, she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more toys and plastic items

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Develop and promote its activity of shopkeeping

loans.name: Aida Esperanza

texts.es:
la sra. Aida Esperanza L. R. tiene 66 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo pupolar, tiene una pequeña pulperia en esu casa de habitacion, ahi vende todo lo relacionado con la canasta basica y tambien vende lacteos como ser queso, mantequilla y quesillo.
este negocio es su unica fuente de ingresos y esta ubicado en la calle principal del Barrio El Centro, es un lugar estrategico en El Municipio de Trojes ya que por aquí circulan muchas personas de diferentes aldeas y caseríos.
La Sra. López es muy conocida en la zona por ser una mujer de buenas costumbres.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia y asi surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aida Esperanza L. R. is 66 and sells common consumer products. She has a small convenience store in her home where she sells everything related to basic household items, as well as dairy products such as cheeses and butter.
This business is her only source of income. It is located on the main street of the El Centro Neighbourhood. This is a strategic location in the Trojes municipality, since there is a lot of pedestrian activity from many different neighbourhoods.
Mrs. L. is very well-known in the area as a woman of good character.
She will use this loan for the purchase of merchandise to stock her business.

loans.use: the purchase of rice, beans, sugar, butter, oil, ham, candles, matches, light bulbs, batteries, toilet paper, drinks, churros, candies, threads, oat cereal, pasta, sauces, cheese.

loans.name: Sonia Abigail

texts.es:
Sonia B. es casada, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales todos asisten a un colegio cercano a su casa, Sonia creo su negocio hace 2 años vendiendo saldos de ropa usada, debido a que su esposo se quedo sin trabajo y con el paso de los meses las ventas han generado ganancias y le han dado la oportunidad de comprar pacas (ropa americana) por mayor y ella las distribuye en los asentamientos cercanos al lugar donde ella vive, y esto ha generado mayor demanda en las ventas de ropa que ella necesita poder vender a todos sus acreedores pero para ello Sonia solicita un Prestamo a FAPE y Kiva para poder comprar 14 pacas mas ya que cada paca le cuesta Q. 1,000.00.
El sueño mas grande de Sonia es ver a su familia unida siempre y a sus hijos con un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Sonia B. is married and has 4 children who attend a school near to her house. Sonia created her business 2 years ago, selling used clothing, since her husband was out of work. As the months passed, her sales generated an income and provided her with the opportunity to purchase pacas (American clothing) wholesale. She distributes it to neighbourhoods near to where she lives. This has generated greater demand than she can satisfy, so Sonia is requesting a loan from FAPE and Kiva in order to buy 14 more pacas, as each costs Q. 1,000.00.
Her greatest dream is to see her family together forever, and for her children to have a better future.

loans.use: the purchase of clothing to sell

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 55 años, es viuda, y vive en compañía D. sus 5 hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a la venta D. productos básicos para la comida, desD. hace 4 años que posee una tienda en donD. ha logrado tener experiencia en el comercio, ya que desD. un inicio incursiono en esta actividad D. manera ambulante y distribuyendo sus productos a otras ciudades. En la actualidad su tienda se encuentra instalada en el interior D. su casa y en donD. sus hijos la ayudan en la atención. Su establecimiento abastece con productos D. primera necesidad a sus vecinos que gustoso consumen en su establecimiento debido a  al buena atención que ofrece  y esto hace que su negocio sea la preferida ante la competencia. Ante esto continuará esforzándose en incrementar el capital D. su negocio con más productos. Es el octavo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. más mercadería en productos D. primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 55 years old, a widow, and lives with her 5 children in her own home.  Her business is selling essential food products.  She has owned her store for four years and has gained a lot of experience in selling.  When she was just starting out in the business, she used to make her sales as an traveling saleswoman, distributing her products to other cities.

Currently, Yolanda's store is located in her home and her children help her to serve in it.  Her establishment supplies essential household products to her neighbors who happily buy from her thanks to the good customer service that she offers.  This makes them favor her store over the competition.  Yolanda will continue working hard to increase her business capital with more products.

This is Yolanda's eighth loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She has always shown herself to be responsible in making her loan repayments.  Yolanda likes being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  She would like to thank those people who will help to fund her loan as it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will invest the loan money in buying more merchandise, more essential household products.

loans.use: To buy more essential household products

loans.name: Sarwar Rasheed Tabbasum's Group

texts.en:
Sarwar lives in Pakpattan, a small city in Pakistan that is known for its agricultural industry. She lives with her family in a two-room brick house. Sarwar is a caring lady who prefers to stay at home and be responsible for her household. In addition to being a housewife, she sews at home to supplement her family’s income. Sarwar has done this work part time, but because she has gotten a very positive response from her customers, she has decided to dedicate herself to this work to full time since demand for her services is increasing. 

Sarwar has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah to buy a new sewing machine to improve her product quality and speed. Sarwar is hopeful that investing in her business will help it grow and improve her profits. In this photo, Sarwar is the woman holding the Asasah passbook.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
el sr. Juan Francisco G. F. tiene 47 años de edad, su negocio siempre a sido la venta de leña, pero el año pasado empezo a cultivar cafe y platanos y este negocio le estara dando los frutos para este año, tambien vende lacteos.
Juan es un sr. emprendedor y muy luchador, se a esforzado mucho para sacar adelante a su familia.
nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que sus cultivos estan floreciendo y piensa que este año tendra una produccion de cafe y platanos.
el credito lo utilizara para siembra de cafe en una nueva parcela, tambien comprara leña y lacteos.
Juan es una persona responsable y de buena conducta moral.
su meta es poder hacer que crezca su pequeña finca de cafe para tener buenas ganancias en un futuro.
texts.en:
Juan Francisco G. F. is 47 years old. He has always worked selling firewood, but last year he started growing coffee and bananas, which he will be harvesting this year. He also sells dairy products.
Juan is a motivated, diligent man who has worked hard to improve his family's lives.
He told us that he's very happy that his plantings are flowering, and he thinks that this year he will be able to harvest coffee and bananas.
He will use the loan to plant coffee on a new plot of land, as well as buying wood and dairy products.
Juan is an upright, responsible person.
His goal is to be able to expand his small coffee farm to have greater earnings in the future.

loans.use: Purchase firewood and dairy products

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa A. is a widow who takes care of five dependants. She sells kenkey (a fermented corn dish) and smoked fish at Elmina. Adjoa uses her income to provide for the well-being of her family. She will use her loan to purchase more fish to smoke and sell. Adjoa will reinvest the profits from her loan into expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish

loans.name: Alba

texts.es:
El solicitante es comerciante de la zona de Pilar, su negocio se halla situada en el Barrio San Antonio de esta  ciudad, esta en el ramo más de 15 años, realizando la venta de mercaderías de primera necesidad asi como fideos, harinas, carnes, verduras, frutas y otros, la misma es casada, vive en casa familiar.
Posee todas las comodidades necesarias para el bienestar de su casa, en dicho negocio se refleja que hay buenas ventas ventas, calidad de sus servicios, inmensas variedades de mercaderías para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientelas.
El cliente solicitó el préstamo para comprar mercaderías como, fideos, harina, arroz, verduras, frutas, y otros, ya que se le presentó un lote a un buen precio.
texts.en:
Alba J. has a business located in the San Antonio neighborhood of the city of Pilar. She's been in the business more than 15 years, selling staple goods such as noodles, flour, meats, vegetables, fruit, etc. She is married and lives with her family.
She has everything she needs for her family's wellbeing. She has good sales, gives good service, and has a wide variety of merchandise to meet her customers' demands.
She is requesting this loan in order to purchase products such as noodles, flour, rice, vegetables, fruit, and other items, since she has the opportunity to buy a lot at a good price.

loans.use: Purchase meat, flour, noodles, rice, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Georgina Cudjoe Araba

texts.en:
Georgina Cudjoe Araba M. is married and has eight dependants. She has been through senior high school. Georgina fries doughnuts to sell at Elmina and her husband is a mason. Georgina uses her income to help her husband pay for school fees and utility bills. 

In this picture, Georgina is scooping flour mixture into oil to fry her doughnuts. She will use her loan to buy flour and other ingredients to prepare doughnuts for sale. In the future, Georgina plans to reinvest her profit.

loans.use: to buy flour and ingredients

loans.name: Viviana

texts.en:
Viviana is a 38 year old mother who lives in Cartago, Costa Rica with her husband and three children. A current university student, Viviana is a multi-talented entrepreneur who has tried her hand at various types of work to support her family. She is adept in the arts of piñata making, card making, gift wrapping and seamstress work. Viviana is also passionate about children’s education and is studying to become a primary school principal. When her children were young, she was unable to attend classes. Now that they are older, Viviana takes care of her business from 6 am to 5 pm and then goes to class at night.
