Viviana runs a family business selling school supplies such as binders, papers, pens, etc. She will use her loan to purchase a photocopier to offer photocopying services to her customers. Viviana is confident that this type of service will be very popular with the local students as it is not offered by any other stores in the area, and she expects to increase her revenue. The loan consultant who has been working with Viviana and her family over the years describes her as a hardworking and entrepreneurial person who has goals and plans. Viviana and her husband work as a team and make decisions together. 

The main business obstacle Viviana faces is the slow rotation of inventory. To address this, she is beginning a publicity campaign and offering promotional deals to her customers. One of Viviana’s long-term goals is to open an internet café. This would increase revenue as well as provide the opportunity to create a job for one of her children or a community member.

loans.use: to purchase a photocopier

loans.name: Nana Adjoa

texts.en: Nana Adjoa A. is married with seven dependents. Her husband is a fisherman. Nana sells cosmetics at Elmina and moves her wares from one area to another. Nana has attained a senior high school education and helps her husband to pay for school fees and utilities. She will use her loan to provide working capital to expand her cosmetics business. In the future, Nana hopes to use her profits to build a shop.

loans.use: to provide working capital

loans.name: Cecilia Elizabeth

texts.es:
La joven Señora Cecilia Elizabeth U. C. es comerciante individual, se dedica a la venta de Ropa Americana clasificada, tiene mas de 2 años de tener su negocio, pero fue hasta en el mes de Diciembre del año pasado que estableció su negocio en un local, ya que antes lo realizaba de forma ambulante, su negocio iba creciendo rapido y se le hacia imposible mostrar la mercadería a sus clientes, entonces fue como decidio montar su negocio en un local y esta ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de El Paraíso, calle principal de mayor afluencia comercial.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar 2 fardos de ropa para surtir más su negocio, desea tener un buen surtido en ropa de calidad y tambien mejorar los precios de venta.
las ganancias las necesita para sacar adelante a su hijo.
texts.en:
Cecilia Elizabeth U. C. has worked selling used American clothing for more than two years. She used to sell door-to-door, but in December of last year she set up a shop. Her business had grown rapidly and it had become impossible to display her merchandise for her customers. So she set up a shop in downtown El Paraíso, on the main shopping street.
She will use the loan to buy two bundles of clothing to stock her store. She would like to have a good supply of quality clothing and be able to raise her prices. She needs the income to help her son get ahead in the world.

loans.use: Purchase two bundles of used clothing

loans.name: Tasmeena

texts.en:
Tasmeena lives in Pakpattan, a small city in Pakistan that is known for its agricultural industry. She is a talented woman who makes wooden trays to sell to utensil shops. Handmade items are considered very important and Tasmeena is very skillful in applying her talent. One of Tasmeena’s sons works on the Pakistan railway. Tasmeena was not able to provide for her son’s education, which is why he works hard for a low wage. 

Tasmeena is applying for a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. He is a blacksmith who makes iron rods to earn a living. He runs a shop in the local market and is known as an expert in his field. He has been operating his business for the past 15 years and has a number of customers. He will use the loan to buy iron to fill his orders and increase his profits. Tasmeena is hopeful that this investment will be profitable for her husband.

loans.use: to buy iron

loans.name: Yudi

texts.es: Yudy tiene 48 años, vive en compañía D. su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. DesD. hace 20 años se dedica a la  elaboración D. bordados artesanales sobre prendas típicas D. su zona, desD. entonces y en la comodidad D. su casa elabora D. manera muy tranquila los bordados. Este negocio le ha generado rentas muy provechosas, y más cuando hay festividades generalmente suceD. durante los meses D. junio y Julio. Disfruta D. su trabajo, ya que lo considera como una distracción, además que pone en práctica su habilidad D. combinar bien los colores en los bordados. Es por ello que continuará desempeñando esta actividad con miras a seguir progresando. Es su décimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en materiales que necesita para continuar elaborando  bordados.
texts.en: Yudy is 48 years old and lives with her husband and two children in their own home. For 20 years she has been making embroidered pieces on garments typical of her area. In that time, she has been doing embroidery very peacefully in the comfort of her home. This business has generated a very profitable income, and more when there are festivities, usually during the months of June and July. She enjoys her work, because she considers it a hobby, and in addition she puts into practice her ability to combine colors well in her embroidery. That is why she will continue doing this activity for the purpose of continue to get ahead. This is her tenth loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support, because she has always been responsible with her payments. She also enjoys being part of her community bank, because all of its members are responsible and supportive people. She thanks those people who will be part of the loan she is requesting, which will be very useful for her business' progress. She will use the loan she is requesting to purchase materials she needs to continue doing embroidery.

loans.use: Purchase thread and other materials to continue doing embroidery

loans.name: Adjoa Essoun Felicia

texts.en: Adjoa Essoun Felicia C. sells underwear, dresses, rice, soaps and other goods in Elmina. Adjoa has gone to a senior-high level of education. She is married and takes care of three children. Her husband is a fisherman. She has been in this trade for four years. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more underwear and dressses to increase the quantity of goods sold. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more underwear and dresses to increase the quantity of  goods sold.

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
Silvio tiene 42 años, está casado y tiene 3 hijos. Es comerciante desde hace más de 15 años, se dedica a la fabricación y venta de cuadros, espejos y botiquines, empezó vendiendo primeramente mercaderías ajenas, apenas pudo contar con un pequeño ahorro pudo hacerse  de capital y fabricar su propia mercadería, con la calidad aumentaba su margen de ganancias a sus productos, hoy día tiene clientela formada.  
Don Silvio agradece a fundación paraguaya y Kiva por el apoyo constante que les brinda para fortalecer su microempresa y a la vez espera recibir siempre tan valioso apoyo.
El crédito que solicita es para la compra de madera, láminas y espejos en plancha.
texts.en:
Silvio is 42 years old, married, and has 3 children. He has been a business man for more than 15 years. He manufactures and sells frames, mirrors, and cabinets. He first began selling other people's merchandise. He barely had any savings. He was able to raise capital and manufacture his own merchandise; with its quality he increased his products' profit margin. He now has an established clientele.
Mr. Silvio thanks the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for their constant support, which strengthens his micro-enterprise, and likewise hopes to always receive such valuable support.
The loan he is requesting is for purchasing wood, plates, and sheets of mirror.

loans.use: Purchase of wood, plates, and mirrors.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa K. sells fruits in Elmina. She is married to a farmer and has six dependents. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will serve as capital to buy more fruits to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a fruit shop.

loans.use: Her loan will serve as capital to buy more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba Y. sells a variety of things, some of which are jewelry, dresses and others.  Aba has attained senior high level of education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a taxi driver. She has been in this trade for four years. She assists her husband in providing the basic needs of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more goods for resale. She anticipates building a shop to sell her goods.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more goods for resale.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi E. is married and has four children. Esi sells food items in Elmina, which she has been doing for four years. Her husband is a farmer. Esi uses her income to assist her husband in feeding and clothing the children. Demand for other food items is increasing, and she is requesting the loan to purchase these items to expand her business. She plans to build a shop from the new profit.

loans.use: To purchase items to expand her business.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua K. is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a farmer. She sells porridge and secondhand clothing in Elmina. Ekua uses her income to assist her husband in taking care of the family. The loan will be used to buy additional maize to prepare porridge for sale. With the new profit from her expanded business, Ekua plans to educate her children.

loans.use: The loan will be used to buy additional maize to prepare porridge for sale.

loans.name: Manko Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité MANKO est créé le 28 juin 2010. Il est composé de 19 femmes qui sont toutes du même quartier. C'est un groupe très dynamique et solidaire. Leurs activités dominantes sont le petit commerce et l'élevage. 

Madame YAYE RAMA B., à l'extrême droit sur la photo, enroulée d'un pagne jaune est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 51 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants. Elle s'occupe également de sa petite fille.

Elle fait du petit commerce depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle s'approvisionne en savon, encens, pagnes tissés etc pour revendre dans son village.

Son prêt lui permettra de mieux développer son activité afin d'escompter des bénéfices plus importants.

Son objectif est de renforcer son épargne et de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille, par exemple la santé, la scolarité et la nourriture.
texts.en:
The Manko solidarity group was created on June 28, 2010. It is composed of 19 women, all living in the same neighborhood. This is a very dynamic and united group. Their main business activities is retail and raising livestock.

Mrs. Yaye Rama B., on the far right in the photo, wrapped in a yellow outfit, is the group’s leader. She is 51 years old. She is married and the mother of eight. She also takes care of her granddaughter.

She has been working as a small retailer for ove 10 years. She stocks up on soap, incense, traditional “pagnes” fabrics etc., in order to resell these wares in her village. This loan will allow her to grow her business and to increase her income. Her goal is to boost her savings and to help her husband provide for the family needs, such as  the costs of healthcare, schooling and food.

loans.use: Grown and promote her small business

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem M. A. is 45 years old, married to M. A., and has given birth to three children. They all left school and started to work in their teenage years to help financially support the family. The family lives in Kasur, which is a small city within Punjab, Pakistan. It is famous for its leather industry.

Milk sales have become the family's business since most of the members are involved in it. Naseem’s husband has some buffaloes at home that he milks early in the morning and then sells the milk to his neighboring clients. He has run his dairy for the past twenty years. Naseem’s eldest son sells buffalo milk, her middle child works in the fields and grows different crops, while her youngest son also sells milk.

Naseem works at home doing embroidery and stitchery work. She receives orders from her neighboring clients and is paid after completing the orders.

Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner Asasah to further expand her husband’s milk business. She is a regular borrower from Asasah; this is her fifth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit and never missed any meetings.

With the loan, Naseem will buy another buffalo to increase their dairy’s output of milk and to serve many more clients. She is hopeful that such an investment will improve her family’s business to a great extent.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo

loans.name: Jappo Liggueye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité JAPPO LIGGUEYE est créé le 09 décembre 2008 lors de l'inauguration de son Banc Villageois? Il est composé de 16 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même quartier. Elles se sont nouées par des liens d'amitié et ont comme dénominateur commun le culte du travail. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de TOUBA SERAS 2

Madame SEYNABOU N. debout à droite de la photo, vêtue de grand boubou orange est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. Elle a aussi la garde d'un enfant qui lui est confié par des proches.

Elle est éleveuse. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine. Elle achète des moutons qu'elle engraisse pendant 5 à 6 mois pour les revendre dans le marché ou dans son quartier

Avec son nouveau crédit elle pourra au moins acheter deux moutons qu'elle va emboucher

Son objectif est de subvenir à ses besoins personnels, de renforcer son épargne et son activité
texts.en:
The Jappo Liggueye solidarity group was created on December 9, 2008 at the inauguration of the Banc Villageois of Touba Seras 2, to which it belongs. The group is composed of 16 women from the same neighborhood. They share ties of friendship, and are also bound by the cult of work. 

Mrs. Seynabou N., standing at the right of the photo and wearing a large orange robe, is the head of the group. She is 42 years old, married, and the mother of four children who are still in her care. She also has custody of another child entrusted to her by relatives.

She is a cattle breeder who practices sheep fattening. She buys sheep to fatten over a period of five to six months for resale at the market or in her neighborhood.

She will use her new loan to buy at least two sheep for fattening. Her goal is to be able to support herself, strengthen her business, and bolster her savings.

loans.use: Buying a ram

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.es: El Sr. Rosendo es un hombre que trabajo desde sus 24 años de edad en rubro de transporte actividad donde le va muy bien, en la actualidad el Sr. Rosendo tiene 46 años de edad, casado con la señora Gipsi que se dedica a labores del hogar, tienen 2 hijos que se encuentran estudiando vive en casa familiar ubicado  en el barrio Oriental zona norte de la ciudad de Santa Don Rosendo utilizara el dinero del crédito para ya que el tiene un buen historial crediticio El cliente  manifestó su agradecimiento por la rapidez del crédito y lo bien que lo atendieron el la Institución.
texts.en:
Mr. Rosendo is a man who has worked in transportation since the age of 24. It is going very well. He is now 46 and married to Gipsi, who does the housework. They have 2 children who are in school. They live in the family home in the Oriental neighbourhood in the north of the city of Santa Don Rosendo.

He has a good credit history. He is grateful for how quickly he was approved and for the good service in the Institution.

loans.use: maintenance for his vehicle (auto body repair)

loans.name: El Rubi Group

texts.es:
el grupo El Rubi lo integran 3 mujeres, todas muy unidas y estan ubicadas en el Barrio las Flores de la ciudad de El Paraiso, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

la sra. Mayra Yolanda Z. es comerciante y su actividad principal es la venta de tajaditas de plátano, tiene mucha experiencia en fabricar tajaditas de platano fritas..
Doña Mayra es una mujer que a sabido ganarse a su clientela, por el buen sabor, la cantidad por porción y los precios que ella ofrece, además de la venta de tajaditas de plátano también se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo y sus derivados, esta actividad la realiza solamente los días sábados de cada semana.
Mayra utilizara el credito para la compra de platanos, aceite y sal.

la sra. Maria Rosario N. es comerciante y su actividad principal es la venta de golosinas.
Doña Maria es una mujer muy conocida en su comunidad por la actividad que realiza, ya que las golosinas que  vende son de muy buen sabor, cuenta con una gran clientela.
 además de los ingresos que percibe en su negocio cuenta con ayuda económica por parte de su esposo ya que el le envía remesas desde los Estados Unidos por lo que es notable que sus condiciones de vida son muy favorables. Pero esto no le quita el entusiasmo de trabajar. el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materia prima para elaborar sus golosinas.

La sra. Deysi Judith O. C. es comerciante y su actividad principal es la elaboración y venta de pan y rosquillas. Durante todo este tiempo Deysi a perfeccionado su técnica para la elaboración de rosquillas y pan logrando obtener muy buen sabor en su producto, tiene una gran clientela ya que su producto tiene gran demanda, ofrece precios bajos a los mayoristas, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materia prima y continuar elaborando su producto y cubriendo la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Rubi group is made up of three women who are very close to each other and live in the neighborhood of Las Flores in the city of El Paraíso.  Below is more information about the different work that they do.

Mayra Yolanda Z. is a merchant who sells sliced bananas.  She has a lot of experience making fried sliced bananas.  Doña Mayra won over customers with good flavors, good portion sizes, and good prices.  In addition to selling sliced bananas, she also sells pork on Saturdays.  Mayra will use this loan to purchase bananas, oil, and salt.

Maria Rosario N. is a merchant who sells sweets.  She is well known in her community for her work.  The sweets she sells are tasty, so she has a lot of customers.  In addition to the income she earns from her business, her husband sends money every month from the United States, so her living conditions are good.  However, she is still eager to work.  She will use this loan to purchase materials to make her sweets.

Deysi Judith O. C. is a merchant who makes and sells bread and pastries.  Deysi has been perfecting her bread and pastry making technique for a long time to create a good tasting product.  She has a lot of customers because there is a lot of demand for her products.  She offers low prices to wholesalers.  She will use this loan to purchase materials to make bread and pastries so that she can continue baking and meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: Purchase cheese, butter, sugar, bananas, oil, salt, tortillas, vegetables, meat, potatoes and yucca

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Huaquillay Group

texts.es:
Rosemary, tiene 41 años de edad, casada, tiene tres hijos de los cuales son menores, vive en la zona de Huaquillay, en el distrito de Comas. Hace cinco años que integra el grupo “Santa Rosa de Huaquillay”, formado por 9 integrantes, quienes la eligieron como secretaria del grupo. 
Hace nueve años Rosemary se dedica a la compostura de prendas,  desde los 18 años empezó a confeccionar y decidió poner su negocio, gracias a su negocio ha logrado su estabilidad económica, y apoya a su esposo en los gastos de alimentos.
  Su anhelo es que sus hijos sean profesionales. 
Con el préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en stock de prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Rosemary is 41 years old, married, and the mother of three small children. She lives in Huaquillay, in the district of Comas. Five years ago she joined the group Santa Rosa de Huaquillay, whose 9 members elected her to be secretary of the group.
For nine years Rosemary has earned a living by mending clothing. She started making clothes when she was 18 and decided to start her own business, which has offered her economic stability and enabled her to help her husband with food costs.
Her greatest wish is for her children to have good careers.
She will use the requested loan to purchase a stock of clothing.

loans.use: Invest in merchandise for her business

loans.name: Las Tres Marias Group

texts.es: El Grupo solidario Las Tres Marías esta compuesto por tres integrantes todas mujeres, La representante  es la Srta. Elvia realiza la venta de cosméticos, es soltera, vive en la casa de sus padres trabaja de lunes a sábado, es vendedora ambulante va a distintas instituciones a ofrecer sus productos es una persona muy amable y muy trabajadora, con el dinero del crédito comprara cosméticos por mayor que se encuentren en oferta, las otras dos componentes se dedican a la venta de accesorios para celulares  en Cochabamba y sacaba ofrecen de lunes a sábado  tienen varios clientes fijos , el préstamo lo invertirán para aumentar  su mercadería para así variar sus productos, todas las socias están agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The Las Tres Marias [The Three Marias] solidarity group is made up of three members, all women. The representative is Miss Elvia. She sells cosmetics. She is single, lives in her parents'  home, and works from Monday to Saturday. She sells door to door, and goes to different locations to offer her products. She is a very likable and hard-working person.

She will use this loan to purchase wholesale cosmetics that are currently on sale. The other two members sell accessories for cell phones in Cochabamba Monday to Saturday. They have various fixed customers. They will use this loan to increase their merchandise in order to have varied stock. All of the members are grateful to the institution for the support offered.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics wholesale

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba F. is married and has four children. Her husband is a fisherman, while Aba is a fish monger in Elmina. Aba uses her income to assist her husband in feeding and clothing and for the education of her children.

Aba will use her loan to purchase extra fish to smoke for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to buy some land.

loans.use: To purchase extra fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Sop Serigne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 15 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 20 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même quartier. Elles ont longtemps évolué ensemble au tour des activités génératrices de revenus. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de TOUB. SERAS 1

Madame ROKHAYA F. debout à l'extrême droite de la photo avec un large sourire est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 51 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de deux enfants qui lui sont confiés. 

Elle fait du petit commerce. Elle vend des fruits et des légumes. En sus de cette activité elle compte vendre des beignets. 

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de mieux développer son activité de vente de fruits et légumes et de beignets.

Son activité est de soutenir son mari dans la gestion familiale d'une part, et renforcer son niveau d'épargne d'autre part.
texts.en: The Sop Serigne Fallou solidarity group was created on December 15, 2009. It is composed of 20 women who all come from the same neighborhood. For some time they have created income-generating businesses together.  The group is affiliated with the TOUB. SERAS 1 Banc Villageois.  Mrs. Rokhaya F., standing at the far right of the photo with a broad smile, is the leader of the group. She is 51 years old, married and the mother of 6 children. She also provides for two children entrusted to her care. She has a small business selling fruits and vegetables. In addition to this business, she plans to sell beignets (a type of doughnut). Her new loan will enable her to expand her business selling fruits, vegetables and beignets. Her goals are to help her husband support the family and to increase her level of savings.

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, de 31 años, vive al lado de su esposa Ada de 29 años y su pequeña hija en la casa de sus suegros, juntos luchan cada día para salir adelante. Desde hace 2 años, este emprendedor hombre se dedica a la venta de ropa, junto a su esposa. Esta muy satisfecho pues les va bien ya que compran la ropa a mayoristas de la ciudad y la llevan al lugar donde viven para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes, así la venden a un poco más del precio real y obtienen regulares ganancias. Paralelamente a esta actividad también se dedica a dictar charlas pastorales en su iglesia cristiana, por lo que recibe un sueldo regular que le permite brindarle a su familia una buena calidad de vida. Tiene muchos planes para el futuro como el de mejorar la infraestructura de la casa donde vive pues aunque es de sus suegros, ya le cedieron una parte a su esposa; ya que quiere instalar ahí un negocio. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Carlos tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de materiales de construcción, pues quiere empezar con la refacción de su casa, para continuar vendiendo sus prendas de vestir  sin problemas en la comodidad de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Carlos, age 31, lives with his wife Ada, age 29, and their small daughter in the home of his parents-in-law. Together they fight to get ahead every day. For two years, this enterprising man has sold clothing with his wife. He is very satisfied, since it is going well for them. The buy the clothing from the city wholesalers and bring it to the area where they live in order to fill their customers' orders. This way, they sell it for a little more than the real price and obtain regular earnings. In addition to this activity, he also gives sermons in his Christian church, for which he receives a regular salary which allows him to offer his family a good quality of life.
He has many plans for the future, such as improving the structure of their house--even though it is his in-laws' house, they gave part of it to him and his wife. He wants to open a business there. This is his second loan with MFP, and he promises to pay his quotas punctually since he does not want to disappoint those who are making this loan possible. This loan will allow him to continue working in the search of progress.
Carlos plans to invest this loan in the purchase of construction materials, since he wants to start refurbishing his house in order to continue selling his garments without problems in the comfort of his own home.

loans.use: to purchase materials for finishing building his home.

loans.name: Nueva Generacion Group

texts.es:
el grupo Nueva Generacion esta integrado por 3 mujeres las cuales viven en EL Matazano Jamastran, son mujeres que tienen tiempos de concerse y son muy amigas, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

la sra. Reina Isabel Cáceres se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular y granos básicos, tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion, su pulperia opera bajo el nombre de pulperia "ENID". lo atiende personalmente por lo tanto es bien administrado y se nota que lo a manejado muy bien dicho negocio esta ubicado entre la intersección de las aldeas de la zona montañosa del valle de jamastran.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su pulperia.

la sra. Orfilia Escoto López se dedica al comercio su actividad principal es la venta de productos agropecuarios, papelería y fotocopiado de todo tipo de documentos denominado “Agropecuaria Matazano” cuenta con mas de 2 años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad comercial, nos comentaba que le a ido muy bien ya que se encuentra en una zona netamente agrícola y ganadera, lugares aptos para este tipo de negocio. 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de productos agricolas, papeleria en general.

la sra. Yeny Lizzeth Cáceres se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace mas de 2 años, durante ese tiempo le a ido muy bien, ya que con los ingresos que percibe de las ventas apoya a su esposo en los gastos familiares y a la vez no descuida sus oficios domésticos y a su familia.el credito lo utilizara para la compra de cosmeticos.
texts.en:
The Nueva Generacion ["New Generation"] group is made up of 3 women who live in El Matazano Jamastran. They have known each other for a long time and are good friends. The following is a description of their businesses:

Mrs. Reina Isabel C. sells common consumer products and basic grains. She has a small general store in her home. Her store operates under the name "Enid". She works in it herself, and it is clear that it is well-managed. Her business is located at the intersection of the neighbourhoods in the mountainous zone of the Valle de Jamastran. 
She will use her loan for the purchase of merchandise to stock her store.

Mrs. Orfilia Escoto López is a merchant. She mainly sells agricultural products and stationery, and provides photocopying for all types of documents. Her store is called “Agropecuaria Matazano”. She has more than 2 years' experience in this kind of business. She told us that it has gone very well for her since she is located in a strictly agricultural area, a prime location for this type of business.
She will use her loan for the purchase of agricultural products and general stationery.

Mrs. Yeny Lizzeth Cáceres has sold cosmetics for over 2 years, during which time things have gone very well for her, since she uses her income to help her husband with the household costs without having to ignore her domestic responsibilities and her family.
She will use her loan for the purchase of cosmetics.

loans.use: the purchase of beans, rice, corn, sugar, coffee, cosmetics, general stationery and agricultural items

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 55 años vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de sus 2 hijos mayores, que trabajan y se mantienen, pero ella continua trabajando con mucho empeño para salir adelante. Desde hace 5 años, esta emprendedora mujer tiene un negocio de venta de comestibles y productos de primera necesidad en su vivienda. Esta muy satisfecha con el negocio pues le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos, además es tranquilo y lo desempeña durante todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, aunque obtiene regulares ganancias lo que no le gusta es que no puede salir muy a menudo pues no tiene con quien dejar el negocio. Dice que se entretiene mucho conversando con sus compradores y le gusta mantener abastecido su negocio. Como es una dama con muchos planes ya tiene pensado para el futuro ampliar más las instalaciones de su tienda, para la comodidad de sus clientes. Es el cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. María tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de variedad de comestibles para surtir mejor su negocio y así continuar creciendo empresarialmente.
texts.en:
María, age 55, lives in her own home with her two grown children who work and take care of themselves. She still works with a great desire to succeed. For five years, this enterprising woman has had a business selling food items and basic necessities in her home. She is very satisfied with her business, since it has allowed her to get her children ahead. Furthermore, it is calm and occupies her every day from 8:00 am to 10:00 pm. Even though she does not make a regular income, what she doesn't like is that she can't go out very often since she doesn't have anyone to run the business for her. She says that she greatly enjoys talking with her customers and she likes to keep her business stocked.
Since she is a woman with many plans, she is already planning on expanding her store more in the future, for the comfort of her customers. This is her fourth loan with MFP and she promises to pay her quotas punctually, since she does not want to disappoint those who are making this loan possible. It will allow her to continue working in the search of progress. Maria plans to invest the requested loan in the purchase of a variety of food products in order to better stock her business and this continue to grow as a business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products to stock her store.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa E. sells maize, pineapple and utensils at Elmina. She is divorced and takes care of six dependants. Adjoa has been selling maize, utensils and pineapple for 10 years. She is responsible for the well-being of her family. Her loan will be used to buy other varieties of utensils for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her dependants.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy other varieties of utensils to sell.

loans.name: Sop Serigne Khadim Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP SERIGNE KHADIM est créé le 14 décembre 2008. Il est composé de 09 femmes issues du même quartier et partage le même centre d'intérêt qui est le développement de leur terroir. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de KEUR SERIGNE LOUGA EST.

Madame FATOU S. debout tout à fait à droit sur la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 44 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de 05 autres enfants dont une orpheline. 

Elle fait du petit commerce. Elle vend sur étalage divers produits alimentaires tels des condiments de cuisine et des légumes. 

Son crédit lui permettra de renforcer et de développer son petit commerce et aspirer à une activté plus importante.

Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille et renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
The Sop Serigee Khadim solidarity group was created on December 14, 2008. The group is made up of 9 women who are from the same neighborhood and who share the same interest - developping their region. 

The group is part of the "Keur Serigne Louga Est" Banc Villageois. Mrs. Fatou S., standing at the far right of the photo, is the group's leader. She is 44 years old, married, and the mother of 6 children. She is also responsible for another 5 children of whom one is an orphan. Fatou is a small-scale retailer. She displays and sells various food items such as condiments for cooking and vegetables. The loan will allow her to strengthen and develop her small business and aim for a increased level of activity. Her goal is to contribute to an improvement in her family's living conditions and to save more money.

loans.use: To develop and market a small business

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame E. is married and has ten dependents. She makes and sells "Aboodo" in Elmina. "Aboodo" is the local name for a baked dish made from corn flour and sugar.  It is wrapped in a green leaf before baking. 

Maame has been in this business for ten years. Her husband is a fisherman. She uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase extra bags of maize to use in preparing Aboodo for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to educate her dependents.

The picture shows Maame removing the baked Aboodo.

loans.use: To purchase maize to make Aboodo

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa B. sells food items and maize in Elmina. She is a widow taking care of six dependents. She also sees to the general upkeep of the home. 

Her loan will be added to her working capital to expand her maize business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children. 

Adjoa is showing the maize she sells.

loans.use: To use as working capital

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Carmen

texts.es:
la sra. Guadalupe del Carmen D. se dedica a la venta joyas de Oro de manera ambulante y es notable que durante este tiempo a sabido administrar su negocio, con los ingresos que le a generado el mismo a logrado terminarles sus estudios a sus hijas, mismas que ahora todas son profesionales y graduadas de carreras universitarias con licenciaturas en pedagogía.
ahora ya no tiene hijos a su cargo pero esto no a sido pretexto para no seguir trabajando en lo que le gusta hacer, ya que sus clientes la prefieren por la calidad y precios en que vende las joyas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de joyas como ser Cadenas, Esclavas, Anillos, Aritos, cadenas, pulseras y esclavas para dama y caballero.
texts.en:
Mrs. Guadalupe del Carmen D. sells gold jewelry on the street. It is clear that she knows how to run her business; with her income, she has been able to see her daughters through to the end of their studies. They are now professionals and graduates with university degrees in teaching.
She does not have children under her care anymore, but this has not been a reason to stop working in a business that she enjoys. Her customers prefer her for the quality and good prices she offers for jewelry.
She will use this loan for the purchase of jewelry such as chains, bangles, rings, hoops and bracelets for men and women.

loans.use: the purchase of chains, bracelets, hoops, rings, bangles.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 49 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo José de 55 años y de su pequeña hija, juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Desde hace 1 año, esta emprendedora mujer instaló en su casa una tienda de venta de helados de una marca reconocida, ahí vende con la ayuda de su pequeña hija durante todo el día. Además durante los fines de semana vende cervezas y llega a comercializar por pedido a las propias casas de sus clientes, con este negocio obtiene regulares ganancias que le permiten ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar para brindarle a su familia una buena calidad de vida. Dice que le gusta mucho trabajar pues se entretiene bastante y no descuida las labores de su hogar, además tiene muchos planes para el futuro como el de ampliar su negocio para aumentar sus ganancias, y así espera salir adelante. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. María tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de helados, y también varias cajas de cervezas pues necesita abastecerse para el verano, ya que estos productos tienen bastante salida.
texts.en: Maria is 49 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Jose who is 55 years old and their young daughter. Together they work hard every day to get ahead. A year ago, this enterprising woman set up a shop in her home selling a well known ice cream. She sells all day with the help of her young daughter. On the weekends she also sells beer and she takes orders and delivers to her customer's homes. With this business she regularly obtains profits and is able to help her husband with the household expenses to provide her family a good quality of life. She enjoys working because it is entertaining and because she does not neglect her household work. She has many plans for the future such as expanding her business to increase her profits so she can get ahead. This is the first loan she has obtained from field partner MFP and she promises to make her payments on time because she does not want to look bad with the people that made this contribution, which will allow her to continue working in search of progress, possible. Maria plans on investing this loan in purchasing ice cream and several boxes of beer since she needs to stock her store for the summer as these products sell a lot.

loans.use: Purchase ice cream and boxes of beer.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua M. sells maize and pineapple in Elmina.  She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a carpenter. 

Ekua has been selling maize and pineapple for four years. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her dependents.

loans.use: To buy maize

loans.name: Yaira Yulieth

texts.es:
la sra. Yaira Yulieth P. tiene dos años de dedicarse al comercio y su actividad principal es la elaboración y venta de tortillas todos los dias y los días miércoles y sábados se dedica a la venta de nacatamales los que distribuye de manera ambulante, siendo las rutas de mayor rentabilidad las zonas cafetaleras.
Doña Yaira a sabido ganarse la clientela ya que sus tortillas son grandes y sus tamales tienen buen sabor, este tipo de negocio es muy rentable para ella, ya que en donde reside es una aldea con bastante población.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de los materiales para la fabricacion de las tortillas y los nacatamales.

Se observo que sus condiciones de vida son favorables y su esposo se dedica a la ganadería y la agricultura
texts.en:
Yaira Yulieth P. has been making and selling tortillas for two years. She works every day and on Wednesdays and Saturdays she sells nacatamales (a Honduran tamal) which she sells as a street vendor. The most profitable routes are the the areas where the coffee plantations are located. 

Yaira has learned how to gain customers since her tortillas are big and her tamales have a lot of flavor. This type of business is very profitable for her since she lives in a neighborhood with a large population. 

She will use this loan to purchase materials to make tortillas and nacatamales. 

It was observed that her living conditions are favorable and her husband raises livestock and farms.

loans.use: Purchase corn, wood, water, chicken, pork, vegetables and banana leaves.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Menana Aba

texts.en:
Menana Aba R. is divorced and has five dependents. Menana bakes pie and fries groundnuts for sale in Elmina.  She has been doing this for fifteen years. Menana uses the income she makes from her sales to take care of her dependents.

Menana will use the loan to purchase flour, groundnuts, and other ingredients to bake pies and fry groundnuts for sale. She plans to reinvest her new profit.

loans.use: To purchase flour, groundnut, and baking ingredients

loans.name: Mena

texts.en:
Mena A. sells provisions such as rice, soaps, and others items in Elmina. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. She assists her husband in educating her children.  Her loan will be added to her initial capital to increase her stock. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

In Mena’s hand is a cup of rice. At her side also are soaps.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita B. is married and has one child. Rita is a hair dresser in Elmina. She also sells hair products. Her husband sews for a living. Rita uses her income to assist her husband in feeding their family. 

Rita will use the loan to purchase more hair products to resell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rita plans to build a salon. In this picture, Rita is showing some of the artificial hairs she sells.

loans.use: To purchase hair products

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa B. cooks food such as rice, beans, and wakye for sale in Elmina. She is divorced and has seven dependents. She has been cooking food for sale for thirty years. She responsibly sees to the well-being of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs to cook for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a cafeteria. 

Adjoa is dishing out some of the cooked rice.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to cook for sale

loans.name: Nana Tweba Margaret

texts.en: Nana Tweba Margaret K. is a widow taking care of four children.  She sells bottles and bags of water in Elmina. She also sells ice cream. She has been in this trade for seven years. She also sees to the general well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to buy more water and ingredients to make ice cream for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: To buy water and ingredients to make ice cream

loans.name: Ramona De Jesus

texts.es:
La Sra. Ramona P. se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la elaboración y venta de pan.
actividad a la cual se dedica desde hace más de tres  años. Se a sabido ganar sus clientes por su buen trato y la buena calidad, sabor y porción de sus panes.
gracias a su negocio este le permite percibir ingresos para cubrir sus gastos familiares, doña Ramona tiene una hija que reside y trabaja en los Estados Unidos, le apoya ecomicamente pero esto no le es ningún impedimento para dejar de trabajar ya que siempre a sido independiente ademas le permite mantenerse ocupada todos los dias.
texts.en:
Ramona P. has been making and selling bread for more than three years. She has won over her customers by treating them well, by the quality and flavor of her bread and by its portions. 
Her business allows her to have income to cover the family's expenses. Ramona has a daughter that lives and works in the United States. Her daughter helps her economically but she does not think this is an impediment for her to stop working since she has always been independent. Her business also allows her to keep occupied every day.

loans.use: Purchase flour, cheese, lard, margarine, soft drinks, yeast, sugar and wood.

loans.name: Petrona Del Carmen

texts.es:
la sra. Petrona del Carmen L. se dedica a la elaboracion de rosquillas, tustacas y quesadillas actividad que realiza en su casa de habitación con ayuda de sus hijas, su producto los distribuye en diferentes negocios de la ciudad de El Paraíso Y Danlí, sus rosquillas tienen una gran demanda son caracterizadas por su sabor y lo crujientes que son, esta es su principal fuente de ingresos que doña Petrona Posee.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de las rosquillas, tustacas y quesadillas.
Petrona es una mujer emprendedora y con espíritu de superación, a tenido que luchar sola para darle la crianza y educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Petrona del Carmen L. makes rosquillas (a doughnut shaped cracker), tustacas (a type of corn cake with sugar) and quesadillas. She makes these in her home with the help of her daughters. She distributes her product to different businesses in the cities of El Paraiso and Danli. Her rosquillas are in high demand. They are characterized by their flavor and how crunchy they are. This is the main source of income for Petrona. 

She will use this loan to buy materials to make her rosquillas, tustacas and quesadillas. 

Petrona is an enterprising woman with a spirit to overcome difficulties. She has had to fight on her own to raise and educate her children.

loans.use: Purchase cheese, corn, wood, lard, brown sugar and cinnamon.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama Y. sells goundnuts and maize at Elmina, in both in small and large quantities. She is divorced and has two children. Ama has been selling goundnuts and maize for thirty years. She is responsible for the well-being of her family. Her loan will be used to buy extra bags of maize and groundnuts for resale. She plans to buy some land with the profits. In the bowl in front of her is maize. She has yet to receive the groundnuts from her supplier.

loans.use: To buy extra bags of maize and groundnuts for resale.

loans.name: Efua Mensah

texts.en:
Efua mensah P. is a fishmonger. She also cooks food for sale at Elmina. She is married with five dependents. Her husband is a fisherman. She assists her husband in paying school fees and utility bills. She is asking for a loan to purchase food to cook for sale. She hopes to use the profits from her business to establish a food stall.

In this picture Efua is dishing out some of her prepared food.

loans.use: To purchase food to cook for sale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 41 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo Jorge de 48 años y de sus 2 hijos que son mayores y trabajan independientes; juntos se esfuerzan a diario para salir adelante. Desde hace 2 años,  esta trabajadora mujer se dedica a la venta de comida (menú) diaria, pues reparte estos platillos a sus 15 comensales fijos que son trabajadores de una empresa y le pagan semanalmente. Esta muy satisfecha pues la labor es tranquila, empieza a cocinar muy temprano, y luego alista sus taper para repartir la comida al mediodía, así se la pasa de lunes a sábado y solo descansa los domingos. Dice que aunque no tiene hijos pequeños se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante ya que quiere terminar de construir su casa de material noble. Para mas adelante tiene planeado instalar un restaurante donde pueda ofrecer sus diversos platillos, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias. Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. María tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de ingredientes, al por mayor, como arroz, aceite, menestras, huevos y azúcar que necesita para continuar cocinando, y espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Maria is 41 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Jorge who is 48 years old and their two adult children who work independently. Together they strive daily to get ahead. For two years, this hardworking woman has been selling food daily. She delivers meals to 15 regular diners that work at a company and they pay her weekly. She is very satisfied since her work is peaceful. She starts cooking very early and then gets her food ready in containers to distribute the food at noon. She does this Monday through Saturday and only rests on Sundays. Even though she does not have small children, she strives daily to get ahead because she wants to finish building her home made of noble materials. In the future she plans on setting up a restaurant where she can offer a variety of dishes and in this way she can improve her profits. This is the third loan she has obtained from field partner MFP and she promises to make her payments on time because she does not want to look bad to the people who made this contribution, which will allow her to continue working in search of progress, possible. Maria plans on investing the loan in purchasing wholesale ingredients such as rice, oil, beans, eggs and sugar which she needs to keep cooking. She hopes to improve her profits.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of beans, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes, de 39 años, vive al lado de su esposo Walter de 44 años que es chofer y de sus 3 jóvenes hijos; juntos se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante. Esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la elaboración de trenzas, echas a base de material reciclable, con las cuales fabrican carteras que son exportadas a otros países. Ella manifiesta que labora para una intermediaria que les trae el material, por el  trenzado le pagan mensual, según el volumen de la producción, y esta bastante satisfecha pues le genera regulares ganancias en lo que se ha convertido una labor familiar, pues en el trenzado del plástico le ayuda su esposo, durante sus ratos libres, además de sus hijos cuando están de vacaciones del colegio. Como es un trabajo bastante tranquilo, pues mientras mayor tiempo le dediquen mejores serán las ganancias. Siente que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia, y tiene planeado para el futuro instalar una librería en su vivienda, pues por la zona donde vive no hay competencia. Es el cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Mercedes tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de material, pues quiere empezar a producir por su cuenta sin necesidad de intermediarios.
texts.en: Mercedes, age 39, lives together with her husband Walter, age 44, who is a driver, and their 3 young children. Together they work hard every day to get ahead. This enterprising woman works creating braided panels from recyclable material. The panels are then used to make handbags, which are exported to other countries. She reports that she works for an intermediary who delivers the material. She is paid monthly for the braids, according to her production volume. She is quite satisfied because this work generates regular earnings. She has made this work into a family effort, since her husband helps her weave the plastic during his free time, and her children also help when they are on vacation from school. It is not difficult work, and the more time they dedicate to it, the more they earn. She feels that it has helped her family get ahead, and in the future she plans to set up a bookstore in her home, because there is no competition in the area where she lives. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she promises to make her payments punctually, since she does not want to disappoint the people who made possible this funding which will permit her to continue working in search of progress. Mercedes plans to invest the loan she is requesting in buying materials, because she wants to start producing on her own, without the need for intermediaries.

loans.use: Buying materials to make braided panels from recycled plastic

loans.name: Miriams Ildilcia

texts.es:
Miriams Ildilicia C. Ochoa se dedica al comercio, cuenta con una pulpería en su casa de habitacioon. Miriams atiende a sus clientes y administra muy bien su negocio, el cual es su principal fuente de ingresos y le a permitido salir adelante supliendo los gastos del hogar.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su negocio y asi tener mejores ganancias.
Han mejorado notablemente las condiciones de vida de ella y de su familia, hizo unas remodelaciones en su casa de habitacion con las ganancias obtenidas anteriormente.
texts.en:
Miriams Ildilicia C. Ochoa is a merchant, she has a grocery store in her home. Miriams servers her customers and administers her business well. Her business is her main source of income and it has allowed her to be successful in supplying for the household expenses. 

She will use the loan to purchase merchandise to stock her business so that she can obtain more profits. 

Her and her family's living conditions have notably improved. She remodeled her home with profits she had previously made.

loans.use: Purchase lard, oil, margarine, soaps, toilet paper and sanitary napkins.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, tiene 38 años de edad, vive junto a sus 4 hijos y se dedica a administrar una tienda de productos de primera necesidad.
Ella como responsable del hogar mantiene en las mejoras condiciones el inventario de su tienda ya que de ella dependen sus hijos y logra cubrir los gastos familiares, por tal motivo solicita un préstamo para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite y maíz, con estos productos espera continuar con el inventario en buenas condiciones y ofrecer a los clientes calidad y variedad, complaciendo sus necesidades cotidianas.
Su objetivo es mantener el negocio en buenas condiciones y ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios, para que estos puedan superarse.
texts.en:
María lives in San Francisco Gotera in the department of Morazán. She is 38 years old, lives with her four children, and works managing a store with basic necessities.

As the person responsible for the household, she keeps her store inventory in the best conditions as her children depend on her. She is able to cover the family expenses and this is why she is requesting a loan for the purchase of rice, beans, sugar, oil, and corn. With these products, she hopes to continue to keep her inventory in good conditions and offer quality and variety to her customers, meeting their daily needs.

Her goal is to keep her business in good condition and to help her children with their education so that they can be successful.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for the store

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es:
Oscar de 38 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, tiene un hijo con el viven solos alquilando vivienda, él se dedica a la venta de CD Y DVD de forma ambulante, este negocio le ayuda a mantener a su hijo y pagar los gastos del hogar.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para fortalecer el negocio comprando CD Y DVD para abastecer el negocio, con esta ayuda espera mantenerse competente y atender las demandas de los clientes.
Su principal objetivo es darle a su hijo los estudios necesarios y proveer la alimentación diaria.
texts.en:
Oscar is 38 years old and lives in San Francisco Gotera in the department of Morazán. He has a son and they live alone in a rented house. Oscar works selling CDs and DVDs by foot and this business helps him to support his son and pay the household expenses.

He is currently requesting a loan to strengthen his business by purchasing CDs and DVDs to stock it. With this support, he hopes to stay up-to-date and tend to the customers’ demands.

His main goal is to provide his son with the necessary education and provide food on a daily basis.

loans.use: To purchase CDs and DVDs

loans.name: Maira Elieth

texts.es:
Maira Elieth L. se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan casero y los fines de semana elabora nacatamales actividad que viene realizando por mas de 5 años su producto lo vende de forma ambulante en los diferentes negocios de la localidad. tiene clientes fijos que siempre le compran todo el año.
algunos vecinos comentan que Maira es una mujer de muy buena conducta y cumplida con los compromisos.
con los ingresos que le genera este negocio apoya a su esposo con algunos gastos en el hogar y a logran salir adelante y suplir las necesidades básicas de sus dos hijos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la fabricacion del pan y de los nacatamales.
texts.en:
Maira Elieth L. makes homemade bread and on the weekends she makes nacatamales [tamales wrapped in banana leaves]. She has been doing this for more than 5 years. She sells her products to various businesses in the area. She has permanent clients who buy from her all year. Several neighbors have commented that Maira is a good person and follows through on her obligations.

The income that this business generates helps her husband with some of the household expenses, helps them to get ahead, and also provides the basic necessities for their two children. 

She will use the loan to buy ingredients for making her bread and tamales.

loans.use: To buy corn, cheese, shortening, margarine, yeast, baking soda, firewood, water, matches, pork and chicken, vegetables, and banana leaves

loans.name: Unidas Somos Más (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Unidas Somos Más está formado por un grupo de 7 señoras y un señor, quienes trabajan en el campo realizando diferentes actividades para obtener el sustento diario de sus hogares. Viven en la comunidad de Nonadel en donde se puede admirar la naturaleza en todo su esplendor, respirando un aire de tranquilidad fuera del ruido de la ciudad. 

La Señora. Elsa S. es socia del banco comunal Unidas Somos Más, vive en la comunidad de Nonadel. Este es su primer crédito y fue  invitada por una vecina a formar parte del banco comunal. Nuestra socia se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y aprovecha el tiempo que pasa en su casa para criar animales como son pollos y borregos a los cuales los  vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica. También labora 3 días a la semana lavando y arreglando casas. 
Doña Elsa tiene 35 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos de 18, 16, 14, 11, 9 años de edad y su ultimo hijo de un mes de nacido, su primer hijo trabajar para sus gastos, su segunda y tercera hija pasan en la casa y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuela de la comunidad. Su esposo labora como albañil y con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos. Su meta es mejorar su casa.

La Señora. Hilda B. es socia del banco comunal Unidas Somos Más, vive por la comunidad de Deleg. Tiene 26 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 10, 7, 5 y 3 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en una escuela de la comunidad, no tiene casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
Doña Hilda se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y al cuidando de sus niños, también cría pollos, inicio este negocio con su primer crédito y ha ido creciendo poco a poco. Este es el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y al igual que los créditos anteriores lo va a invertir en la compra mas pollos y en su alimento. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The “Unidas Somos Más” [United We are More] communal bank is made up of a group of 7 women and one man. They work in the countryside in various business to earn a living for their households. 

They live in the community of Nonadel, where one can admire nature in all of its splendor, breathing an air of tranquility far from the noise of the city.

Elsa S. is a member of the “Unidas Somos Más” community bank. She lives in Nonadel. This is her first loan and she was invited to join the bank by a neighbor. She is a homemaker and she takes advantage of the time she spends at home to raise animals, such as chickens and goats, which she sells when she has economic need. She also works 3 days a week washing clothing and cleaning houses.

Elsa is 35 years old, married, and has 6 children who are 18, 16, 14, 11, and 9 years old, and one son who is one month old. Her first son works and pays his expenses. Her first and second daughters stay at home, and the last two children study in a school in the community. Her husband works as a mason and between the two of them they have managed to build their own house. She will use the loan to buy more chickens. Her goal is to improve her house.

Hilda B. is a member of the “Unidas Somos Más” communal bank. She lives in the community of Deleg. She is 26 years old, married, and has 4 children who are 10, 7, 5, and 3 years old. Her first three children study in a community school. They don’t have their own house, so they rent. Hilda is a homemaker and along with taking care of her children, she also raises chickens. She started this business with the first loan and it has been growing, bit by bit. This is the third loan she has taken through the communal bank. As with her previous loans, she will invest it in buying more chickens and chicken feed. Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: To buy chickens and animal feed.

loans.name: Unidos Al Futuro Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Unidos al Futuro está conformada por 8 personas muy unidas y trabajadoras Sabina es una D. las integrantes D. este grupo ella tiene 53 años D. edad se dedica a su pequeña bodega desD. hace 10 años, en el cual venD. abarrotes  como son: arroz azúcar, fideos, aceite y algunos productos más que sus clientes requieren para su consumo, también venD. pollo verduras y gaseosas. Ella tiene este negocio en su casa las paredes son D.  material metálico (kiosco) por eso trabaja mucho para poder terminar D. construir su casa con la ayuda D. su esposo. Ella solicitó el préstamo a EDAPROSPO para comprar una vitrina para sus productos y más mercadería (arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite) al por mayor ya que esto le permite ahorrar y tener un poco mas D. ganancias. Con el esfuerzo D. su trabajo logró mejorar el ambiente D. su negocio ya que antes solo era D. estera.
texts.en: La Alcancía Unidos al Futuro has eight members, all of them fast friends and very hardworking. Sabina is one of the members of the group. She is 53 years old and has had her small shop for 10 years, selling groceries like rice, sugar, noodles, oil, and other products to meet her customers' needs. She also sells chicken, produce, and soft drinks. She runs the business out of her house. The walls are maD. of sheet metal, and she's working hard to be able to finish building her house with her husband's help. She requested this loan for EDAPROSPO to buy a display counter for her products and other goods (rice, sugar, noodles, oil) that she sells in bulk for a little extra income. With a lot of hard work she was able to improve her store, which used to be built of straw.

loans.use: Buy a display counter and merchandise (rice, sugar, noodles, oil) for her store

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Lucia, reside en Puerto el Triunfo departamento de Usulután, vive con sus hijos y nietos su casa es propia y se dedica a vender varios productos como dulces, jabon, huevos, tiene 54 años de edad.
Su negocio tiene 3 años de existir y junto a su hija lo administra, este negocio es la fortaleza con la que cuenta el hogar de Doña Lucia, por el momento está solicitando un préstamo para comprar más mercadería y enriquecer el negocio, ya que los produstos que ofrece tienen buena demanda de parte de los clientes pues son cosas que siempre son necesarias en cada hogar, y aprovechara para aumentar las cantidades de mercaderia en negocio.
Su propósito es estar siempre activa y mejorar las condiciones económicas del hogar.
texts.en:
Lucia lives in Puerto El Triunfo in the department of Usulután with her children and grandchildren. Her house is her own and she is 54 years old. She works selling various items like sweets, soap, and eggs and has had the business for three years. She runs it together with her daughter and this business is the strength of Lucia’s home. Right now, she is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise and improve the business as the products that she sells are in good demand by her customers because they are needed in every home. She will take advantage to increase the amount of merchandise at the store.

Her goal is to always be active and to improve the household’s financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise (soap, detergents, sweets, and other products)

loans.name: Isrrael Group

texts.es: El banco D. emprendimiento "Israel" es un banco nuevo  se encuentra en su primer ciclo son clientes que ya tienen experiencia en otras instituciones son D. la zona D. villa Israel todos  viven en la misma zona y la institución esta entrando con apertura D. bancos nuevos ellas sacaron el crédito para aumentar su capital D. trabajo, la representante del grupo es la Sr. María se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes, tiene una tienda donD. venD. solo abarrotes , ella esta separada D. su esposo tiene 2  hijos dedica  a esta actividad ya hace muchos años, es una persona muy trabajadora y con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería por mayor D. arroz, azúcar, aceite , etc. Todas las socias esta muy agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The communal bank "Israel" is a new bank and it is in its first cycle. Its customers have had experience with other institutions. They are from the Villa Israel area and they all live in the same area. This institution is opening new banks. They have obtained this loan to increase their working capital. The representative of the group is Maria. She has a store where she only sells groceries. She has been in this business for many years. She is separated from her husband and has two children. She is a hardworking person and with the money from this loan she will buy merchandise wholesale such as rice, sugar, oil, etc. All of the members are very thankful to this institution for the support it has provided them.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of groceries.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa, de 48 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de sus 2 hijos mayores y su nieta; juntos se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante. Esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la confección y venta de ropa. Recuerda cuando enseñaba a sus hijos a coser, pues ella realizaba este oficio desde que eran pequeños, con el tiempo ellos crecieron y ahora el mayor de sus hijos confecciona todo tipo de prendas de vestir. Teresa ayuda a su hijo cuando puede, pero más lo ayuda en la venta de las prendas que él confecciona. Es así que viaja constantemente al interior del país y las ofrece a los mayoristas de las ciudades que le pagan muy bien por prenda. Le gusta mucho la labor pues apoya a su hijo, conoce lugares y se distrae, pero en el futuro tiene planeado instalar su tienda de venta de prendas de vestir que elabora su primogénito, asimismo desea continuar vendiendo en las provincias del país. Es el quinto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Teresa tiene planeado invertir este crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de tela para producir buena cantidad de prendas de vestir para el verano, pues tiene varios pedidos pendientes por concretar.
texts.en: Teresa is 48 years old and lives in her own home, beside her two older children and her granddaughter.  Together they struggle daily to get ahead.  This enterprising woman makes and sells clothing.  She remembers when she taught her children to sew, which she did from the time they were small.  They grew up, and now her oldest child makes all types of garments.  Teresa helps her son whenever she can, but is the most useful selling the garments he makes.  For this reason, she travels constantly to other parts of the country, offering clothes to the cities’ wholesale merchants, who pay her well for each piece.  She likes this work a lot, since she supports her son, sees different places, and enjoys herself, but in the future she plans to set up a store to sell the clothing made by her first-born.  She would also like to continue selling in the provinces.  This is the fifth loan she takes out with MFP, and she promises to make the payments punctually.  She doesn’t wish to leave a bad impression with those who have made this support possible, which support will enable her to continue to work towards her goals.  Teresa plans to use the requested loan to purchase enough fabric to produce a large number of garments for summer, since she has several orders to fulfill.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise:  creams, lipsticks, blush, and other items

loans.name: Mujeres En Marcha Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del Grupo Mujeres en Marcha, residen en la colonia Nueva Esperanza de la ciudad de Danlí y son mujeres que se conocen muy bien entre si, cada una posee su propio negocio en el cual tienen buena experiencia en la administración de los mismos.
En la actualidad las Sras. Antes mencionadas no cuentan con el capital de trabajo suficiente para surtir mas sus negocios y necesitan un credito para salir adelante, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

la sra. Rosa Elena R. se dedica a la elaboración y venta de nacatamales y hamburguesas.
Actividad que lleva a cabo los días jueves y viernes de todas las semanas, sus clientes son los empleados del aserradero en donde labora su esposo el cual esta ubicado en la ciudad de danlí.
Doña Rosa a sabido ganarse la clientela por la higiene, sabor y tamaño con que elabora sus nacatamales y hamburguesas.

la sra. Eda Ventura C. Zelaya se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de cosméticos y enchape de Oro, actividad a la cual se dedica desde hace tres años y es notable que durante este tiempo lo a sabido administrar, ya que la demanda del producto es muy buena y sus clientes día a día son mas.
Doña Eda anteriormente se dedicaba al negocio de pulpería y a la vez a la venta de Cosméticos y Enchape de oro, pero se vio obligada a quitar el negocio de pulpería porque las ventas cada día iban bajando, además alquilaba local y casi no le dedicaba tiempo ya que era atendida por un familiar y mientras mas tiempo pasabas mas perdidas tenia.
La Sra. Cáceres, sale a vender su producto de manera ambulante en diferentes Barrios, Colonias y empleados de diferentes fábricas de tabacos.
se a sabido ganar los clientes por la amabilidad con que les atiende y por facilidades de pago que les brinda.

la sra, Blanca Lidia G. se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado nuevo.
Doña Blanca es una mujer que se a sabido ganarse los clientes por las facilidades de pago y por el buen producto que vende.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa y zapatos.
texts.en:
The members of the Mujeres en Marcha group live in the Nueva Esperanza development in the city of Danli. They are women who know each other very well. Each one has her own business and has good experience in running it.
These women do not currently have the sufficient working capital to stock their businesses more, and so they need a loan to get ahead. The following is a description of their different businesses:

Rosa Elena R. makes and sells nactamales and hamburgers on Thursdays and Fridays every week. Her customers are the employees of the sawmill where her husband works, which is located in Danli city. Rosa has gained customers for her food's cleanliness, flavour and portions.

Eda Ventura C. Zelaya is a merchant, and she mainly sells cosmetics and gold-plated jewelry. She has done this for three years, and it is notable that during this time she has managed it well because the demand for her products is very high and she has more customers every day.
Eda previously had a grocery store on top of her cosmetics and jewelry business, but she had to leave her grocery store because the sales were getting lower every day. Furthermore, she was renting the store and had almost no time for it; it was attended by a family member, and the more time that passed the more losses she had. Mrs C. goes out to sell her product door-to-door in different neighbourhoods and developments, and to employees of different tobacco factories. She has gained customers because of her kind service and the easy payment options she offers.

Mrs. Blanca Lidia G. sells clothing and new shoes. 
Blanca is a woman who has gained customers because of the ease of payment she offers, and because of the quality of her product.
She will use this loan for the purchase of clothing and shoes.

loans.use: the purchase of bread for hamburgers, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, mustard, tomato sauce, ground beef, spices, condiments, salt, chicken, corn, banana leaves, vegetables, cosmetics and gold-plated jewelry, clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Patricia Evelyn

texts.es:
Patricia, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, tiene 31 años de edad, tiene una hija de 10 años, posee un negocio de medicamentos naturales.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería,  para el negocio, con esta ayuda estará fortaleciendo el inventario y podrá dar salida a la demanda de los clientes.
Su propósito es proveer del negocio los ingresos que necesita para cubrir todas sus necesidades, así también velar por el bienestar de su hija.
texts.en:
Patricia lives in El Transito, in the San Miguel department. She is 31 and has one 10-year-old daughter. She has a natural medicines business. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of merchandise for her business. With this help, she will strengthen her inventory and supply her customers' demand.
She plans to use her business to earn the necessary income to cover all of her needs and provide for her daughter's well-being.

loans.use: the purchase of natural products

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina, de 37 años, vive en casa de sus padres, en compañía de ellos, de su pareja Freddy de  38 años y de su pequeña hija, juntos se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante. Esta emprendedora mujer tiene varios oficios, pues durante 3 veces a la semana se dedica a la venta de limones en el puesto de su prima que  esta ubicado en un populoso mercado de su zona. De ahí obtiene ganancias semanales pues su pariente le paga por la labor desempeñada, además durante el resto de días de la semana apoya  a su madre en la venta de gaseosas y cervezas en su casa, de ahí obtiene algunas ganancias, y le gustan sus labores pues son tranquilas y no tiene mucha presión. Como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una tienda de comestibles, pero sabe que lo logrará con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación en su trabajo. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Karina tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cervezas y gaseosas para apoyar a su madre, pues necesita surtir el negocio con cantidad de mercadería, pues durante el verano tienen bastante salida.
texts.en:
Karina, age 37, lives in her parents' home with her parents, her partner Freddy (age 38) and her small daughter. Together, they work hard every day to get ahead. This enterprising woman has various jobs. Three times a week she sells lemons in her cousin's stall in a busy local market. From this job, she earns a weekly income, as her cousin pays her for her labour.
During the rest of the week she helps her mother sell pop and beer in their home. She makes some money from this, and enjoys the work because it is calm and relatively pressure-free. Since she is an enterprising woman she plans to open a food store in the future, and she knows that she will achieve this with hard work and dedication to her work. This is her second loan with MFP, and she promises to pay her quotas punctually since she does not want to disappoint those who are making this loan possible. It will allow her to continue working in the search of progress. Karina plans to invest the requested loan in the purchase of beers and pop to support her mother, since they need to stock the business with some merchandise, as they have a lot of sales in the summer.

loans.use: to stock up on pop and beer.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.es:
Doña Carlota D. 46 años D. edad, resiD. en Guatajiagua, departamento D.
