Morazán, donD. vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos D. 24 y 22 años D. edad los dos están estudiando gracias al esfuerzo D. sus padres, ya que doña Carlota su esposo elaboran y venden loza (comales y ollas, este oficio lo aprendió cada uno D. sus padres, ya que esta zona D. Guatajiagua se caracteriza por la herencia en trabajar el barro y crear utensilios D. cocina. 
El negocio lo atienden todo el día, fabricando sus productos para tener disponibles al momento D. que los clientes les visiten y demanden algún producto; su inconveniente es la escases D. material ya que en momentos se termina y esto les dificulta continuar con la actividad. Esta situación les ha llevado a solicitar un préstamo para la compra D. materiales como loza cruda, tres carretas D. leña, nacazcol, barro negro y pasaje para transportar la mercadería.
Esta ayuda les dará fortaleza y podrán ellos continuar con la fabricación D. ollas y comales, ya que en verano es la mejor época para fabricar ya que el sol siempre esta fuerte, Sus sueños son con el negocio que sea prospero, que mantengan cantidades adecuadas D. inventario y lograr que sus hijos terminen sus estudios ya que actualmente se encuentran en la universidad.
texts.en:
Mrs Carlota, age 46, lives in Guatajiagua, in the Morazan department, with her husband and two children ages 24 and 22. Her children are in school, thanks to the hard work of their parents. Carlota and her husband make and sell crockery (plates for cooking tortillas, and pots). They each learned this business from their parents, since the Guatajiagua zone is known for the heritage of working with clay and creating cooking tools.
They work in their business all day, making their products in order to have them available whenever a customer visits and requests any product. Their challenge is the scarcity of materials since at times they run out and it is hard to continue. This situation has brought them to request a loan for  the purchase of materials such as cruD. crockery, three carts of firewood, nacazcol seeds, black clay, and the fare to transport the merchandise.
This help will give them strength and allow them to continue making pots and plates, since the summer is the best season for production as the sun is always strong. Their dreams are for the business to prosper and maintain an adequate inventory, and for their children to finish their studies since they are currently in university.

loans.use: The purchase of crude crockery, three carts of firewood, nacazcol seeds, black clay, and the fare to transport the merchandise

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.es:
Doña Apolinaria, tiene 61 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, vive con un nieto de 16 años, un sobrino de 24 y una nieta de 1 año y medio, se dedica a vender productos de primera necesidad, tamales, cuajada y tortillas, este negocio tiene muchos años de existir y es su fuente de ingreso para mantener el hogar en buenas condiciones.
Ella está solicitando actualmente un préstamo para abastecer el negocio comprando arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles y demás productos que ofrece a los clientes, con este préstamo pretende mejorar la variedad de alimentos necesarios en cada hogar logrando mantener la preferencia de los que ya forman parte de su clientela.
Sueña con desarrollar el negocio, alcanzar estabilidad económica y estar unida a su familia para alcanzar juntos las metas y sueños a futuro.
texts.en:
Apolinaria, age 61, lives in San Francisco Gotera, in the Morazan department. She lives with a 16-year-old grandson, a niece, age 24, and a granddaughter age 1 and a half. Apolinaria sells basic staples, tamales, curds, and tortillas. She has had this business for many years, and it is her source of income to maintain her home in good condition.
She is requesting a loan to stock her business, buying rice, sugar, oil, beans, and other products that she offers her customers. With this loan, she will improve the variety of food in every household, with a preference for those who are already her customers.
She dreams of developing her business and achieving economic stability, and working with her family to achieve their goals and dreams for the future.

loans.use: the purchase of rice, sugar, oil, beans

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma, de 54 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo José de 68 años, que es obrero y sus 2 hijos mayores, juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Desde hace 8 años, esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, de una reconocida marca; y esta muy satisfecha pues las ganancias que obtiene le permiten ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Le gusta mucho su labor pues la desempeña visitando a sus amigas y conocidas, de esta manera  les va enseñando los catálogos para que le realicen pedidos; además paralelamente a esta actividad también se dedica a la enseñanza en un programa de alfabetización de su zona. Esta muy contenta pues ambos trabajos le permiten salir adelante, y ya tiene muchos planes para  el futuro como el de vender ropa, pues aunque a solo veces se dedica  a este negocio sabe que es muy rentable. Es el sexto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Irma tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de tela, pues quiere mandar a fabricar pantalones cortos y blusas para comercializar estas prendas durante el verano.
texts.en: Irma, 54 years old, lives in her own home with her 68 year old husband José, a laborer, and their two grown children. Together they work every day to get ahead. For 8 years this businesswoman has sold a well-known brand of cosmetics. She is very satisfied as her earnings that she receives have enabled her to help her husband with the household expenses. She enjoys her work as it allows her to visit friends and acquaintances, showing them catalogs from which they then order; in addition to this business she also teachers a reading program in her neighborhood. She is very content as both jobs allow her to get ahead, and she has many plans for the future such as the one to sell clothing. Even though she has only sometimes sold clothing she knows it is a profitable business. This is her sixth loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments punctually,  as she doesn’t want to disappoint the people who make the money possible for her to be able to continue working and becoming successful. Irma has planned to invest the money into buying a quantity of fabric, as she wants to arrange for the making of some shorts and blouses to sell during the summer.

loans.use: Buy fabric to make pants and blouses

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco Antonio de 42 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y un hijo de 18 años de edad, residen en San Miguel, departamento de San Miguel, es empleado desde hace 18 años como motorista del ministerio de Trabajo.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para los gastos educativos de su hijo que actualmente estudia educación media, ya que el salario no cubre todas las necesidades, pues solamente él trabaja para mantener los gastos de la casa.
Su proyección es continuar trabajando, cancelar puntualmente el préstamo y ayudar a su hijo hasta que este finalice una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio is 42 years old and lives in San Miguel with his wife and 18 year old son.  For the past 18 years, he's been working as a driver with the Work Ministry.  He is asking for a loan so that he can pay his son's tuition.  At the moment he is only a part time student because his salary does not cover all the needs.  He only works to maintain the household.

He expects to continue working, repay the loan on time, and help his son until he finalizes his professional career.

loans.use: Tuition

loans.name: Maria Elsy

texts.es:
Doña María, tiene 60 años de edad, reside en San Miguel departamento de San Miguel, donde vive junto a su esposo, posee una tienda que nació por iniciativa propia, atendiendo todos los días de 6:00am a 7:00pm, este negocio tiene 15 años de existir y hasta el momento les ha solventado las necesidades del hogar.
Ella por el momento desea invertir en mercadería por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar arroz, pollo, azúcar, aceite, esta compra le ayudara a fortalecer la tienda, ofrecerá más productos a los clientes y espera que sus ventas aumenten.
Para doña María este negocio de tantos años, en el que ha trabajado mucho y del que ha obtenido ingresos para sostener al día los gastos del hogar, espera que siga siendo rentable y que le estabilice su condición económica.
texts.en:
Doña María, age 60, lives with her husband in the San Miguel department of San Miguel. She started her own store 15 years ago. It's open every day from 6:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. The income from this business is enough to cover María's household expenses. She is now requesting a loan to invest in merchandise such as rice, chicken, sugar, and oil. 

This purchase will strengthen the store by allowing María to offer more products to her customers and thus, to increase her sales income. María has worked hard to build her business and hopes that it will remain profitable enough to support her economically.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, chicken, sugar, and oil.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es: Adelaida, de 37 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Hugo de 38 años que es obrero y de sus 3 pequeños hijos; juntos se esfuerzan a diario para salir adelante. Esta empeñosa mujer se dedica a la costura de pedrería en prendas de vestir. Esta muy satisfecha con su labor pues la desempeña, de lunes a viernes, durante sus ratos libres ya que una intermediaria le deja la ropa a ella y un grupo de amigas de la zona donde vive para que se dediquen al pegado de diversos tipos de pedrería que adornan diversas prendas. Le pagan semanalmente de acuerdo al volumen de prendas que termino el trabajo, y ayuda a su esposo en los constantes gastos del hogar. Tiene muchos planes para el futuro como el de instalar un negocio propio, pero sabe que debe terminar primero de construir su casa. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar laborando en busca del progreso. Adelaida tiene planeado invertir el crédito en materiales para terminar de tarrajear las paredes de su casa por el interior, pues desea continuar progresando y que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Adelaida is 37 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Hugo, a 38 year old construction worker, and their three small children. Together they strive each day to move forward in life. 

This industrious woman works sewing beaded jewellery into items of clothing. She is very satisfied with her occupation, working from Monday to Friday and also in her spare time, since an intermediary passes on clothes that require beadwork to her and a group of friends from her community. Adelaida is paid weekly according to the number of items of clothing that she completes and this money helps her husband with the constant home expenses. They have many plans for the future, including setting up their own business, but Adelaida knows that they should finish building their own house first. 

This is the second loan that Adelaida has taken out with MFP and she promises to make her repayments on time. She doesn't want to make a bad impression on the people who make this loan possible, as it allows her to continue working towards progress. Adelaida plans to invest this loan in materials to finish plastering the interior walls of her home. She wants to continue making progress so that her family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Maria Herminia

texts.es:
María de 27 años de edad, está soltera vive con su madre y un hermano, residen en Usulután, es empleada en una tienda distribuidora de lácteos, encargada de ventas, esta tienda está ubicada en la ciudad de El Transito, María tiene ya 5 años de contar con este empleo.
Ella por el momento su necesidad es cubrir los gastos educativos para su hermano menor, ya que ella se encarga de pagar la colegiatura por el año y comprar útiles, por eso solicita un préstamo y salir de este gasto lo antes posible.
Su objetivo es seguir trabajando para ayudar a su familia y que su hermano se prepare estudiando para que tenga en un futuro una oportunidad de empleo distinta a la de ella.
texts.en:
Maria is 27 years old, single and lives with her mother and brother. She lives in Usulutan. She works for a store that sells milk products. She is in charge of sales. This store is located in the city of El Transito. Maria has been working here for the past five years.
Right now Maria needs to pay for the cost of schooling for her younger brother. She is in charge of paying his yearly educational expenses including school supplies. She is asking for a loan to pay for these costs as soon as possible.
Her objectives are to continue working in order to help her family and her brother. He is studying so that he has greater opportunities in the future. She would like him to have a different type of work than she has.

loans.use: To pay for her brother's educational expenses and school supplies.

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doña Gloria, es una comerciante de pan y administra un comedor, tiene 45 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, vive con su esposo, el negocio es familiar y trabaja todos los días de la semana, vende pan por las tardes y comida desde la mañana hasta el mediodía, tiene clientela abundante.
Por el momento está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales de cocina, estos los necesita en el día a día para preparar la comida que ofrece a los clientes, su compra será en carnes, verduras, condimentos y aceite, manteniendo con estos variedad en su cocina y vender a los clientes platillos de calidad.
Su objetivo es progresar con sus dos negocios, empleando a personas para que distribuyan su pan y ampliar el comedor,  garantizando ingresos diariamente para el mantenimiento del negocio y de los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria sells bread and runs a food stall. She is 45 years old. She lives in San Miguel with her husband. This is a family business and she works every day of the week. She sells bread in the afternoons and prepared food from the morning until the middle of the day. She has a lot of customers.
Right now she is asking for a loan in order to buy kitchen supplies. These she needs in order to prepare the daily meals for her customers. She will buy meat, vegetables, condiments and oil in order to have a variety of food products in her kitchen and sell quality prepared food to her customers.
Her objectives are to progress with her two businesses. She would like to employ people to sell her bread. She would like to expand her food stall in order to increase her daily earnings. The earnings will be used to maintain her business and also for household expenses

loans.use: She will buy meat, vegetables, condiments and oil.

loans.name: Elvin Alexander

texts.es:
Elvin es un joven de 20 años de edad, reside en Guatajiagua departamento de Morazán, está soltero vive con su madre, a quien le ayuda mucho desarrollando su trabajo que es el barro creando ollas y comales, también está aprendiendo el trabajo de estructuras metálicas, la alfarería la aprendió por sus padres y las estructuras metálicas las ha aprendido de Don José un señor vecino que tiene un taller de esta actividad y le ha ofrecido trabajo para que él aprenda y pueda tener otro ingreso para ayudar a su madre.
Por el momento Elvin está solicitando un préstamo para  comprar materia prima para la elaboración de loza (barro, leña, nacazcol) también comprara hierro pintura e insumos necesarios para las estructuras metálicas.
El dinero de este préstamo será una gran ayuda para su familia, pues es una oportunidad de abastecer de materiales el trabajo que a diario realizan, también él tendrá materiales para comenzar a crear sus propios inicios en el taller de estructuras. El sueño actual es crear su propio taller de estructuras, ganar clientes y realizar su trabajo de la mejor manera demostrando la experiencia adquirida.
texts.en:
Elvin is a young person who is 20 years old. He lives in Guatajiagua, in the department of Morazan. He is single and lives with his mother. She helps him a lot with his business, which is creating pots and griddles out of clay. He is also learning how to make metal items. The making of pottery he learned from his parents. He learned how to work with metal from his neighbor, Don Jose, who has a metal workshop. Don Jose offered him work so that he could learn this skill and have another form of income in order to help his mother. This time Elvin is asking for a loan in order to buy raw materials in order to make loza, which is a combination of mud, small wood and black seeds that are used as a colorant. He also will buy painted iron and other ingredients that he needs for metal fabrication.
The money from this loan will be a big help to his family. It is an opportunity to stock up on the work materials that he needs on a daily basis. He also would like materials to use to begin to create his own items in the metal workshop. His dream is to have his own metal workshop, acquire customers and do his work in the best way he is able thereby showing he is capable.

loans.use: He will buy the raw materials used to make clay (mud, small sticks and black seeds used as a colorant).

loans.name: Elvin Nahun

texts.es:
Elvin tiene 23 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera departamento de Morazán, se dedica a vender refrescos, está soltero y vive con sus padres, este joven es trabajador, ayuda a su madre con sus necesidades y ve por sus propios gastos siendo independiente para sus padres.
El inicio ayudándole a su madre, luego se dedico a vender de forma permanente para contar con un ingreso estable, su inconveniente es que en ocasiones se le terminan los materiales para preparar los refrescos por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar materiales en abundancia de aquellos productos de más duración, como azúcar y frutas de duración, esta será una gran ayuda para él ya que su inventario lo enriquecerá de productos y aumentara su producción de refrescos.
Su objetivo es algún día tener el negocio solvente de deudas y mejorar la condición económica de él y de sus padres.
texts.en: Elvin, 23, lives in San Francisco Gotera in the Morazán area and sells soft drinks. He is single and lives with his parents. This young man is hardworking and helps his mother with the necessities. He is responsible for his own expenses and financially independent from his parents. He began his business by helping his mother and now sells full-time so he can have a stable income. One inconvenience is that he sometimes runs out of materials to prepare his soft drinks and must ask for a loan to buy bulk materials for those longer-lasting products such as sugar and fruit. This will be a great help for him to enrich his product inventory and increase his soft drink production. His goal is to one day have a business solvent of debt and to be able to improve his and his parents’ economic statuses.

loans.use: to buy fruit and sugar to prepare soft drinks

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es: Zonia, de 35 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de sus 2 hijos jóvenes, juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Desde hace 4 años, esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta de salchipapas (papas y hot dog fritos) y caldo de gallina en un puesto que ha instalado en el patio de su vivienda. Esta muy satisfecha pues este negocio le rinde buenas ganancias, y ella empieza a trabajar con la ayuda de su hija mayor, desde las 6 de la tarde hasta las 10 de la noche, de lunes a domingo. Manifiesta que a pesar que su negocio requiere bastante tiempo, pues alista los platillos desde muy temprano. Esta muy contenta con las ganancias que recibe, ya que le han permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos. Para el futuro desea ampliar las instalaciones de su negocio para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus comensales. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Zonia tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de varias javas de gaseosa, pues quiere surtir mejor su negocio e implementarlo con estas bebidas.
texts.en: Zonia, 35, lives in her own house with her two teenaged daughters, and together they make an effort to get ahead.  For the past 4 years this enterprising woman has sold “salchipapas” (fried potatoes and hot dogs) and chicken soup in a stand that she installed on the patio of her home.  She is very satisfied because this business has given her a good profit.  She begins working with the help of her oldest daughter at 6 pm and stays open to 10 pm, Mondays through Sundays.  She shows that although the business is very time-consuming, she has the food ready very early.  She is very content with the earnings that she is getting since they have allowed her to get her family ahead.  In the future she wants to enlarge the space for her business to offer better service to her customers.  This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to make the payments punctually so that she stays on the good side of those who have made her ability to continue working possible.  Zonia plans to use the money from the loan to buy some soft drinks so that she can better stock her business with these drinks.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks to offer to her customers

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 57 años, queda separada de su esposo y vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía de  sus 3 hijos mayores que tiene su familia. Desde hace muchos años, desde la ventana de su casa,  Luz vende gaseosas, galletas, frugos y cervezas.  Los fines de semana; son días muy arduos para ella, ya que vende cerveza hasta altas horas de la noche a sus vecinos y otros jóvenes deportistas de la loza aledaña a su casa, que le prefieren comprar a ella, por su buen trato y su gran paciencia, es así que capta  buenas utilidades; sin embargo la venta de las demás bebidas gasificadas no le genera muchas rentas. Por ello su anhelo  es instalar una puerta para el acceso de la gente a su  establecimiento, asimismo desea surtirla con todos los productos comestibles a  su bodega, ya que el negocio le gusta mucho y sobre todo conversar con sus clientes. Es el 12avo crédito con MFP, y como socia antigua se compromete pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente como hasta hoy, además en su banco comunal es muy respetada por su responsabilidad. De contar con el crédito que solicita, comprará cervezas y gaseosas por la temporada de verano.
texts.en:
Luz is 57 years old and is separated from her husband.  She lives in her own home with her 3 older children that have families of their own.  Luz has been selling soft drinks, candy, frugos [fruit beverages] and beer from a window in her house for many years now.  The weekends are difficult for her as she sells beer to her neighbors and young athletes from the sport courts in her neighborhood until late into the night.  They prefer to buy from her because she treats them well and has lots of patience.  This is how she makes a good profit as she does not make much from the sale of her other beverages. She would like to install a door so that people have access to her store, then she would be able to stock all kinds of grocery items in her store.  She really likes this business and most of all she likes conversing with her customers.  

This is her 12th loan with MFP and as a long time member she is committed to making her payments on time, as she has done in the past.  Additionally, her communal bank is very respected because they are so responsible.  With the loan she will buy beer and soft drinks for the summer season.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks and beer

loans.name: José Ramón

texts.es:
El señor José Ramón U. U., es trabajador en una empresa aguadora ocupando el cargo de Guiriza en la sección de conexiones nuevas desde hace 3 años.

Es soltero de 25 años de edad,  con 2 personas a su cargo una de ella en edad escolar. El habita en la ciudad de Managua en la comarca de sábana grande desde hace 10 años.

Este es el primer crédito que tiene en CEPRODEL, el cuál solicita para invertirlo en compra de material para mejora de vivienda como es Zinc, perlìnes, clavos y otros. Para poder tener una casa con mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Señor José Ramón U. U., works for a water company.  He has been in charge of new connections for Guiriza for 3 years.  

He is a single 25-year-old, with 2 people in his care, one of them of school age.  He has lived in the city of Managua in the sábana grande region for 10 years.  

This is his first loan with CEPRODEL, which he has requested to invest in the purchase of materials to improve his home,  such as zinc, purlins (roof supprts), and nails among other things, so that he will be able to have a house with better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mejora de vivienda

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Juan Manuel P., esta agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudo operar realizarle la operación que su hijo requería en ese momento.
A su vivienda le esta haciendo falta la barda alrededor, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el materia. Es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo ya que le preocupa la protección y la seguridad de su familia. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de los ingresos que obtiene de su trabajo como ingeniero de electrónica de una maquiladora.
texts.en: Señor Juan Manuel P. is grateful for your cooperation with his previous loan, which allowed him to pay for an operation that his son needed.  His home lacks a protective wall around it, but he does not have the necessary money to be able to buy the materials.  That is why he is requesting a loan, since he is worried at the lack of protection and security for his family.  He plans to repay the loan with a part of the income that he earns from his work as an electronics engineer in a bonded assembly plant.

loans.use: To build a protective wall around his house.

loans.name: José María

texts.es:
El señor, José María D. R. trabaja como fontanero en una empresa aguadora desde 2 años. Vive en la ciudad de Managua Carretera vieja a León comunidad los cedros.

Es soltero de 43 años de edad, tiene 3 personas a su cargo dos de ellas son menores en edad escolar

Agradece a CEPRODEL, ya que le permite con este préstamo comprar los materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, perlínes, piedra cantera que tanto lo necesita para invertir en la mejora de su casa ya que después viene el invierno y no podrá construir. Este es su primer crédito con CEPRODEL y espera pagar en tiempo y forma para poder seguir siendo cliente.
texts.en:
Señor, José María D. R. has worked as a plumber in a water company for 2 years.  He lives in the city of Managua on the old road to León, community of the cedars.  

He is a single 43-year-old who has 3 people in his care, two of whom are of school age.

He is grateful to CEPRODEL, since with this loan they permit him to buy building materials such as cement, iron, perlínes (roof supports), and quarry stone that he needs so much to invest in the improvement of his house since winter is coming and he will not be able to build then.  This is his first loan with CEPRODEL and he expects to repay on time in order to continue as a client.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials for his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For home improvement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For home improvement and to cover school expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Eden's Group

texts.en:
Eden E. is from the village of Nagrumbuan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 56 years old. Eden is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Eden is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Eden owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Eden has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Eden joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eden has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Eden is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Eden from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Harselina's Group

texts.en:
Harselina G. is from the village of Maligaya, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 50 years old. Harselina is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Harselina is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Harselina owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Harselina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Harselina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Harselina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Harselina is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Harselina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea B., 52, is set to break the common notion about being a farmer's wife. Irenea, a CCT* Community Partner, is, unlike common wives of farmers, a productive entrepreneur. She is married to Ignacio, and they have seven children. Three of them are already working, one is in elementary, and the other three are not yet of school age. They live as one family in Silang, Cavite.

Running a sari-sari (variety) store is the main focus of Irenea. She sells valuable products that meet the daily, immediate needs of her community. Being 35 years in business, she quite knows what her regular customers need. She also sells vegetables to support her customers' call for a balanced diet. Monthly, Irenea earns a net income of Php 7,900.

To further help her grow her business, Irenea decides to apply for a Php 18,000 loan. This she plans to use to furnish her store with more variety of products that will meet different tastes of different customers. She also plans to start selling meat as well. With this loan money at hand, she is set to break her perceived limitations when it comes to business.

Irenea admits that she also has customers who do not pay their debts. However, she also wants to break that bad habit of theirs and see that her business will prosper. Quite simply, she dreams of securing a bright future for her whole family. 


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: purchase of grocery items and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Esgar

texts.es:
Esgar tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su familia en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Olmos, una zona caracterizada por producir limón y otras frutas como la maracuyá. La zona pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar actividades de transporte) el brinda este servicio cubriendo rutas que unen los caseríos cercanos a donde reside y depende de los ingresos que esta actividad de brinde para sustentar sus gastos personales y apoyar al sostenimiento económico de su familia.

El continuo uso brindado a su mototaxi y el estado accidentado de los caminos de las zonas que recorre diariamente han hecho que su unidad móvil empiece a sufrir algunos daños que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento. Para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Esgar is 26 years old, single and lives with his family in a country house in the Olmos farm district, in an area known for their lemon production and other fruit such as maracuya.  The area belongs to the province of Lambayeque and is located over two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

He has a cargo and passenger service for which he uses a motorized rickshaw (actually a motorcycle with transport cabin attached).  He operates along the route that connects homes where he lives and uses the income to cover personal expenses and help out with family expenses. 

The continous use of his motorized rickshaw and the bad pavement of the roads he has to travel daily have caused some damage to the rickshaw which now requires urgent repair to continue working in optimum condition.  To cover costs he has applied for a loan of 1200 PEN through Edpyme Alternative.

loans.use: To repair his motorized rickshaw

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
Fedelina S., 48, believes that being part of CCT* as a Community Partner is a blessing. Fedelina has no college background; nevertheless, she is able to put up a business of her own. She is married to Pedro, a foreman, and they have five children. One of them now works for a living.

A residential ready-to-wear (RTW) business is what Fedelina works on for more than five years now. She buys quality shirts, bags, pants, and shoes, and sells them to business acquaintances and neighbors. But aside from that, she also focuses on her piggery. She raises piglets and makes sure they grow healthy to produce good pork products. Monthly, she earns around Php 11,000 from these two businesses.

To help Fedelina continue operation of her business, she would like to apply for a Php 16,000.  She plans to use this loan to buy hog feeds and other materials needed to sustain her piggery even as the piglets are still being raised.  She also plans to use this loan in buying quality Ready-to-Wear products which will suit the tastes of her regular customers.

Frustrations never cease to exist even in the life of Fedelina, but she chooses to focus on her goal rather than on the obstacles. She dreams of seeing her businesses grow and eventually expand. More than anything else, she wants to see her children finish schooling and be a blessing not just to her, but to the entire community.
 	
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: hog feeds and quality ready-to-wear items usually ordered by her customers

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en un sector urbano marginal del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, uno de los distritos más poblados de la región, se caracteriza por tener a la mayor parte de su población situada en zonas marginales. Es conocido por su abundante movimiento comercial y de transporte.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio en donde ofrece en venta a sus vecinos diversos productos de uso diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes, ella suele atender a sus clientes con mucho esmero y carisma, por ello actualmente cuenta con un grupo de cliente fieles que prefieren comprar en su bodega. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo, con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Esperanza desea implementar su negocio con más productos de modo que pueda ampliar sus ventas y satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar  a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Esperanza is 50 years old, married and lives with her family in the urban slum area in the José Leonardo Ortiz district.  It is one of the most populous districts in the region with most of its inhabitants living in substandard housing.  It is well known for the abundant trade and transportation activity there.

She has a small store in her home and offers staple goods and all kinds of groceries.  She is very attentive and caring and therefore has loyal customers who prefer to do their shopping at her store.  She uses the earnings from her business to help her husband cover household expenses.

Esperanza wants to increase her stock of products so she can increase sales and meet her customers' demands.  She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternative for 1500 PEN which she plans to use to reach her goal.

loans.use: To buy goods for her store

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
This is 28 year-old Rama B..  She is married and has one child, aged 10.  In 2010, she established her grocery store business.  Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buys grocery goods for her business.  In the future, Rama plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.  In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. 

Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
 
BPW Partner Page     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team"

loans.use: to buys grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Janete

texts.en:
Not everyone is comfortable dealing with change. Janete P., 42, feels quite the same, though she is sure that God will enable her to overcome. Janete is a college graduate, and now she applies what she learned from school and what she gets from her training in CCT* as a Community Partner to make her business prosper. She is married to Antonio, who has a regular work as a driver. They raise their children in Cavite--two college students and one high school student.

Janete is a water dealer, and by this she provides clean, distilled water to her community for almost five years now. She also sells electronic load (e-load) for mobile phones, since Filipinos are avid texters. Sometimes, she also buys and sells pawn tickets. With these she earns around Php 7,000 monthly. 

To help her grow her business, Janete decides to apply for a Php 9,000 loan. She plans to use the money to level up her water business, as well as to boost up her e-load business. She believes that by doing so, she increases the profitability of her businesses, which are the main sources of income of her family.
 
Admitting that a frequent change of business is troublesome for her is one thing Janete has to do in order to decide focusing on one or two and making it grow profitably. From there, she hopes to make her business really work. Janete simply wants her family to have better living conditions. 
 	

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: purchase of materials to increase sales

loans.name: Adriano

texts.es:
Adriano es un padre de familia de 59 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus cuatro hijos en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona se cL. semitropical que se caracteriza principalmente por du producción de frutas como mango y limón. Pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra ubicado a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno. Él cría a su ganado en algnos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio, las alimenta en base a granos y pastos naturales y cuando han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de sustento, por ello siempre trata de mantenerla del mejor modo posible. 

Actualmente Adriano desea mejorar la crianza de sus animales adquiriendo alimento balanceado con esta inversión él espera lograr que sus animales se desarrollen de un mejor modo para poder ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Adriano is the father of a family, he is 59 years old and he lives together with his wife and their four children in the community that makes up the agricultural district of Tambogrande. It is a semitropical region primarily known for fruit production such as mangoes and lemons. It belongs to the region of Piura and it is located more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo. 

He raises and sells livestock. He keeps his livestock in some corrals located near his house and he feeds them grains and natural grasses. When they have reached a good level of development he puts offers them up for sale to the merchants who visit the region where he lives. This business is his primary source of income which is why he always tries to manage it in the best way possible. 

Adriano wishes to improve his livestock business with the acquisition of balanced feed. This investment will help him raise his livestock in a better way and it will improve his sales and his earnings. In order to reach his objective he approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To purchase balanced livestock feed.

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
This is 29 year-old Sunita S..  She is married and has two children aged 12 and 7.  In 2001, she established her tailoring business.  Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buys raw materials for her tailoring business.  In the future, Sunita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.  In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order.  Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal.  With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability. This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. 

Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
 
BPW Partner Page     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team"

loans.use: to buys raw materials for tailoring business

loans.name: Violeta's Group

texts.en:
Violeta A. is from the village of Linglingay, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 44 years old. Violeta is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Violeta is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Violeta owns and operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Violeta has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Violeta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Violeta is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Violeta from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Cleotilde

texts.es:
Cleotilde es una cliente de 51 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona se clima semitropical que se caracteriza principalmente por du producción de frutas como mango y limón. Pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra ubicado a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de cerveza, chicha (bebida preparada en base a una harina llamada jora) y comida en un lugar acondicionado para esas labores en su domicilio.  Su negocio atiende los días viernes, sábados y domingos, ya que en su localidad se acostumbran las reuniones entre amigos, lo que hace que la gente de ese pueblo sea más unida. Esta actividad es su principal fuente de sustento, por ello siempre trata de mantenerla del mejor modo posible. 

Cleotilde desea aumentar su mercadería para venderla, así como también comprar insumos para preparar más comida, así ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Cleotilde is a 51-year old woman who lives together with her family in the community that makes up the agricultural district of Tambogrande. It is a semitropical region primarily known for fruit production such as mangoes and lemons. It belongs to the region of Piura and it is located more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo. 

She sells beer, chicha drink (a drink prepared from a jora flour base) and prepared foods from a space in her house remodeled for her business. She runs her business on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays because in her community friends come together, especially because the population of her community is very close.  This business is her primary source of income which is why she tries to manage it in the best way possible. 

Cleotilde wishes to increase her inventory for resale, and to purchase ingredients to prepare more foods in order to increase her sales and her earnings. In order to reach her objective she approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her restaurant.

loans.name: Jo-Ane

texts.en:
Jo-ane S., 39, is an entrepreneur with a knack for multitasking. She is a registered nurse, but found success in establishing businesses. Her trainings in CCT* as a Community Partner enable her to reach heights in business. Jo-ane is married to Marzan, a painter.  They live in Dasmarinas where they raise their only son, who is now in elementary.

Being in the direct-selling business, Jo-ane has developed the skill to choose the quality products and deal with people in the neighborhood to turn them into regular customers. She sells shirts, pants, bags, and shoes that suit the tastes of her friends and business connections. That is the reason her business works. Jo-ane also sells frozen foods to household people who take time to cook. Monthly, she earns an average net income of Php 10,800.  

Jo-ane wants to maximize her potential as a multitasking entrepreneur. To help her continue operation of her businesses, she would like to request for a  Php 31,000 loan. She plans to use this to increase the number of products she sells in order to better meet the specific needs of her regular customers. More importantly, she is planning to use a big part of the loan to start another business.

Sure enough, Jo-ane never misses her share of customers who do not pay on time. Nevertheless, she still prays for the ability to collect their payments and use the money in her soon-to-open business. All this multitasking is a means of preparation for the multifaceted future which she wants her only son to have.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: restocking inventory

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
There are people who cannot tolerate uncertainties in life. At 50, Petronila M. tries her best to minimize the uncertainties in her business and in her personal life. Petronila is married to Gabriel, who works as a driver. They live in Dasmarinas, Cavite, where they raise their four children. One of them is in college while another one is in elementary. They have a child who already works for a living, and one who stays at home.

Petronila is a dealer of charcoal and wood as cooking fuel, applying her learning from the training CCT* provides to its community partners. She buys sacks of it and repacks it into small packs worth Php 10. This she does to make it affordable to people in her community who often use it for cooking. With these, she earns an estimated net income around Php 10,000 every month.

To help her continue operation of her business, she would like to apply for a Php 8,000 loan. She plans to use this to buy more sacks of charcoal and bundles of woods as fuel to boost her business. She looks forward to an increased income due to this effort.

Customers and financial matters will always be a concern for her, but Petronila knows that God has given her the ability to produce wealth; the first step is to believe, and the next one is to take action. She faithfully does so, and she holds on to the promise that her dream of a prosperous business and a happy, healthy family will surely come to pass, despite all the present uncertainties.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: more sacks of charcoal and bundles of wood for household fuel

loans.name: Sandra Maribel

texts.es:
Sandra Maribel S. T., tiene 30 años de edad, reside en la Aldea Tasajeras junto a su familia que esta conformada por su esposo y sus dos pequeños hijos de 8,5 y 1 años. Sandra es una persona muy simpatica y muy conocida por sus vecinos. Ella Tiene una pequeña pulpería que funciona en su domicilio, con un horario de atención de 6:00 am 9:00 pm. Su principal ventaja es que no hay otra pulpería en el Aldea y eso le hace que todos sus vecinos hagan sus compras en su pulpería. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar abarrotería para surtir su negocio de más y variados productos de la canasta basica. Su meta es tener un mercadito y que este le permita obtener mayores ganancias para seguir apoyando a sus hijos con el estudio porque ella desea que sean profesionales y también que su de vida mejore. Es su primer ciclo en FAMA y espera cumplir con puntualidad el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Sandra Maribel S. T. is 30 years old and lives with her family in the town of Tasajeras. Her family is made up of her husband and three small children who are 8, 5, and 1 year old. Sandra is a very kind person who is well known by her neighbors. She has a small pulpería [grocery store] that she runs from her house from 6:00 am to 9:00 pm each day. Her main advantage is that there are no other pulperías in the town, and therefore all her neighbors come to her store to make their purchases. She needs this loan to buy groceries to stock her business with more products and with a greater variety of daily necessities. Her goal is to have a small market, as this would allow her to earn better profits so that she could continue supporting her children's studies. She hopes that they will be professionals and that their quality of life will improve. This is her first loan cycle with FAMA and she hopes to make her repayments punctually.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her store

loans.name: Josephfine's Group

texts.en:
Josephfine C. is from the village of Brgy. Bintawan Norte, Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 49 years old. Josephfine is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Josephfine is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Josephfine owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Josephfine has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Josephfine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephfine is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Josephfine from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Brgy. Bintawan Norte, Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Ireneo

texts.en:
One good characteristic of a winning entrepreneur is desiring to become better. At 50, Ireneo ignores the number of years he has lived and keeps in mind that there is more to learn or unlearn in order to improve his business. He lives with Jocelyn in Tanza, Cavite, where they raise three college children. 

For four years now, Ireneo rents out his vans to people who are looking for cheap transportation for special trips or group outings. He sees that this kind of business is profitable in his community, where people do not yet have their own cars to use. Aside from that, Ireneo also has an ice cream business located near their home. He earns an estimated income of around Php1,000 per day.

To help him continue operation of his business, he is requesting for a Php15,000 loan. He notices that an improvement has to be done in his shop. Part of the loan, then, will go to this purpose. As a Community Partner, he also continuously applies what he learns from CCT* to make this business grow, along with his ice cream business.

Ireneo presently struggles with coming up with new ideas for his business. He sees that if he has to keep up with the times, he has to give his business a new look. All that his heart desires is to see that his labor is not in vain, and that part of his income goes to his savings for his family. He anticipates a big improvement on his business, and a source of blessings that never runs out.
	
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Improving the shop

loans.name: Gertruda

texts.en:
If one would dream for one’s self or one’s family, why not dream for the best? Gertruda R., 34, dreams for the best, but more than that, she acts to make it a reality. Ruby, as she is called by friends, reached college and is married to Joseph Ryan, a general manager. They have a child who is in elementary school. Together they live in Pasay City.

With the learning she gains as a Community Partner in CCT*, Ruby runs her own sari-sari (variety) store to capitalize on the big target market she has in her community. She has been doing business here for two years. It is quite easy for her since it is a residential business, and there is not much need at present to hire employees. She earns Php800 a day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she would like to request for a Php15,000 loan. This she plans to buy more grocery items to put in her store, so that it would not have to look bare and incomplete. Ruby takes effort to maintain her business in good shape, because a profitable business translates to family needs being met and the schooling of her child being supported. 

Ruby struggles with time management when it comes to balancing business, health and family life. One proof of this is her health problem. However, she sees to it that these struggles will not prevent her from reaching her dreams for her family. She desires to see her small store grow and eventually expand. She dreams of good health for everyone in the family, having their own house and lot, and permanent job for her husband, and a big happy family. Deep inside, she knows that if there is faith, and action, it will be possible.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Grocery items and rice for her store

loans.name: Unidas Por El Amor Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Unidas por el amor está integrado por 11 socias y dos socios, los cuales realizan diferentes actividades económicas. La sra. Maria Salome S. Z., es la coordinadora del banco comunal, tiene 53 años de edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, y reside en la comunidad del Rusio en el municipio de Juticalpa, Olancho. Inicio su negocio con el primer credito que obtuvo en FAMA en el a;o 2002, es una mujer luchadora y tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación que atiende ella y su esposo. Maria atraviesa un problema de salud llamado paralisis facial y muy a menudo tiene que comprar medicamentos.

El préstamo que solicita lo necesita para comprar azúcar, arroz, refrescos, manteca, carnes, pollo, embutidos, pan, etc. Con el apoyo del préstamo tendrá más y mejor surtido su negocio y sus clientes podrán encontrar todo lo que necesitan para preparar sus alimentos y asi ella podra cubrir los gastos de la casa y su salud. Su meta es hacer crecer su negocio hasta inagurar un mercadito, tambien sue;a con hacerle mejoras a su casa porque esta bien deteriorada

Maria Salome ha sido cliente de FAMA por nueve a;os y espera pagar las cuotas de este nuevo prestamo de forma puntual y responsable como hasta en la actualidad.
texts.en:
The 'Unidas por el Amor' (United by Love) community bank is made up of 11 women and 2 men who each carry out different business activities.  Maria Salome S. Z. is the coordinator of the community bank.  She is 53 years old, married, has four children and lives in Rusio neighborhood, in the town of Juticalpa, Olancho.  Maria set up her business with the first loan that she received from FAMA in 2002.  She is a hard-working woman who owns a small grocery store in her home that both she and her husband serve in.  Maria Salome suffers from a health problem called 'facial paralysis' and she has to buy medicine very often.  

Maria needs this loan to buy sugar, rice, soft drinks, butter, meat, chicken, sausages, bread, etc.  Through the support of this loan, she will be able to have a better stocked business and her customers will be able to find everything they need to prepare their meals.  This will, in turn, allow Maria to cover her household and health expenses.  Maria's goal is to grow her business until she owns a mini-market.  She also dreams of making improvements to her home because it is in a bad state of repair.

Maria Salome has been a client of FAMA for nine years and she hopes to make all the repayments on her new loan punctually and responsibly as she has  with her previous loans.

loans.use: To buy general groceries

loans.name: Remelita

texts.en:
We do not need to make a lot of mistakes before we learn. At the age of 32, Remelita, as she is called by friends, learns the ways of both business and life to get going at a better pace. She finished only 2nd year high school, but her training in CCT as a Community Partner enables her to run a business with confidence. She is married to Marco Antonio, a driver.  They used to live in Cebu City, but now they reside in Maricaban, Pasay City, with their three children. One of them is already in college, while the two others are in elementary.

Remelita has been in the direct selling for two years, but is still doing her best to master her trade. She tries to figure out what her customers like when it comes to bags, shoes, shirts, and pants. With no employees to help her sell, she gives her utmost strength to make her business work. She earns an estimated net income of around Php3,000 per month.

To help her grow her business, Lita applies for a Php15, 000 loan. She will use this money to buy quality apparel to make sure that her customers will get only the best in the market. With this money on hand, she can easily improve on her business, one lesson she got in her fellowship* with fellow community partners.

Just like any micro entrepreneur, Remelita also suffers from customers who do not pay their debts. But as she is learning how to be a successful entrepreneur, she also learns how to deal with such difficult times in business. The simplest dreams she has in her heart is for everyone in the family to have good health, and to see her children graduate from college.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Purchase additional quality apparels for selling

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Goals are nothing unless one takes the effort to meet them. Lina L., 37, knows this, and gives her best to accomplish the goals she has set for her and her family. She has finished her high school education and is married to Primo, 47, a market vendor. They have four children who are currently attending elementary and high school.

Lina presently runs a sari-sari (variety) store which caters to needs that are more immediate than the nearest grocery in the community. Lina also operates from home a burger stand which she has run for almost a year now, and has gained regular customers who keep her business alive. She employs no one, and earns at least Php10, 000 estimated net income per month.

To help Lina continue operation of her business, she is requesting for a Php23,000 loan. She will use this to buy goods that her customers prefer. She will see to it that her store will not lack any valuable thing that her customers need, so that they will make her their number one sari-sari store in the community.  She also plans to use part of this loan to purchase needed materials for her burger stand.

Lina learns the value of improving one’s business, and thus works to innovate her own. She does not emphasize any problem she encounters but rather focuses on its solution. Goals cannot be met just by identifying the problem, but by acting on them. One most important goal she has in mind is to support her children until their college graduation, with which she will feel most fulfilled.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Purchase raw ingredients for her burger stand and additional items for her variety store

loans.name: Ligaya's Group

texts.en:
Ligaya A. is from the village of Brgy. Escoting, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 50 years old. Ligaya is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Ligaya is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Ligaya owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Ligaya has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ligaya joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ligaya has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ligaya is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ligaya from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Agnes' Group

texts.en:
Agnes T. is from the village of Gamis Saguday Quirino. She is 48 years old. Agnes is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Agnes is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Agnes owns & operates a business venture in the arts sector operating a handicraft business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling general handicrafts to tourists and local community members. Agnes has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Agnes joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Agnes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional handicrafts to sell. Agnes is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Agnes from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts

loans.name: Anie

texts.en:
If one would dream for one’s self or one’s family, why not dream for the best? Anie Valerio, 40, dreams for the best, but more than that, she acts to make it a reality. Anie is married to Manolito Valerio, a Liason Officer. They have two children who are currently in high school and college.

Anie runs her own small restaurant for a year now.  She mobilizes members of her family to help her. It is quite easy for her to manage since it is a residential business, and there is not much need at present to hire employees.  Her customers are her neighbors and the entire community. She earns at least Php11,000 estimated net income every month.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting for a Php15,000 loan. She plans to use this to buy raw ingredients, sacks of rice, and other materials needed for her restaurant operation. Anie takes effort to maintain her business in good shape, because a profitable business translates to family needs being met and the schooling of her children being supported. 

She dreams of having good health for everyone in the family and able to send all her children all the way through college.  As CCT community partner, she is faithfully attending her weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.  She believes that if there is faith in God, and action, everything will be possible.
	
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Purchase needed ingredients and other materials to continue operation of her restaurant

loans.name: Edeliza

texts.en:
Edeliza T., 48 years old, is a resident of Malibay, Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Eduardo T. and are blessed with three children who are currently go to high school and college.

Edeliza operates a rug-making business having her husband as business partner. She primarily sells doormats but she also sells rugs, towels, braided quilts, bed sheets, and other crafts. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a Php20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional raw materials, such as fabric, thread, and newspapers for patterns. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Edeliza dreams of giving her children a good education through her hard work at her business. She always prays for good health and able to enjoy life to the fullest along with her family.  As CCT community partner, she faithfully attends to their weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.

* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups meet each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: Purchase materials needed for rug-making

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.en:
Anastacio E. is from the village of Nagbukel, San Isidro. He is 45 years old. Anastacio is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Anastacio owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Anastacio has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Anastacio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anastacio is requesting a new loan of 21000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Anastacio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Adalia

texts.en:
Adalia L. is from the village of Camarag, San Isidro. She is 54 years old. Adalia is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Adalia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Adalia has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.
