Jose es divorciado y no tiene hijos, vive con una tia. sus tiempos libres lo dedica a visitar a su demas familia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales electricos.
Jose hace varias instalaciones de luz electrica en diferetes casas y negocios.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose Luis Nunez is a working man and very dedicated to his job. Jose works selling electrical materials and also provides installation service. Every day he gets up at 5 in the morning to do his work in various places around his community.  Jose performs installations of electric light in various houses and businesses. 

Jose is divorced and has no children. He lives with an aunt. He spends his free time visiting his family. The loan will be used to buy electrical materials.

loans.use: to buy electrical materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: housing construction

loans.name: Virginia De Jesus

texts.es:
doña Virginia de Jesus A. tiene 59 años de edad, vive en el Barrio el Centro del Triunfo Choluteca y se dedica a su negocio que es una chiclera,  tiene la ayuda economica de su esposo para cubrir con los gastos el hogar, juntos trabajan duro para sacar adelante su hogar. Virginia es madre de 4 hijos, adultos  y ya no dependen de ella economicamente.
en sus sus tiempos libres lo dedican a visitar la iglesia y visitar la familia.
el credito lo utilizaran para comprar mercaderia y asi surtir su chiclera. 
nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que a logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos y que sus metas poco a poco se le han estado cumpliendo.
texts.en: Ms. Virginia de Jesus A. is 59 years old, lives in the neighborhood of Centro del Triunfo Cholucteca and works in her own business as a snack vender.  She has the help of her husband to cover the household expenses. Together they are working hard to get ahead for their home and family. Virginia is the mother of 4 adult children who no longer depend on her financially. In her free time she visits church and family. The loan will be used to buy merchandise and to stock her snackbar. She commented to us that she feels very happy that she is succeeding already in getting ahead for her children and that little by little she has been accomplishing her goals.

loans.use: to buy churros, candies, cookies, juices, soft drinks, bonbons and gum.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es:
El señor Marcelo C. S. es trabajador de una empresa de Acueducto y alcantarillado, desempeñando el cargo de Gestor Colector desde hace 9 años.

Es casado con 3 personas a su cargo, 3 de estas están en edad escolar, el habita en la ciudad de Managua, Municipio de Managua.

Este es el primer crédito que tiene con CEPRODEL, lo solicita para compra de vehículo para poder ir a dejar a los niños a la escuela y desplazarse a su trabajo, ya que este está lejano de su domicilio.
texts.en:
Mr. Marcelo C. S. has worked in a water and waste management company as collection manager for 9 years.

He is married and has three dependents, all of which are of school age. He lives in the city of Managua in the municipality of Managua. 

This is the first loan that he is taking with CEPRODEL. He is requesting it to buy a vehicle with which to drop off his kids at school and get to work, since it is far from his home.

loans.use: To buy a vehicle

loans.name: Aura Leticia

texts.es:
doña Aura Leticia V. tiene 45 años de edad, vive en el Triunfo choluteca y se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene su negocio en su casa de habitacion.
Aura es una mujer emprendedora, se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para hacer sus ricas tortillas y luego salir a  venderlas, ademas cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo que trabajan duro para sacar adelante su familia.  
sus tiempos libres lo dedican a visitar la iglesia y a sus familiares.
tambien se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maiz, leña, cal para tener una mayor produccion de tortillas.
texts.en:
Ms. Aura Leticia V. is 45 years old. She lives in Triunfo, Choluteca and makes and sells tortillas. Her business is in her home.  Aura is an entrepreneurial woman; she gets up at 4am to make her delicious tortillas and later go out to sell them. She also has help from her husband who works hard to get the family ahead.

She spends her free time going to church and with her relatives. She also raises and sells chickens and pigs.

She will use the loan to buy corn, firewood and lime to increase her production of tortillas.

loans.use: To buy corn, lime, firewood, water, matches

loans.name: Munawar's Group

texts.en:
Munawar is a widow; she lost her husband a few years ago as a result of sudden death. It was a very difficult time for her but she recovered her senses and started working at people's homes to survive financially. 

Now all three of her sons do different work, so Munawar has stopped working. She now stays at home and does her household responsibilities. Her two eldest sons are electricians by profession and have a workshop in the market, where they repair refrigerators and other electronic items. Her youngest son sells clothes. He makes bulk purchases from Multan and Faisalabad and sells in his local city. They all contribute to their family financially through their earnings.  

Munawar has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sons, who want to improve their electronics-repair business. With the loan, they will purchase the latest repairing tools, which will help them do their business better and offer quality services to their clients. 

They have been operating this business for the past six years and Munawar is confident that an investment will improve their business and increase their income. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meetings. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding the book called Asasah Passbook is Munawar.

loans.use: To buy the latest repairing tools for an electronics-repairing business

loans.name: Jose Celino

texts.es:
don Jose Celino M. vive En el Barrio el Centro el Triunfo Choluteca y se dedica al procesamiento y venta de semillas de marañon, este producto tiene demanda ya que es muy sabroso.
Jose es padre de 6 hijos los cuales ya son adultos.
junto con su esposa trabajan duro para cubrir sus gastos personales y los gastos del hogar.
Jose todos los dias se levanta a las 5 de la mañana  para  salir a vender sus semillas en caserios cercanos.
su tiempo libre se lo dedica a su esposa.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de semillas de marañon para luego procesarlas y venderlas, este tipo de producto al final del proceso quedan como cacahuates crujientes y saladitos.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose Celino M. lives in the center of Triunfo, Choluteca. He processes and sells cashews. There is demand for this product, since it is delicious. Jose is the father of 6 children, who are already adults. Together with his wife, they work hard to meet their personal and household expenses.  Jose gets up at 5 every day to go out and sell his nuts in nearby villages. 

He dedicates his free time to his wife. 

He will use the loan to buy cashews, in order to later process and sell them. At the end of the process, the final product is like crunchy and salty peanuts.

loans.use: To buy cashews

loans.name: Carlos Jadith

texts.es: El Sr. Carlos Jadith F. C. vive junto a su esposa e hija. Vive en casa alquilada la cual se encuentra ubicada en el caserio de casablanca. El Sr. Carlos trabaja como obrero de campo en diferentes fundos de la zona hace varios años. Su esposa tambien es obrera de campo. El Sr. Carlos solicita el crédito para la compra de un modulo de vivienda. Su sueño según nos comenta es tener su propio terreno y poder construir su vivienda. El está muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a trávez de este financiamiento.
texts.en: Mr. Carlos C. Carlos Jadith lives together with his wife and daughter. They live in a rental home located in the village of Casa Blanca. Carlos is an agricultural worker on various farms in the area. His wife is also an agricultural worker. Carlos is seeking the loan to buy a housing unit. He tells us that his dream is to have his own piece of land on which to construct his house. Carlos is very grateful for the support that we can provide him through this financing.

loans.use: Mejoramiento de vivienda

loans.name: Bilqis' Group

texts.en:
Bilqis lives in Jaranwala, which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in the area of Hussain Nagar with her family in a two-room brick house.  

Bilqis is married to A. B., who runs a motor workshop in the market. He started this business 30 years ago and now it is working well for him.  

She has given birth to three sons and a daughter. Her youngest son and daughter are studying while the others work with their father in his motor workshop business.  

Bilqis herself is a housewife and does her household responsibilities by staying at home. She is a very active lady and always shows full support to her husband in difficult times.
  
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her family business. With the loan, her husband will buy the latest repairing tools for his workshop to further improve his business.  

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has always paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.  

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book called the Asasah passbook is Bilqis.

loans.use: To buy the latest repairing tools for a motor workshop

loans.name: Ada Petrona

texts.es:
Ada es una mujer trabajadora, madre soltera de dos hijos. Tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de leche agria, helados y bocadillos, iniciando por iniciativa propia para poder solventar sus gastos. Ya que se quedo sin trabajo, el cual laboraba como promotora venta.
Hoy en día, necesita aumentar sus productos de ventas, lo que recurre al financiamiento para lograr el objetivo, el cual comprara más leche para hacer leche agria, helados, variedad de bocadillos. Lo que espera aumentar los niveles de venta como la captación de más cliente, logrando poder cumplir con sus compromisos de pago como las necesidades personales.
texts.en:
Ada is a hardworking woman, the single mother of two children. She has a small business selling buttermilk, ice cream, and sandwiches, which she started in order to cover her expenses now that she's lost her job as a product promoter.
Now she needs to increase the amount of products she sells, so she's looking for a loan in order to meet this goal. She will use it to buy more milk for making buttermilk and ice cream, and a variety of sandwiches. She hopes to increase her sales in order to attract more customers, and so be able to make her loan payments as well as cover her own needs.

loans.use: Purchase milk to make buttermilk and ice cream, as well as more sandwiches, in hopes of increasing her sales

loans.name: Alma Nidia

texts.es:
Alma es una mujer con su propio negocio, la venta de tortillas el cual trabaja desde hace varios años en sus ventas.
Siendo de pocos recursos ha logrado apoyar a su familia, su esposo labora en una cantera.
Al iniciar con la venta de tortilla lo hizo con pocas libras de maíz el cual no contaba con más capital, también, tenía que atraer la clientela.
Luego comienza a palmear los tres tiempos, ya que contaba con más productos siendo Afodenic,  una puerta ah mejorar su inversión lo que aumento sus ventas, como sus ganancias, logrando mejor alimentación para su familia como mantener el equilibrio de su venta de tortilla.
Con este nuevo crédito comprara ochos sacos de maseca de 50 libras, leña y carbón y seguir con la venta de mayor producción de tortillas.
texts.en:
Alma is a mother with her own business, selling tortillas, which she has done for several years.
Even though she has few resources she has been able to support her family. Her husband works in a quarry.
When she started selling tortillas she made them with very little flour, as she did not have enough capital. She also had to attract customers.
Later she started to roll them three times, since she had more products thanks to Afodenic. She has improved her sales and earnings and has been able to better feed her family and keep her sales stable.
With this new loan she will purchase 50 pound bags of maseca corn flour, as well as firewood and coal, and keep selling more tortillas.

loans.use: to purchase quintales [a unit of measurement: 46 kg] of maseca corn flour, firewood and coal for making tortillas

loans.name: Maravilla Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal Maravilla inicia su quinto ciclo con 14 socias. Victoria, tiene 33 años, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos uno de 4 años y el otro de 9 meses. Victoria, antes con su pareja tenia un recreo marisquería, pero se separaron, ella decidió abrir su propio recreo marisquería en su casa y le va bien poco a poco las persona comienzan a visitar su establecimiento, atiende de lunes a domingo los fines de semana son más concurridos. Victoria solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de mesas, mensajería, esteras, etc, para implementar su establecimiento. Ella es socia de Finca desde hace un año, le gusta porque le dieron la oportunidad de otorgarle un crédito cuando lo necesitaba, aprende mucho de las capacitaciones que recibe de su promotora. El sueño de victoria es que su negocio sea reconocido en Ayacucho y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en: The Maravilla Communal Bank has 14 members and is starting its fifth loan cycle.  Victoria is 33 years old.  She is a single mother with a 4 year old and a 9 month old baby.  Prior to their separation, she and her partner owned a seafood restaurant. She decided to open her own seafood restaurant at her home and it’s going well.  Little by little, people are beginning to visit her establishment.  She serves meals Monday through Sunday but the weekends are the most crowded.  Victoria is requesting the loan to pay for tables, courier service, rugs, etc. to equip her establishment. She is pleased to have been a member of Finca for the past year because they provide her with the opportunity to obtain a loan when she needs it.  She learns a lot from the training she receives from her sponsor.  Victoria’s dream is that her business becomes recognized in Ayacucho and to educate her children.

loans.use: To pay for tables, courier service, and rugs

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 65 años, vive en compañía D. su esposo en su casa propia. Hace más D. 21 años que tiene una tienda ubicada en su misma casa, en donD. comercializa productos D. primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, entre otros que son del consumo diario D. la gente. Cada semana se abastece D. mercadería aunque en algunas ocasiones sus proveedores van a su misma tienda para ofrecerle las promociones D. los productos. En todos estos largos años ha visto que este negocio ha resultado estable en las ganancias y afirma que le agrada estar trabajando en su tienda porque le permite estar activa todo el día, es por esa razón que seguirá trabajando por mas años. Es su crédito número 15 con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. más mercadería para su tienda y también en la compra D. sacos D. abono ya que sembrará maíz.
texts.en:
Maria is 65 and lives with her husband in their own home. She has had a store in her home for over 21 years, where she sells basic staples that people consume every day, such as: rice, sugar, pasta and milk, among others. Every week she stocks up on merchandise, and sometimes her suppliers come to her store to offer promotions. In all the time that she has had this business, it has generated a stable income and showed her that she does enjoy working in her store because it allows her to be active all day. For this reason, she will keep working for many more years.
This is her fifteenth loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support, since she has always been responsible with her payments. She is happy to be part of her communal bank, because all of the members are responsible and very united. She thanks those of you who will lend toward this loan, as it will be very useful in the progress of her business. With the loan that she is requesting, she will invest in the purchase of more merchandise for her store, and also in the purchase of bags of fertilizer since she will sow corn.

loans.use: to purchase products to stock her business, and for bags of fertilizer for her corn crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a home

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Luis Enrique L. G., es trabajador de una empresa de acueductos y alcantarillado, desempeñando el cargo de inspector de campo, tiene 1año y medio de trabajar en esta empresa.

Es casado, con 3 personas a su cargo, uno de ellos en edad escolar, vive en la ciudad de Managua en el barrio Adolfo Reyes.

Este es su primer crédito en CEPRODEL lo solicita para compra de materiales de construcción tales como; piedra cantera y bloques.
texts.en:
Luis Enrique L. G. has worked as a site inspector for an aqueduct and sewerage company for the past year and a half.

He is married with three children, one of whom is school aged. He lives in the suburb of Adolfo Reyes in the city of Managua.

This is his first loan with CEPRODEL. He will use it to purchase building materials such as slate and cement blocks.

loans.use: Purchase of building materials

loans.name: Léster Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Léster Antonio S. V. trabaja como Guiriza en una empresa de acueductos y alcantarillados, desde hace 1 año.

Es casado de 39 años de edad, con tres personas a su cargo, vive en la ciudad de Managua en el municipio de Managua desde hace 39 años.

Este es el primer crédito con CEPRODEL lo solicita para consumo y compra de materiales de construcción tales como: bloques y piedra cantera.
texts.en:
Léster Antonio S. V. has worked for an aqueduct and sewerage company for the past year.

He is 39 years of age and married with three children. He has lived in the city of Managua in the Managua municipality all his life. 

This is his first loan with CEPRODEL. He will use it to buy consumer goods and building materials such as cement blocks and slate.

loans.use: To purchase consumer goods and building materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Building and home improvements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Home repairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of building materials and Avon products

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
La señora Hortencia A. esta agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito.
Esta nuevamente solicitando otro préstamo para comprar más mercancía de mercería. Pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para l inversión es por eso que esta recurriendo a solicitar su cooperación en este préstamo. 
 Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para ella y su familia puedan tener una vida mas tranquila.
texts.en:
Hortencia A. is grateful for your help by funding her previous loan.

She is now applying for another loan to purchase more haberdashery merchandise, as she does not have the capital she needs to invest in her business. 

This business is the source of income for herself and her family, which allows them to live more peacefully.

loans.use: Investment in her own business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Manuel Vélez está muy agradecido con todos ustedes por el gran apoyo que recibió en los  préstamos anteriores. Su negocio ha crecido bastante y ha podido darles trabajo a dos personas más.
Está solicitando su colaboración para invertir ahora en la compra y venta de aparatos. Su idea es seguir desarrollándose y con este nuevo propósito de comercialización, no tiene duda que lo logrará.
Corresponde a cada uno de ustedes que le brindarán su apoyo para este nuevo proyecto.
texts.en:
Manuel V. is very grateful to all of you for the support he has received with his previous loans. His business has grown considerably and he has been able to employ two more people. 

He is requesting your help to invest now in the purchase and sale of equipment. His idea is to keep growing and with this new business proposition he has no doubt that he can accomplish that.

Manuel responds to every one of you that will give him support for this new project.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es:
La señora Pastora V. E.  trabaja como Conserje en un Recinto Universitario, desde hace 12 años

Es soltera de 53 años de edad, no tiene  persona que dependa de ella, vive en la ciudad de Managua en el municipio de Managua desde hace 13 años.

Este es el crédito número 8 con CEPRODEL los que ha utilizado en su mayoría para cubrir gastos médicos de sus familiares y otros para su vivienda. Este en particular lo solicita para remodelar su casa ya que hay partes que necesitan cambio.
texts.en:
Pastora V. E. has been working as a janitor at a university campus for 12 years. 

She is single, 53 years old and does not have any dependents. She has been living in the city of Managua in the municipality of Managua for 13 years. 

This is her 8th loan with field partner CEPRODEL. She used the majority of the previous loans to cover medical expenses for family members and also for her home. She is requesting this loan to remodel her home because parts of it need change.

loans.use: Remodel her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 52 años, es separada de su esposo, y vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de sus dos hijos que son mayores. Hace muchos años tenía un bazar, negocio que le ayudaba en el sustento de su familia, pero los problemas conyugales que tenía tuvo que hacerse cargo de la educación superior de sus hijos; por tal razón su negocio no pudo auto sostenerse que fracaso. Hoy trabaja en casa ajena, realizando labores domesticas durante el día, sin embargo no le daba abasto así que emprendió un negocio adicional, que es la venta de productos de belleza. Desde entonces aprovecha la oportunidad de vender a sus amistades  y familias los cosméticos que más demanda tienen. Con estas ganancias viene afrontando y cubriendo la educación de sus hijos además de comprar los medicamentos para su madre anciana. En adelante piensa dejar de trabajar como doméstica para retomar e reabrir su bazar,  de esa manera logrará estabilizar su economía.  Es el 11avo crédito con MFP, y se compromete pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea contar con posteriores ayudas para re iniciar su negocio anterior. De obtener el crédito solicitado, podrá cubrir los gastos de operación de su madre.
texts.en:
52 year-old María is separated from her husband and lives in her own home with her two grown-up children.  María owned a store for many years and her business helped her to support her family but, owing to her marriage problems, she had to take sole responsibility for her children's higher education expenses.  For this reason, her business could not sustain itself and failed.

Currently, María works in other peoples' homes, carrying out domestic tasks during the day.  However, as this is not enough to support her family, she has taken on an additional business, selling beauty products.  María has taken the opportunity to sell her most popular cosmetics to her friends and family members.  She uses the profits from this business to cover the expenses of her children's education and to buy medication for her elderly mother.

In the future, María plans to stop working as a domestic employee and to re-open her store.  In this way, she hopes to stabilize her finances.

This is María's 11th loan with MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time since she would like to have access to loans in the future, to help her to re-start her previous business.  María will use this loan to cover the expenses of an operation for her mother.

loans.use: To cover her mother's operation expenses

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol, D. 38 años, vive en casa D. sus suegros junto a su esposo, Pedro. Ambos tienen dos hijos adolescentes, quienes aún estudian. Hace más D. 4 años está trabajadora madre D. familia, se dedica a L. venta D. gas, actividad que lo realiza en su mismo domicilio. DesD. entonces se dedica en L. distribución D. los balones D. gas al domicilio D. sus clientes, quienes requieren del servicio. Por otro lado, trabaja en L. municipalidad D. su distrito D. esa manera se asegura un ingreso extra. Es así que sus hijos L. apoyan, cuando las veces que trabaja en L. municipalidad, ellos se dedican D. hacer el pedido D. gas, D. esa manera  buscan mejorar su calidad D. vida. ElL. está muy contenta con su nuevo trabajo, pero a L. vez todas las tardes no descuida D. su negocio; Como es una mujer emprendedora en adelante anheL. ampliar su negocio y sobre todo comprarse una moto lineal para distribuir gas con mayor rapidez. Es el 11avo crédito con MFP, y se compromete a ser responsable con el pago D. sus cuotas, pues como es líder D. su banco comunal, debe ser ejemplo, asimismo podrá acceder a otros créditos fácilmente. D. obtener el crédito que solicita, podrá incrementar más balones D. gas, para así auto sostener su negocio.
texts.en: Marisol is 38 years old and lives in her in-laws' home with her husband Pedro. They have teen-aged children who are in school. For more than four years this hardworking family has been selling gas which they sell out of their home. Since then, they have engaged in the distribution of gas tanks to the homes of customers who require service. She also works in the municipality of her district which ensures that she will have extra income. When she is working for the municipality her children help with the gas orders thus they are searching for a better quality of life. She is very happy with her new job but at the same time she does not neglect her business in the evenings. Because she is an enterprising woman she hopes to expand her business in the future and above all to buy a motorbike so that she can more quickly distribute gas. This is her 11th loan with field partner MFP and she promises to be responsible with her payments because she is the leader of her community bank she has to set an example and so she can access other loans. With the loan she is requesting she will be able to increase her gas tanks so that her business can be self-sustaining.

loans.use: Purchase more gas tanks.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica, de 41 años, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía de su esposo y su hijo. Ella es profesora de nivel primario, en un colegio particular, asimismo le gusta el negocio. Es así que hace más de 7 años vende calzados, actividad que hasta el momento le ha ido muy bien. Actualmente visita a sus amistades y familias a ofrecer lo nuevos modelos en zapatos, puesto que son adquiridos en provincias por lo que tiene que viajas cada fin de mes. Se siente muy satisfecha con el negocio que posee, ya que le es rentable, además que la mercadería lo vende a crédito, así mantiene a sus clientes y largo plazo recupera lo invertido. Sin embargo le molesta tener que presionar a sus clientes para que terminen de pagar pasada la fecha establecida de pago. Para el futuro tiene planeado comprar un terreno y poder construir habitaciones, ya que ve el negocio de la renta de espacios es mucha más rentable. Es el 12avo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente pues quiere acceder a posteriores ayudas para continuar progresando. De obtener el crédito que solicita, comprará zapatos para la temporada escolar que se avecina.
texts.en: Monica is 41 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and her son. She is a primary school teacher at a public school. She has been selling shoes for more than seven years, a business that has so far gone very well. She currently visits her friends and families to offer new shoe models. She acquires the shoes in the provinces and has to travel there at the end of every month. She is very pleased with her business because it is profitable and because her merchandise is sold on credit and she is able to keep her customers and in the long run she recovers her investment. However, she does not like having to press her clients to finish paying after the date established for the payment. In the future, she plans to buy land to be able to build rooms because she sees that the business of renting rooms is very profitable. This is her 12th loan with field partner MFP and she promises to pay her dues on time because she wants to have access to future loans in order to further progress. With the loan she is requesting she will purchase shoes for the school season ahead.

loans.use: Purchase shoes for the school season.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemí tiene 35 años, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía de su esposo y sus 2 hijos pequeños que estudian en el colegio. Noemí se dedica a coser blusas, camisas, faldas, pantalones y buzos,  es decir su especialidad es confeccionar uniformes y prendas deportivas para el colegio, mercadería que es ofrecida a sus amistades y profesores de los centros educativos que se encuentran cerca de su casa. De esta manera viene trabajando hace 6 años en esta labor, con la ayuda de su cuñada y hasta la de su esposo. Le gusta mucho la actividad que realiza, además lo haced desde la comodidad de su casa. Por ahora su meta es construir el segundo nivel de su casa, para que pueda acondicionar su taller de costura con más implementos.  Es el 11avo crédito con MFP, es una socia responsable y siempre preocupada por el bienestar del grupo comunal. De obtener el crédito que solicita, comprará tela en diversos diseños y modelos para elaborar más blusas, pantalones y faldas, ya que pronto se acerca la temporada escolar.
texts.en: Noemi is 35 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and her two small children who are in school. Noemi makes blouses, shirts, skirts, pants and sweatshirts. Her specialty is making uniforms and sportswear for schools. She offers her merchandise to her friends and to teachers at schools near her home. She has been working this way for six years with the help of her sister-in-law and sometimes her husband. She likes her job and likes that she can do it from the comfort of her home. Currently her goal is to add a second level to her home so that she can set up her sewing workshop with more machines. This is the 11th loan that she has obtained from field partner MFP. She is a responsible member and she always worries about the welfare of the community group. With the loan she is requesting she will buy fabric in different designs so that she can make more blouses, pants and skirts since the school season is approaching.

loans.use: Purchase different types of fabric.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, D. 30 años, vive en casa D. sus suegros, en compañía D. su esposo y sus dos hijos Brayan y Adriana. El negocio al que se dedica es la venta D. productos D. limpieza, que inicialmente era D. su padre, quien al fallecer ella tuvo que hacerse cargo del negocio. Actualmente su hermana Yolanda es quien esta al frente D. la venta D. estos productos, pues ella acaba D. dar a luz a su hija Adriana, solo espera el tiempo necesario para retomar el trabajo, aunque no deja D. continuar invirtiendo en la compra D. más mercadería. Le gusta lo que hace, ya que desD. muy pequeña apoyaba a su padre en las ventas, y considera que es un trabajo muy rentable,  además algunos productos D. limpieza como el jabón, detergentes, escoba, escobillas;  no tiene fecha D. vencimiento, por lo que no se aflige D. su rápida venta.  Lo que más desea Rosa es ampliar su negocio con diversa mercadería. Es el onceavo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que valora el beneficio D. este negocio en su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita desea incrementar con productos novedosos en limpieza para así tener que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en: Rosa, who is 30 years old, lives in her in-laws' home with her husband and two children, Brayan and Adriana. She makes her living with a business selling cleaning products.  The business was initially her father's, but when he passed away, Rosa had to take it take over.  Because Rosa just gave birth to her daughter Adriana, her sister, Yolanda, is currently in charge of selling their products.  Rosa is only taking the necessary leave before she takes up the business again.  Even so, she hasn't stopped investing in the purchase of more merchandise.  She likes what she does, especially since she helped her father with the sales even as young girl.  She considers the work to be very profitable.  In addition, some of the cleaning products, like soap, detergents, brooms and brushes, don't have expiration dates, so she doesn't need to worry about selling them quickly.  What Rosa wants most is to expand her business with varied merchandise.  This is her eleventh loan with MFP, and she promises to make all her payments on time.  She values the benefit of MFP in her business.  With the loan she is requesting, she hopes to increase her merchandise with novel cleaning products to offer to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase novel cleaning products.

loans.name: Agueda

texts.es:
La señora Agueda M. C. es habitante de la comunidad de Acatlan de Perez Figueroa en el estado de Oaxaca, ella tiene la edad de 39 años, solo estudio hasta el sexto grado de primaria y esta casada con el señor Martín Luis Crespo C. con el cual tiene tres hijas las cuales se llaman Cintia de 19 años de edad que  asiste los fines de semana(sábado) a la escuela normal de la Zona Urbana a 15 minutos de su comunidad en donde estudia Licenciatura en pedagogía, Yarely de 16 años que asiste al bachillerato y la mas pequeña Karen que asiste a la secundaria de su comunidad.

Doña Agueda desde hace mas de tres años inicio con su negocio de venta de zapatos por catalogo ella vende casa por casa lleva sus catálogos a sus clientes para que vean sus productos, levanta pedidos, los encarga con su proveedor y posteriormente lo entrega a sus clientes, ella nos dice que decidió iniciar su propio negocio ya que quería ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus hijas. Ella necesita este préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de Zapatos y catálogos, también nos comenta que ella espera seguir trabajando muy duro ya que en un futuro  quiere tener un pequeño local en el centro de su comunidad para poner una zapateria.

Doña Agueda se encuentra agradecida con la Fundación por la confianza que le esta brindando al otorgarle este préstamo y la oportunidad de que su negocio prospere.
texts.en:
Agueda M. C. lives in the community of Acatlan de Perez Figueroa in the state of Oaxaca. She is 39 years old, has only studied through sixth grade, and is married to Martín Lusi Crespo C.. Together they have three daughters. Cinta is 19 years old and goes to school on the weekends (Saturday) in a city 15 minutes from their community where she is studying to get her teaching license. Yarely is 16 years old and is working towards her bachelor's degree. The youngest, Karen, goes to high school in the community. 

More than three years ago Agueda began her business selling shoes from a catalog. She sells house to house and brings her catalogs to her clients so they can see her products and look at orders. She places orders with her supplier and the brings them to her clients. She tells us that she decided to start this business because she wanted to help her husband pay for the household expenses and her daughters' education. She needs this loan to invest in buying shoes and catalogs. She also tells us that she wants to continue working very hard since in the future she wants to have a small location in the center of the community to put her shoe store. 

Agueda is very thankful to the Foundation for the confidence it has in her by offering this loan and the opportunity for her business to prosper.

loans.use: To buy and sell shoes from a catalog.

loans.name: Miguel's Group

texts.en: To make a living, Miguel R. raises pigs for breeding. He is 41 years old, married and has five school-aged children. They are from the village of Little Tadian. Miguel has been in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Miguel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Miguel is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be his first loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. Miguel is the leader of a seven member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members, if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Miguel R. Group". About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Beatriz's Group

texts.en:
Beatriz A.'s main source of income comes from raising pigs. She is 50 years old, married and has three grown-up children. She is from the village of Caraniogan. Beatriz has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2007, Beatriz joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Beatriz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase livestock to raise. Beatriz is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 7th loan from ASKI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. 

Beatriz is the leader of a four member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Beatriz A.'s Group".

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Daisy's Group

texts.en:
Daisy R. is from the village of Caraniogan. She is 44 years old. Daisy is the group leader of a six member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Daisy R.'s Group.

Daisy is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Daisy owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Daisy has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Daisy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daisy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Daisy is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Daisy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

texts.en:

While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Glory V. Group.

Glory has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

Glory has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Glory is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Glory from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About ASKI:

loans.name: Florentina's Group

texts.en: Florentina C.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She is 40 years old, married and has three school-aged children. They are from the village of Macatal. Florentina has been in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Florentina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Florentina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Florentina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young plants to raise. This will be her third loan from ASKI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. Florentina is the leader of an eight member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Florentina C.'s Group". About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea N. has been in farming business for over ten years. She is 32 years old and a resident of Kompong Cham Province. She has three children:  all of them are single, and they are still living with her. Her husband is a casual construction worker and earns a profit of around US $2.50 a day. In addition to the farming business, Chea N. raise a few pigs behind her house for extra-profit. Because the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for Chea N. and her family, she would like to request a loan to buy additional feed and small pigs to feed for selling.

loans.use: To buy additional feed and small pigs to feed for selling.

loans.name: Larryn Gramber

texts.es:
Larryn tiene 37 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a sus padres en el caserío La compuerta, una zona agrícola que pertenece al distrito de Oyotún, una zona de territorio accidentado que se encuentra situada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura, por un lado posee un terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar diversos granos y cereales, asimismo cuenta con un grupo de animales menores los cuales cría en su vivienda alimentándoles de granos y pastos naturales, cuando estos se han desarrollado completamente los vende a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside.

Larryn ha sembrado actualmente un cultivo de maíz en su parcela, el desea aplicarle pesticidas y abonos para poder brindarle mantenimiento y lograr asegurarse una buena cosecha. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Larryn is 37 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the hamlet of La Compuerta, an agricultural zone that belongs to the district of Oyotún.  It is an area with uneven, hilly land, located two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

His work is all related to agriculture.  On the one hand, he has a plot of farmland where he plants various grains and cereals.  He also has a group of young animals that he raises in his home, feeding them natural grains and grasses.  When they have fully developed he sells them to traders who pass through the zone where he lives.

Larryn has recently planted corn on his land and he would like to apply pesticides and fertilizers in order to care for his fields and to ensure that he has a good harvest.  In order to do this, he decided to request a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Aita

texts.es:
Aita es una madre D. familia D. 58 años D. edad y resiD. junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el caserío La Compuerta, una zona agrícola que pertenece al distrito D. Oyotún, una zona D. territorio accidentado que se encuentra situada a dos horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura junto a su esposo, juntos poseen un terreno D. cultivo en donD. suelen sembrar granos y cereales, asimismo ella cuenta con un grupo D. animales menores los cuales cría en algunos corrales D. su vivienda alimentándoles D. granos y pastos naturales, cuando estos se han desarrollado completamente los venD. a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donD. resiD..

Aita desea adquirir pesticidas y abonos para poder brindarle mantenimiento al cultivo D. maíz que tiene instalado actualmente, D. ese modo esperan asegurarse una buena cosecha. Asimismo desea adquirir alimento balanceado para sus animales. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1800 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Aita is a 58 year-old mother who lives with her husband and children in the hamlet of La Compuerta, an agricultural zone in the district of Oyotún. It is an area with uneven, hilly land, located two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

She and her husband both work in agriculture. They own a plot of farmland together, where they plant grains and cereals. Aita also has a group of young animals that she raises in pens at her house. She feeds them natural grains and grasses, and once they have fully developed, she sells them to merchants who pass through the zone where they live.

Aita would like to buy pesticides and fertilizers to care for the corn fields that they currently have planted. She hopes this will ensure a good harvest.  She would also like to acquire a balanced diet for her animals.  In order to achieve her goals, she decided to request a loan of 1,800 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her corn fields

loans.name: Erlinda's Group

texts.en: Erlinda D.'s main source of income comes from tending a canteen near a school. She is 30 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of Banquero. Erlinda has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2006, Erlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 9th loan from ASKI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. Erlinda is the leader of a five member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Erlinda D.'s Group". About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Roth

texts.en: Roth N. is a 48-year-old widowed woman who is a local farmer. She lives with her five children, three of whom are single and two of whom are married. She always weaves baskets for additional income besides that which she receives from farming. Roth N. is good at making bamboo baskets for the market. She and her children sometimes go through the village looking for bamboo, which they take home and soak in water for almost a week. After that, they dry it in the sunshine for three days. They split the bamboo into smaller pieces, and after that she and her children start making it into baskets. Recently, Roth N. has not been comfortable, because her house often needs to be repaired. She would like a loan to repair her old house.

loans.use: To repair her old house.

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es:
Jhonny tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su familia en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito de Monsefú, una zona agrícola y comercial que se encuentra situada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El cuenta con una pequeña panadería instalada en su domicilio, allí el prepara su masa y la hornea muy temprano por la mañana. Los panes que produce los suele ofrecer en venta a sus vecinos y también los distribuye en los principales establecimientos de la zona en donde reside. Los ingresos que obtiene de esta actividad los utiliza para solventar sus gastos y ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.

Debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando en esta actividad y a la calidad con la que prepara sus productos, su demanda ha empezado a aumentar considerablemente. Para lograr satisfacerla y aumentar sus ventas, Jhonny ha decidido solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que le ayuden con el logro de su objetivo.
texts.en:
Jhonny is 26 years old, single, and lives with his family in one of the hamlets that comprises the district of Monsefú. It is an agricultural and commercial zone located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He has a small bakery set up in his house, where he prepares his dough and does his baking very early in the morning. He offers the bread he makes to his neighbors and also distributes to the main establishments in the area where he lives. He uses the income he earns from this work to cover his expenses and to help his family get ahead.

Thanks to the length of time he has been baking and the quality of his products, his demand has started to grow considerably. In order to achieve his goals of satisfying the demand and increasing his sales, Jhonny has decided to request a loan of 1,200 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for his bread bakery

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch S. has been spending her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learned from her grandparents since 1979. She is now married and has eight kids, five of whom are single and three are married. Two of her children are working in different jobs, and they have a fixed salary every month. Her husband often works in the farm fields alongside her. Growing crops is an annual process with which she has had great success. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. Presently, Touch S. would like a loan in order to purchase a piece of land in good condition for a farming business. This loan will provide her with additional new assets.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land in good condition for a farming business.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila tiene 54 años D. edad, es casada, y resiD. junto a su esposo, hijos y una nieta en el distrito D. TambogranD., un distrito D. la provincia D. Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, caracterizado por que sus pobladores se dedican principalmente al cultivo D. frutas.

Se dedica a la venta D. productos naturales, a base D. plantas y vegetales en su propio domicilio. Ella por el conocimiento que posee sobre las bondades D. los productos D. la naturaleza tiene bastante clientela a quien orienta para la majora D. su salud. El negocio le permite ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento D. su economía diaria.  Asimismo su esposo se dedica a la venta D. productos D. abarrotes en un puesto en el mercado D. su localidad.

Lucila siempre se esfuerza para poder sacar adelante su negocio. Actualmente ella desea comprar más plantas y vegetales para realizar mayor cantidad D. preparados medicinales. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Lucila is 54 years old, married and lives with her spouse, children and granddaughter in the TambogranD. district, in the province and region of Piura. A region characterized by its inhabitants who mainly dedicate themselves to the cultivation of fruit.

From her home she sells natural products that are plant and vegetable based. Because of the knowledge that she possesses about the benefits of her natural products, she has a wiD. customer base who she can help to improve their health. The business allows her to help her family sustain their daily needs. Her husband sells groceries from a stall in a city market.

Lucila always strives to be able to keep her business going forward. These days she wishes to buy more plants and vegetables to have a larger quantity of herbal remedies. Because of this, she thinks it's advisable to request a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: The purchase of inputs to make herbal remedies.

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
The woman in the photograph is Son S., age 31, who lives in the province of Kompong Thom, which is the best territory for farming. Son S. is married and devoted to her one child, who depends on her care. Her husband earns an income by driving a horse cart around his community. 

Son S. grows various crops on her farmland, which she acquired from her grandmother many years ago. She does well in the farming business almost every year. Son S. would like to request a loan from Kiva to buy a plot of her neighbor’s farmland near her house, which is a good location for farming, and to add to her personal savings. She will use this land for farming.

loans.use: To buy a plot of her neighbor’s land for farming

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José tiene 49 años de edad, es soltero, y reside en el distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito de la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, caracterizado por que sus pobladores se dedican principalmente al cultivo de frutas.

Se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura desde que era joven, y con mucho esfuerzo pudo comprarse una hectárea y media de terreno. En su terreno de cultivo suele sembrar limón. Cuando llega el tiempo de cosecha las comercializa con las plantas procesadoras de la zona. El negocio le permite ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento de su economía diaria.

José siempre se esfuerza para poder sacar adelante su negocio. Actualmente desea aplicar a su terreno diversos fertilizantes para lograr que las frutas que coseche a futuro se desarrollen de mejor modo. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
José is 49-years-old. He's single and lives in the Tambogrande district of the province of Piura, in the region of the same name. This area is characterized by fruit cultivation. 

José has worked in agriculture since he was young, and with a lot of hard work he was able to buy a hectare and a half of land. He usually plants lemons on his land. At harvest time he sells them with the plant processors in the area. The business allows him to help sustain his family on a day-to-day basis.

José always pushes himself to get his business ahead. Currently he wishes to use various fertilizers on his land in order to yield a better crop. For this he believed it necessary to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1500 nuevos soles ($550 USD) to help him achieve his goal.

loans.use: Purchase of various fertilizers

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 52 años de edad, es casada, y tiene seis hijos, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito de la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, caracterizado por que sus pobladores se dedican principalmente al cultivo de frutas.

Se dedica a la crianza de ganado caprino y aves de corral, en los lugares alrededor de su casa.  Ella los engorda hasta que alcancen un nivel de desarrollo adecuado para venderlos posteriormente. El negocio le permite ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento de su economía diaria.

Teresa siempre se esfuerza para poder sacar adelante a su familia. Actualmente ella desea comprar mayor cantidad de alimento balanceado para sus animales. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Teresa is 52-years-old. She's married and has six children. She lives with her husband in the Tambogrande district in the province of Piura in the region of the same name. This area is characterized by fruit cultivation. 

Teresa raises goats and poultry in the area surrounding her house. She feeds and raises them until they're ready to be sold. This business allows her to help support her family in the daily expenses.

Teresa always pushes herself to get her family ahead. Currently she wants to buy a large quantity of balanced feed for her animals. For this purpose she has requested a loan of 1500 nuevos soles ($375 USD) to help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: Purchase of balanced feed for her animals

loans.name: Sor

texts.en:
Sor M., age 57, is married to Yen, age 58.  They have three children, all of whom are employed as garment workers. She and her husband have been earning a living for many years by cultivating rice crops. They have had experience in this sector since 1985. This family usually generates an income of approximately $5 each day to use for all the family expenses. 

Sor M. says that her savings account is currently not sufficient to assist her daughter to have her wedding, which coming soon. To deal with this situation, Sor M. is seeking a loan to help her daughter hold her wedding ceremony.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's wedding ceremony

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Yolanda Maribel

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 27 años de edad, es conviviente, y tiene tres hijos, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito de la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, caracterizado por que sus pobladores se dedican principalmente al cultivo de frutas.

Yolanda se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, ella cuenta con un grupo de clientes que le compran sus productos con frecuencia, mientras más pedidos le realizan obtiene mas puntos de parte de la empresa que le provee los productos y por consiguiente obtiene mayores ganancias. Por este motivo siempre se esfuerza por obtener cada vez más clientes.

Adicionalmente trabaja vendiendo aves de corral, con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades apoya a su familia, con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. Ella trabaja incansablemente por mantenerse en estas actividades.

Yolanda desea implementar su stock de productos de belleza para poder satisfacer la demanda con la que actualmente cuenta, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 27 years old.  She lives with her partner and three children in Tambogrande district, in Piura province, in the region of the same name.  This area is noted for the fact that its inhabitants are mainly fruit growers.

Yolanda's business is selling beauty products through a catalog.  She has a group of customers who buy her products frequently.  The more orders her customers make, the more points she earns from the company that provides the products and, hence, the more profits she makes.  For this reason, she is always working hard to attract more customers.  Yolanda also works selling poultry.  She uses the income she makes from these business activities to support her family financially.

Yolanda works untiringly to keep going in her businesses.  She would like to add to her stock of beauty products so that she can meet the demand she currently has.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To increase her stock of beauty products

loans.name: Imelda's Group

texts.en:
Imelda C. is from the village of Victoria. She is 42 years old. Imelda is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Imelda C.'s Group.

Imelda is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Imelda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Imelda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Imelda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Nilsa Nidia

texts.es:
Nilsa tiene 45 años de edad, es casada, y tiene dos hijos, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Tambogrande, un distrito de la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, caracterizado por que sus pobladores se dedican principalmente al cultivo de frutas.

Yolanda se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, ella cuenta con un grupo de clientes que le compran sus productos con frecuencia, mientras más pedidos le realizan obtiene mas puntos de parte de la empresa que le provee los productos y por consiguiente obtiene mayores ganancias. Por este motivo siempre se esfuerza por obtener cada vez más clientes.

Nilsa desea implementar su stock de productos de belleza para poder satisfacer la demanda con la que actualmente cuenta, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Nilsa is 45 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives together with her family in Tambogrande district, in Piura province, in the region of the same name.  The area is noted for the fact that its inhabitants are mainly fruit growers.

Nilsa's business is selling beauty products through a catalog.  She has a group of customers who buy her products frequently.  The more orders her customers make, the more points she earns with the company that provides her products and, hence, the more profits she makes.  For this reason, she is always working hard to attract more customers.

Nilsa would like to add to her stock of beauty products in order to meet the demand that she currently has.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 700 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To increase her stock of beauty products

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio C. is from the village of Quiling. He is 48 years old. Virgilio is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Virgilio owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Virgilio has been engaged in his business for over 28 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Virgilio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virgilio is requesting a new loan of 24000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Virgilio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Fredie

The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Fredie has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Fredie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fredie is requesting a new loan of 24,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the first loan taken out by Fredie from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his child. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. Jeonel L. is from the village of Quiling. He is 38 years old. Jeonel is married and has two school-aged children.

Jeonel owns and operates a business raising crops, with the main source of income coming primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over 23 years and earns approximately 7000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo G. is from the village of Mangga. He is 23 years old and single. Alfredo owns and operates a business raising crops, with his main source of income coming primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Alfredo has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 6000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2010, Alfredo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Alfredo from ASKI. Alfredo is requesting a new loan of 18000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Inocencia R. is from the village of Mangga. She is 45 years old. Inocencia is married and has three school-aged children.

Inocencia owns and operates a business growing crops, with the main source of income coming primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 7000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

Marcelo G. is from the village of Mangga. He is 42 years old. Marcelo is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marcelo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Marcelo has been engaged in his business for over 25 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie C. is from the village of Mangga. He is 28 years old. Jessie is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Jessie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia lives in Jaranwala which is a small city of Punjab Pakistan which is famous for its agriculture industry. She lives there in a 2 room brick house with her family. 

She is married to M. M. who is 43 years old and is a daily wage labor. 

Razia has given birth to 2 sons and 4 daughters. She couldn’t provide them education facilities due to poor financial conditions. Her eldest son operates a donkey cart and offers loading services to his clients. He contributes the family financially through the earning. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who also wants to buy a donkey cart and start loading business because his profession doesn’t return with good income and in result his family suffers from financial aspect.  

Razia is hopeful that through the loan investment her husband will be able to approach many clients and makes better profits from his new business. 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan year, she has established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Razia”.

loans.use: To buy a donkey cart for starting a loading business

loans.name: Maqsoodan's Group

texts.en:
Maqsoodan lives in the city of Jaranwala, located in Punjab, Pakistan which is famous for its agricultural industry.  She is the mother of 4 sons and a daughter, and all of them are young and getting their education.  The family has lived in Jaranwala for 20 years. 

Her husband works in a private organization and she supports him by sewing clothes for her neighboring clients. Maqsoodan is skilled in her work and receives regular orders from her community members. She has been in this profession for four years and she has never received any complaints from her customers.  

Maqsoodan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her sewing business. With the loan she will buy a new sewing machine.  The old machine doesn’t produce a completed dress in a timely manner, and the new machine will help her work more efficiently and make better profits.  She is a regular borrower of Asasah and this is her second loan application. With the previous loan she established good credit behavior and never missed any meetings. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Maqsoodan”.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra lives in a small city called Jaranwala, which is located in Punjab, Pakistan, and is known for its agriculture industry.  She is a 49-year-old active lady. She spends her time at home taking care of her household responsibilities. 

She is married to S. A. who makes and sells leather purses. He has contracts with different purse sellers and he provides them with the finished products to earn income for the family. He has a great talent which is admired by many of his clients and became the reason for getting more orders on a regular basis. Azra, besides her household work, also helps him in preparing the purses and in completing the orders on time. 

She has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy leather, zippers, etc. in larger quantities, which will help him to complete his orders on time and increase his clientele base. Azra is very hopeful that by investing money in her husband’s business, he will successfully continue to get good results from his business.
  
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Azra.

loans.use: To buy leather and zips for leather purses making business
